title: The Silence of the Lambs
summary: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.
josh_notes: Very chilling vibe right from the first scene when she's running through the misty woods. Jodie Foster and Anthony Hopkins are both so good. She makes a great heroine. Thought it was clever the way the camera was always focussed on people's eyes whether it was his creepy eyes or men ogling her or her looking all tough. All round top stuff.

title: Friends with Money
summary: After she quits her lucrative job, Olivia finds herself unsure about her future and her relationships with her successful and wealthy friends.
josh_notes: I thought it was great - paints a very realistic/varied portrait of what it might be like to be that age. Covers a lot of ground - money/careers/relationships/mortality in a subtle way and has a great cast. Ended a little too quickly but better than it going on too long. Ty Burrell and Simon McBurney's relationship was really funny too. I think everyone could find a character (or two) that they relate to which was good. I think I related to Jennifer Aniston haha.

title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
summary: With Spider-Man's identity now revealed, Peter asks Doctor Strange for help. When a spell goes wrong, dangerous foes from other worlds start to appear, forcing Peter to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.
josh_notes: Mostly pretty enjoyable - I think Spiderman is probs one of the best of the genre because it doesn't take itself too seriously. Superheroes are ultimately silly and I feel like Spiderman films are usually aware of that. Lots of plotholes because it's multiverse stuff but that didn't matter too much (why doesn't Dr S just fix everything/Tom Holland is at fault for all this dumb stuff when he could have just reapplied for uni or whatever/why were there not more spidermen from other universes?). They did the bit with the other spidermen really well I thought - Tobey Maguire was funny & good. Don't get why marvel films are all lit so weirdly though, at nearly no point do any of the characters look like they're where they're supposed to be.

title: The Gentlemen
summary: An American expat tries to sell off his highly profitable marijuana empire in London, triggering plots, schemes, bribery and blackmail in an attempt to steal his domain out from under him.
josh_notes: Hugh Grant and Colin Farrell were especially good - Colin Farrell should do more funny roles. Entertaining and I enjoyed the script but it didn't have the same style as Snatch for example. It never really felt like it was really the criminal underworld you know? Still worth a watch though.

title: Licorice Pizza
summary: The story of Alana Kane and Gary Valentine growing up, running around and going through the treacherous navigation of first love in the San Fernando Valley, 1973.
josh_notes: All round great fun movie - a fun world to be a part of for a couple of hours & it's really good on first love/wrong attraction/whatever. Both the leads are great, mad that they've never acted before because they have a lot to do here. Bradley Cooper is the best of some pretty good side characters. Lot's of running scenes, maybe the motorbike one being the best. Looking forward to seeing it again.

title: The 400 Blows
summary: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.
josh_notes: Not as groundbreaking as I thought it would be maybe, but the kid was aamazing and  it did look great. I liked the ambiguity of it, never signalling to the audience what they should think about any of it. Quite sad in some ways but plenty of humour in it too. I'd like to see it again/see the sequels though.

title: Moonrise Kingdom
summary: A pair of young lovers flee their New England town, which causes a local search party to fan out to find them.
josh_notes: Probably in the top half of Anderson movies for me. A simpler story than some but very sweet without quite as much style as The French Dispatch (but he really loves yellow). Similar themes to Licorice Pizza in a way - young love and naivety. I think his quirkiness really suits a scout camp - in my experience the film is full of the sort of weird dramas that fill a week away from your parents at that age and make it feel like an incredibly significant week, until the next one. Bruce Willis is good too, he should do more stuff like this.

title: The Hunt
summary: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent li...
josh_notes: Incredibly hard to watch in places, in some ways you could argue it's a horror film. The premise is great but the script really makes it something better - every point in the story makes you wince and it really feels like it could all happen and there's nothing you could do about it. Great ambiguous ending too - at first I thought perhaps he had imagined it and he was having flashbacks to being hunted again, but it could also be Karla's older brother shooting at him I suppose. Mads obviously great.

title: Jackass 3D
summary: Johnny Knoxville and company return for the third installment of their TV show spin-off, where dangerous stunts and explicit public displays rule.
josh_notes: Not as funny as the first one to be honest although there are some of the grossest pranks they do - the sweatsuit cocktail is disgusting and so is the poo volcano thing. Grim haha. Still good though, laughter is contagious.

title: A Man Called Ove
summary: Ove, an ill-tempered, isolated retiree who spends his days enforcing block association rules and visiting his wife's grave, has finally given up on life just as an unlikely friendship develops with his boisterous new neighbors.
josh_notes: A fairly familiar story of grumpy old man turned nice, similar to Up or Gran Torino etc but with a bit more Scandinavian darkness what with the suicide attempts and a few other differences/themes. The main guy was very convincingly grumpy and it was all done very well and the flashback structure worked well. Did make me cry a little bit when he starts to enjoy his life after Sonja. Her makeup on the train at the end was a bit weird though for some reason haha.

title: High Fidelity
summary: Rob, a record store owner and compulsive list maker, recounts his top five breakups, including the one in progress.
josh_notes: Didn't really see what people like about it (other than Jack Black), I think Rob is just too unlikable to root for, even if he does learn a bit by the end. Pretty devoid of any romantic central relationship either which didn't help all that much. Also personally I rarely like stuff when they talk at the camera. The music was good but I couldn't understand all the references (although that isn't really a criticism).

title: In the Mood for Love
summary: Two neighbors form a strong bond after both suspect extramarital activities of their spouses. However, they agree to keep their bond platonic so as not to commit similar wrongs.
josh_notes: An incredible looking film. Every shot was crafted so carefully and it's all so warm and colourful. Also brillianty edited - there's so many short shots that end up really making the film but must have taken a very clever person to pull off. It shows the passing of time very effectively as well as the brutality of that. Very similar themes to Chungking Express - longing, loneliness, memory, missed opportunities. Would very much like to see it again. Also the 4K looked really great. Cinema I suppose.

title: Anastasia
summary: The last surviving child of the Russian Royal Family joins two con men to reunite with her grandmother, the Dowager Empress, while the undead Rasputin seeks her death.
josh_notes: A bit different to other Disney Princess films I guess. I didn't think a whole lot of (most of) the music but Rasputin was good and pretty scary plus the story was alright. Animation was cool including some weird attempts at 3D tech which must have just been invented or something.

title: La haine
summary: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.
josh_notes: Intense, in your face, smart, funny, brilliant. Looks amazing throughout with some really cool shots (Flying one, shot alongside the cars when they're trying to steal one, massive dolly zoom, when they're peeing in the bathroom and with the mirror). Mad ending as well, was good to watch with an audience because it's quite sudden and then silence and you could feel the quiet in the cinema.

title: Licorice Pizza
summary: The story of Alana Kane and Gary Valentine growing up, running around and going through the treacherous navigation of first love in the San Fernando Valley, 1973.
josh_notes: Didn't change all that much seeing it on 35mm (took my eyes a while to get used to the flickering in the brighter spots even) but it did suit watching in the PCC. The scenes reversing the truck, in the casting room, on the golf course and on the waterbed with the light shining from underneath are all so great. It also remains mad that both the stars are first time actors - Cooper Hoffman is amazing at running, and Alana Haim is very good with her face (and has a good face)

title: Look Both Ways
summary: On the eve of her college graduation, Natalie's life diverges into parallel realities: one in which she becomes pregnant and remains in her hometown to raise her child and another in which she moves to LA to pursue her dream career.
josh_notes: It's a well woven story of lots of characters dealing with death (or at least their own morbidity) and I liked the central relationship - it seemed pretty real and sort of sweet. But the whole thing did have a very early 2000s TV movie vibe which it could never quite shake. Good soundtrack and clever animation although maybe overused. Strangely enough the director (married to the main guy) was diagnosed with cancer in post production.

title: Aliens
summary: Decades after surviving the Nostromo incident, Ellen Ripley is sent out to re-establish contact with a terraforming colony but finds herself battling the Alien Queen and her offspring.
josh_notes: Not as tense as the first one (just) but way more action. Final fight scene in the loader suit is great, and the xenomorphs all look gross and terrifying. Lighting and set design are both amazing too.  Less character development than the first one but Ripley is great at least. The last hour or so is is especially intense.

title: Sweet and Lowdown
summary: In the 1930s, jazz guitarist Emmet Ray idolizes Django Reinhardt, faces gangsters and falls in love with a mute woman.
josh_notes: Interesting way of telling the story - I only just realised writing this that Emmet Ray wasn't a real person. Seemed like a documentary/feature but I guess it was actually a mockumentary in a way. Sean Penn is great playing a role I've not really seen him in before, he manages to come off as both extremely self confident and uncomfortably insecure at the same time. Music was nice too. I liked the running Django Reinhardt character.

title: The Summit of the Gods
summary: A photojournalist's obsessive quest for the truth about the first expedition to Mt. Everest leads him to search for an esteemed climber who went missing.
josh_notes: Liked the plot, amazing animation, especially for something that must be increcibly hard to look good animated. French added some gravity to the whole thing.

title: Jackass Forever
summary: After 11 years, the Jackass crew is back for another crusade.
josh_notes: I think having some time away gave them a chance to come up with some great ideas for stunts. Funny as ever, definitely better than the second one and was helpful to have some fresh blood. Zach Holmes was especially good. Johnny Knoxville is so good at being the ringleader. Could barely watch the cup test once they got to the pogo stick and the bear one was mental.

title: The Worst Person in the World
summary: The chronicles of four years in the life of Julie, a young woman who navigates the troubled waters of her love life and struggles to find her career path, leading her to take a realistic look at who she really is.
josh_notes: Such a rich film - every scene had so much going on. They really all felt like real characters to me - every one had some complexity. Also it was properly funny, particularly in the first half. The main actress was really great too, she had to have a lot of range. Break up scene felt very real and I liked the pause scene before it, felt like we were in her head weighing up the decision she was about to make. Oslo looked amazing too.

title: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy
summary: An unexpected love triangle, a failed seduction trap and an encounter that results from a misunderstanding, told in three movements to depict three female characters and trace the trajectories between their choices and regrets.
josh_notes: I think the format of the three short stories just meant it wasn't quite as cohesive and layered as Drive My Car, also a bit less polished visually. I liked the third story best with the little twist and with them becoming friends at the end of it and ulitmately getting what they were looking for. All the stories were good but it just wasn't quite for me.

title: Yi Yi
summary: Each member of a middle-class Taipei family seeks to reconcile past and present relationships within their daily lives.
josh_notes: 3 hours but I could have watched for longer, from about 45 minutes in I was totally captivated in a way that doesn't often happen. On paper it could seem boring but it was such a great film, really has it all - lots of funny scenes, wisdom and beautiful shots. Every scene is rich with something and it winds up beinga  great portrait of life in general and captures that feeling that there are different perspectives to everything. Some standout scenes: when NJ and his daughter are both simultaneousely on dates and he talks about his first date as his daughter's first date is mirroring it exactly. The wedding scene at the beginning, Yang Yang in the photo shop, Yang Yang giving his photos to his uncle/dad and explaining how he was helping them to get perspective, the funeral speech at the end, Ota's magic trick. Some all time great characters too in Yang Yang and Ota. Left me feeling like I wanted to burst in to tears at the end.

title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
summary: A young man searches for home in the changing city that seems to have left him behind.
josh_notes: Liked it from the very start - it has a very particular style to it, with touches of the surreal that make it feel sort of biblical or something - the chorus of people outside the house, the four eyed fish, the lighting (which I especially liked) etc. Bit Wes Anderson-y too in parts. "People aren't just one thing" was a good bit. Somehow I think it just lost the point it was making towards the end but I'm intrigued to see what Joe Talbot does next - was pretty great for a first feature film. Jonathan Majors is great too.

title: Lucky
summary: Lucky follows the spiritual journey of a 90-year-old atheist and the quirky characters that inhabit his off the map desert town.
josh_notes: Very nice opening shots - looks great and  immediately sets up Lucky's character. Nice and low key and sweet and sort of sad. Worth a quick watch.

title: The Invisible Man
summary: When Cecilia's abusive ex takes his own life and leaves her his fortune, she suspects his death was a hoax. As a series of coincidences turn lethal, Cecilia works to prove that she is being hunted by someone nobody can see.
josh_notes: I found it pretty scary, especially in the quiet moments of the first hour or so up until the point she is in the attic. The camerawork was great I think that really contributed to the effect of feeling like you're not sure whether she is imagining it or not. The way the camera was sometimes peeking around corners or having these wide-ish shots were very effective in giving the impression that there might be someone we couldn't see stood right there. Elisabeth Moss was really good too and I actually thought it was quite a good allegory -  I suppose it was making a point about not believing victims of abuse? which it did well.

title: The Batman
summary: When a sadistic serial killer begins murdering key political figures in Gotham, Batman is forced to investigate the city's hidden corruption and question his family's involvement.
josh_notes: Maybe the most relatable Batman - Robert Pattinson was really good and fairly different to the Bale version. His motives seemed a bit clearer and he seemed more of a person than a billionaire dude like in the previous ones. Fight scenes weren't all that great but I liked that it was more focussed on Batman the detective working with Commissioner Gordon. The Riddler was mostly good except for that Ave Maria bit which I didn't get/seemed liked it was trying too hard to make him seem unhinged (he already seemed unhinged, he just flooded the whole city). Gotham was good and dark and Colin Farrel was unrecognisable. Zoe Kravitz is a good catwoman too and their relationship was more interesting/important than usual. Didn't always flow that well I didn't think but the story was good and I liked it mostly.

title: 14 Peaks: Nothing Is Impossible
summary: Fearless Nepali mountaineer Nirmal Purja embarks on a seemingly impossible quest to summit all 14 of the world's 8,000-meter peaks in seven months.
josh_notes: It's an amazing story, and Nirmal is obviously a crazy/interesting/ultra-impressive guy but can't help but think it wouldn't have been better as a series. A lot of the climbing is skimmed over and I didn't think it documented the challenges they faced all that well. Most of the climbs were a few shots and then him at the summit celebrating. K2 was the best bit but even then after he comes up with a plan to set the fixed lines at 1am and says "Camp 2 today, Camp 4 tomorrow then summit day after" and starts walking, they only then showed a few shots of him near the top rather than him executing his plan. Could have been better.

title: She's Gotta Have It
summary: Story of a woman and her three lovers.
josh_notes: Stylish but I thought in quite a different way to Do the Right Thing. Less cool shots and things but I liked the way the story was told, was almost like a documentary about her. Didn’t think the acting was great which is probably just down to it being so low-budget.

title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
summary: During the Napoleonic Wars, a brash British captain pushes his ship and crew to their limits in pursuit of a formidable French war vessel around South America.
josh_notes: A kind of adventure/epic film that has sort of gone out of fashion lately - a little bit like Pirates of The Caribbean or something I suppose but less comedy and more about what it's like to be in charge of other people and how that might weigh on you. Russell Crowe was really good I thought. The plot was a little bit thin but it looked great and must have been amazing to film.

title: Turning Red
summary: A thirteen-year-old girl named Mei Lee is torn between staying her mother's dutiful daughter and the changes of adolescence. And as if the challenges were not enough, whenever she gets overly excited she transforms into a giant re...
josh_notes: Good movie - just when you think Pixar has covered everything. Nice style of animation similar to the bao short. Very good at showing that period of time when you start to move away from your parents in certain aspects of your personality or opinion or whatnot and start to think for yourself. Quite an educational film in a way. Also great that they can tackle stuff like periods - feel like that wouldn't have happened ten years ago.

title: The Master
summary: A Naval veteran arrives home from war unsettled and uncertain of his future - until he is tantalized by the Cause and its charismatic leader.
josh_notes: Outstanding acting - can't believe neither Philip Seymour Hoffman or Joaquin Phoenix won. Looked beautiful on 70mm. Would like to see it again in a year or something. Hard to know what it's all about quite frankly - I took it to be about having power - from both sides. Freddie has power over Lancaster as he cares so much about him, and Lancaster enjoys having power over his followers and enjoys trying to catch/change Freddie - not sure I see the love story that other people seem to reading online. Good quote about having a master and that.

title: One Hour Photo
summary: A mentally unstable photo developer targets an upper middle-class family after his obsession with them becomes more sick and disturbing than any of them could imagine.
josh_notes: Well shot and I liked the premise but the story was all a bit messy I thought. Some scenes were a bit jarring like when they just cut to the couple mid argument - the argument had no weight to it it was like they'd cut out the beginning to save time. Maybe I would have had him descend into creepiness a bit slower. Robin Williams was pretty good though it was worth watching for him. Don't get many hamsters in movies either. Cool shot of him with his eyes obscured by the car mirror before he leans forward and cool one of him running down the spiral car park.

title: Face/Off
summary: To foil a terrorist plot, an FBI agent assumes the identity of the criminal who murdered his son through facial transplant surgery, but the crook wakes up prematurely and vows revenge.
josh_notes: Absolutely mad premise that could only work with Nicholas Cage. He's really good at being John Travolta playing Nicholas Cage somehow. Proper 90s action, a bit like Point Break in it's ridiculousness.

title: Hail, Caesar!
summary: A Hollywood fixer in the 1950s works to keep the studio's stars in line.
josh_notes: I liked the setup and some of the script and the way it looked but it doesn’t really go any where at all. There were lots of scenes I liked: The scene with the rabbi/priest etc arguing about Jesus, the aerial shot of the synchronised swimmers, the scenes with the communists were good and the scene with Ranulph Fiennes directing that film but overall it didn't seem to amount to much. Amazing cast.

title: Ponyo
summary: A five-year-old boy develops a relationship with Ponyo, a young goldfish princess who longs to become a human after falling in love with him.
josh_notes: Very calming, lovely animation and food as always. Not that compelling a story but it was quite relaxing to watch. I like ham too.

title: Stalker
summary: A guide leads two men through an area known as the Zone to find a room that grants wishes.
josh_notes: Hard to decipher what it was really about. Less Sci-Fi than I expected and more philosophical/conversational. What does it all mean? I took it to be about faith and human nature but would need to watch again to get a proper grasp. I liked the brown shots at the start they were weird and the shot of the girl which is revealed to be on his shoulders. Why can she suddenly move things with her mind at the end? Seemed a bit out of place in a way.

title: The General
summary: The real-life story of Dublin folk hero and criminal Martin Cahill, who pulled off two daring robberies in Ireland with his team, but attracted unwanted attention from the police, the I.R.A., the U.V.F., and members of his own team.
josh_notes: Maybe it's just me but I didn’t think it was as funny as everyone says. We watched a colourised version which to be honest was a bit distracting in most of the scenes, would probably have been better off watching the original. Some of the stunts are absolutely mad though. First Buster Keaton film I've seen I think.

title: Honey Boy
summary: A young actor's stormy childhood and early adult years as he struggles to reconcile with his father and deal with his mental health.
josh_notes: Incredibly honest and personal film - fascinating because of how personal it is. Must have been so difficulto play his own abusive father - I wonder if it was cathartic or the opposite. Feel sorry for Shia LaBeouf now. It works because it's so sincere (and also the kids playing him are really good) (Noah Jude and Lucas Hedges who is good at everything)

title: Spotlight
summary: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.
josh_notes: Really well written, goes along at a good pace and by all accounts is incredibly accurate. Thrilling as an action film would be. Great ensemble cast particularly Mark Ruffalo - he does some great face acting too. Makes you want to retrain as a journalist quite frankly. Breathtaking end credits.

title: The Northman
summary: A young Viking prince is on a quest to avenge his father's murder.
josh_notes: After a relatively jumbled start it becomes really absorbing once his dad is killed and he starts on his path to vengeance and the world is all set up. Great cast. Anya Taylor Joy especially good -you can never imagine anyone else playing the parts she plays. Big and epic, kind of like an icelandic gladiator or something. Apt that it ends with two hench naked dudes fighting to the death inside a volcano. Touches of The Lighthouse but with a much bigger scope.

title: Taxi Driver
summary: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action.
josh_notes: Not really the film I expected - given it's popularity and reknown I thought it would be less ambiguous or more action-packed somehow? But it's amazingly shot, incredibly cool and Robert DeNiro is great. The whole plot and his character are ambiguous and open to interpretation though - it's hard to be totally sympathetic to him because he's so unstable and you never really know what he's thinking or why he's thinking it. Interesting ending too - he ends up a hero when really he was very close to assasinating the senator. In the end though he is basically just the same as he was in the beginning.

title: A Goofy Movie
summary: When Max makes a preposterous promise to a girl he has a crush on, his chances to fulfilling it seem hopeless when he is dragged onto a cross-country trip with his embarrassing father, Goofy.
josh_notes: Pretty wacky!!! It was alright but probably one of those kids films that you had to watch when you were a kid to now really like. I do enjoy the h-yukking though and some of the songs were actually very good. The guy who did the score also did the score for most of the Coen Brothers stuff and Martin McDonagh films as well as a bunch of other good shit. He has an interesting website where he talks about all the scores he did - pretty good find.

title: Four Roads
summary: During the COVID-19 pandemic, filmmaker Alice Rohrwacher gets in touch with her neighborhoods through her photographic lenses.
josh_notes: Nice little film about her 4 neighbours, one in each direction, made during lockdown as a way of connecting to them. Nice message too - very Agnes Varda like with shining a short spotlight on some ordinary people. Some good ideas for shots in there - running into the sun behind the kids running away, shots of parting between trees in between 'scenes'. Maybe would be funny to do a Super8 film that had Lydia voiceovering in Italian but talking about something funny in that serious, short-doc style.

title: Partly Cloudy
summary: Babies both human and beast are created up in the stratosphere, by the clouds themselves. One cloud specializes in "dangerous" babies, creating a challenge for his loyal stork that has to deliver them.
josh_notes: Simple pretty typical pixar short. Cloud thinks the stork is leaving him but he's just adapting. Fine!

title: Shiva Baby
summary: At a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student runs into her sugar daddy and ex girlfriend.
josh_notes: Balances itself well between being funny and tense throughout. The main actress was really good and Sy Ableman is always a perfect dad. I really liked the ending with them all in the van and Danielle and Maya holding hands and maybe realising their lives are kind of separate from their family's. Didn't quite like the score because it reminded me too much of Inside No 9 but I liked the idea of just creating tension like that. Reminded me a little of Saint Frances with how it dealt with modern stuff.

title: Grosse Pointe Blank
summary: Martin Blank is a professional assassin. He is sent on a mission to a small Detroit suburb, Grosse Pointe, and, by coincidence, his ten-year high school reunion party is taking place there at the same time.
josh_notes: Very likeable film - kind of like any of those classic 90s romcomactions but everyone in it just acts slightly odd which is fun. The Cusacks are good in this

title: Nightmare Alley
summary: A grifter working his way up from low-ranking carnival worker to lauded psychic medium matches wits with a psychologist bent on exposing him.
josh_notes: Beautifully shot, great lighting, interesting use of weird vignettes that moved about at the end of scenes too. Really great cast and Bradley Cooper in particular is great as a kind of greedy Icarus type character who starts to believe his own tricks. The plot didn't quite have enough twists and turns plus was hoping for some more weird stuff but otherwise it was very good. It was marketed badly the trailer sucked - didn't include any of the carnival bit which was probably the better half imo.

title: Bottle Rocket
summary: Three friends plan to pull off a simple robbery and go on the run.
josh_notes: Interesting to watch just to see what Wes Anderson was up to when he started and see the Wilson brothers (who are both good/already themselves). Funnily enough it isn't really in the same style as his whimisical features that came later although there is still a bit of wit about it.

title: Logan
summary: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.
josh_notes: Would be good if more superhero movies were like this - seems more like a realistic picture of what life would be like if there were mutants & superheroes - violent and kinda gory for a start. Also it felt more like a film set in that universe rather than a superhero film if that makes sense - it wasn't all about saving the world and whatnot but about the characters in it (plus action scenes). At the end of it all though the story isn't that new or exciting, it's essentially a roadtrip movie that's a tiny bit long. Still good though.

title: The Father
summary: A man refuses all assistance from his daughter as he ages. As he tries to make sense of his changing circumstances, he begins to doubt his loved ones, his own mind and even the fabric of his reality.
josh_notes: Brilliant film, not as sad as I was expecting til the last third but terrifying instead. The way it begins with him just not sure of the odd thing before quickly revealing him to have little sense of time or place is amazingly done and frankly very scary. Anthony Hopkins is unbelievably good - he manages to say a lot with his eyes, sometimes they appear both completely vacant and as though he is thinking of a thousand things. Hard to imagine a better portrait of dementia I suppose. Don't really want to watch it again mind you.

title: Les Misérables
summary: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.
josh_notes: Kind of like a mashup of Training Day and La Haine but doesn't quite reach the heights of either. Interesting to see how the projects in Paris work but it felt a bit too derivative and didn't have much of it's own style. Alexis Manenti made a good shitty cop though. And I liked the ending with the kid about to throw a molotov (although that is a very similar end to La Haine).

title: Guns Akimbo
summary: A guy relies on his newly-acquired gladiator skills to save his ex-girlfriend from kidnappers.
josh_notes: Didn't really like it from beginning to end. Daniel Radcliffe and Samara Weaving are good and fun but the script is terrible and the style is just a bad rip off of Scott Pilgrim and stuff like that. Feels like it's designed for nerds but in a way that nerds might hate. I suppose that's pandering? None of the jokes landed.

title: Far from the Madding Crowd
summary: In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.
josh_notes: Really well made and well acted. Even though I preferred it to other period films I've seen I still didn't really love it like maybe it deserved. Nice ending and Carey Mulligan in particular was great and also a good character. Some great shots of Michael Sheen and Carey Mulligan on their own in the dark and stuff which looked very cool.

title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
summary: A middle-aged Chinese immigrant is swept up into an insane adventure in which she alone can save existence by exploring other universes and connecting with the lives she could have led.
josh_notes: Must be one of the most original films I've ever seen. Amazing to see what they've done since "Interesting Ball". This is essentially the same vibe - profound despite it's silliness and full of a million ideas that it somehow manages to pull off. The papercut scene was a classic to watch with a whole cinema wincing in unison. A must watch

title: Don't Look Up
summary: Two low-level astronomers must go on a giant media tour to warn humankind of an approaching comet that will destroy planet Earth.
josh_notes: I get the point it's making but a good point does not make a good film. Jennifer Lawrence is weird casting and her character is badly written, Jonah Hill is very funny, Cate Blanchett is good and DiCaprio is good but kinda weird casting. Why was Timothee Chalamet even in it? His character did nothing haha. I didn't hate it and there were good bits but how it got nominated for Best Picture is beyond me. Adam McKay made Anchorman and that didn't get any oscar hype?

title: Friday
summary: It's Friday, and Craig and Smokey must come up with $200 they owe a local bully or there won't be a Saturday.
josh_notes: It's alright, didn't know that that is where 'bye Felicia' came from. Didn't really grab me tbh! I do like Ice Cube though. And fair play to him for writing a movie straight out of NWA

title: Hairspray
summary: Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.
josh_notes: Not sure if I should really count this as I wasn't paying attention for all of it but it did seem like the sort of musical I might like if I liked musicals. Kinda funny and quite self aware it seemed. Also John Travolta was really good - great casting. I don't really like the music but there were some funny lines. Also I don't know what I thought it was about but it wasn't what I thought.

title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
summary: Dr. Evil is back and has invented a new time machine that allows him to go back to the 1960s and steal Austin Powers' mojo, inadvertently leaving him "shagless".
josh_notes: Maybe the best Austin Powers film? Although they're all pretty consistent tbh. Just silly init.

title: Goodfellas
summary: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.
josh_notes: Really great and so watchable. Maintains an amazing pace/tempo through every single scene. Joe Pesci's character is amazing and kind of terrifying. Great soundtrack and everything else. Really feels like a proper film throughout. Only thing I don't like is that it doesn't really build to a big tense scene like The Godfather does but heyho.

title: Top Gun
summary: As students at the United States Navy's elite fighter weapons school compete to be best in the class, one daring young pilot learns a few things from a civilian instructor that are not taught in the classroom.
josh_notes: I can see why it became a cult hit at the time but to be honest it wasn't all that great. The script is pretty bad and even Tom Cruise isn't at his best IMO. Looks cool and the flying scenes are pretty great (although kind of hard to follow vs a normal action scene). I like all the saturation and colours and that. Everyone who says it's pretty gay is right. Nowhere near as good as Point Break if we're comparing 80s action.

title: Top Gun: Maverick
summary: After thirty years, Maverick is still pushing the envelope as a top naval aviator, but must confront ghosts of his past when he leads TOP GUN's elite graduates on a mission that demands the ultimate sacrifice from those chosen to ...
josh_notes: Significantly more exciting than the original. A great sequel - they took all the good things about the original (mainly the style and the general idea) and improved everything else (the plot, the script). Some amazing footage from the cockpits. Story was much more cohesive and exciting as a result.

title: Mission: Impossible
summary: An American agent, under false suspicion of disloyalty, must discover and expose the real spy without the help of his organization.
josh_notes: Plot not great but Tom Cruise being cool is always good. Mainly watched so I might watch some of the later ones. Good sleight of hand scene.

title: Platoon
summary: Chris Taylor, a neophyte recruit in Vietnam, finds himself caught in a battle of wills between two sergeants, one good and the other evil. A shrewd examination of the brutality of war and the duality of man in conflict.
josh_notes: Willem Dafoe is really great, this might be the earliest thing I've seen him in. Really liked the colour - all the green looked amazing. The whole thing was very effective in taking you there and seeing everything from Charlie Sheen's perspective. Vietnam was mad wasn't it.

title: Kung Fu Hustle
summary: In Shanghai, China in the 1940s, a wannabe gangster aspires to join the notorious "Axe Gang" while residents of a housing complex exhibit extraordinary powers in defending their turf.
josh_notes: So silly but also with great action scenes - good stuff. Didn't like it as much as Shaolin Soccer but then again I saw that when I was about 12 so I might be wrong

title: Land of Mine
summary: In post-World War II Denmark, a group of young German POWs are forced to clear a beach of thousands of land mines under the watch of a Danish Sergeant who slowly learns to appreciate their plight.
josh_notes: Decent war film about some young german boys after world war 2 being made to clear up mines in Denmark. The shots of the sergeant driving were always incredible for some reason - especially the one with all the smoke on the road behind the car. Bittersweet ending came a bit abruptly - didn't quite get how the sergeant was able to extract the boys from their new post clearing mines. Good but not as tense as Kajaki if we are comparing minesweeping films.

title: Drop Dead Gorgeous
summary: A small-town beauty pageant turns deadly as it becomes clear that someone will go to any lengths to win.
josh_notes: Didn't all work but there was a lot of good ideas in there. Amazing cast - Kirsten Dunst, Amy Adams, Allison Janney and Brittany Murphy.  Amy Adams particularly funny - her relationship with her boyfriend was classic. Wasn't quite as funny as it could have been but I think it would be quite rewatchable in the way Mean Girls is.

title: Whiplash
summary: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.
josh_notes: A near perfect film. So engaging throughout and JK Simmons is so scary. Complicated too - you kind of want Miles Teller to get his own back and walk away but you can understand why he doesn't. Camera work is great too.

title: 20 Feet from Stardom
summary: Backup singers live in a world that lies just beyond the spotlight. Their voices bring harmony to the biggest bands in popular music, but we've had no idea who these singers are or what lives they lead, until now.
josh_notes: Great topic - starts off pretty interesting and then drops off but still has the odd interesting Nugget. Darlene Love in particular is great. I don't think they really delved into why some people might want to be backing singers though, or what it is like for them working with the stars. Not bad just got a bit samey.

title: The Postman
summary: A simple Italian postman learns to love poetry while delivering mail to a famous poet, and then uses this to woo local beauty Beatrice.
josh_notes: A lovely film about poetry and simplicity. Pretty devastating ending, especially then reading that Massimo Troisi died immediately after filming ended. He is great as Mario. The scene when they're on the beach and he comes up with a metaphor for the first time is great. Looks fantastic too, I'd like to visit wherever it was filmed. Can't believe it was filmed in 1994 looks like it's from the 60s but in a good way. Also why didn't Pablo write to him though what gives?

title: Black Bear
summary: A filmmaker at a creative impasse seeks solace from her tumultuous past at a rural retreat, only to find that the woods summon her inner demons in intense and surprising ways.
josh_notes: Really worth a watch. Aubrey Plaza is really really good - has a lot of range in the film, especially given she is effectively playing 2 or 3 different characters, rather than the usual character she seems to play. I liked the score too. It was all very meta and quite emotionally intense. Some funny lines in there too. Worth discussing afterwards - I took it that she was writing two different drafts and that was the two acts, although I didn't come to that conclusion til quite near the end. Probably preferred the first half although I did also like the chaos of the second.

title: Casino
summary: In Las Vegas, two best friends - a casino executive and a mafia enforcer - compete for a gambling empire and a fast-living, fast-loving socialite.
josh_notes: Very Scorsesey with the narration and stuff. So many cool shots, that one where he is standing in the window and the car headlights very briefly illuminate him is so cool. Robert DeNiro, Joe Pesci and Sharon Stone are all amazing. Kind of in between The Wolf of Wall Street and Goodfellas.

title: Daguerreotypes
summary: Portraits of the people that occupy the small shops of the Rue Daguerre, Paris, where the filmmaker lived.
josh_notes: Probably wasn't in the right mood for it but it didn't land quite like her other films that I've seen. I think it was lacking some more of her narration. I very much liked the idea of it though and it was still fascinating just to see people living in the 70s. The old couple and the magician were very interesting.

title: Broadcast News
summary: Take two rival television reporters: one handsome, one talented, both male. Add one producer, female. Mix well, and watch the sparks fly.
josh_notes: Really enjoyed it - bit of a different spin on romcoms and it's all so well written. Three great characters that play off each other really well, Holly Hunter was great in particular, that smart boss vulnerable character is perfect for her. Seemed like a very realistic portrait of that kind of TV as well. William Hurt is a bit like Ben Doss?

title: 28 Days Later
summary: Four weeks after a mysterious, incurable virus spreads throughout the UK, a handful of survivors try to find sanctuary.
josh_notes: Not really as scary or tense as I thought it might be. Looks extremely early noughties with the pretty budget homemade style - lots of cool camera angles. Although I thought Cillian Murphy was good it did all come across a bit like a TV movie. I liked the music but I think it has been parodied since. Surprised it is so well known tbh. I guess the premise is good?

title: Paris, Texas
summary: Travis Henderson, an aimless drifter who has been missing for four years, wanders out of the desert and must reconnect with society, himself, his life, and his family.
josh_notes: Looks absolutely incredible, the blue skies, the outfits, the colours in every scene. Amazing restoration. Loved most of it - that scene with them in the peep show talking was so tense and full of emotion. In some ways felt similar to Yi Yi but didn't quite hit me in the same way.

title: Nope
summary: The residents of a lonely gulch in inland California bear witness to an uncanny and chilling discovery.
josh_notes: Not as strong a message as his other two films but still very entertaining. Didn't particularly like the ending - was she getting ready to smile for the cameras or something? Could have probably been clearer somehow. Also it didn't really come to any conclusion. I did like the two main characters though and it was maybe his funniest film.

title: The Guard
summary: An unorthodox Irish policeman with a confrontational personality is partnered with an uptight F.B.I. agent to investigate an international drug-smuggling ring.
josh_notes: Funny very Irish buddy cop movie but Brendan Gleeson just makes it better than that. Probs one of the best actors isn't he. Similar accents to The Young Offenders which I like.

title: Support the Girls
summary: The general manager at a highway-side ''sports bar with curves" has her incurable optimism and faith, in her girls, her customers, and herself, tested over the course of a long, strange day.
josh_notes: Mumblecore-y film about a day in the life of a Hooters manager essentially. I liked the jist of it, and the main character was really well acted but really there just wasn't quite enough going on. It did manage to almost feel like a documentary though which maybe was the intention.

title: Fire of Love
summary: Intrepid scientists and lovers Katia and Maurice Krafft died in a volcanic explosion doing the very thing that brought them together: unraveling the mysteries of volcanoes by capturing the most explosive imagery ever recorded.
josh_notes: Documentary about a volcanologist couple that love each other and volcanoes. Works as either a romance story or an amazing array of volcanic footage. So many of the shots by them are really cinematic, they're more artistic than many documentary films which realy added to it (especially as at the time of filming they were just making memories for themselves). Beautiful

title: Starship Troopers
summary: Humans in a fascist, militaristic future wage war with giant alien bugs.
josh_notes: A weird mix of teen angst movie, big budget sci fi, military propaganda and satire, all pretty well balanced into a pretty unique film. Hard to know what to make of it all. I enjoyed it because it was so different but it could have done with a twist. I thought that it was going to turn out that it had all been a simulation as part of his training or something - given how everything just seemed to go his way - getting promoted repeatedly, testing how he felt by having Buenos Aires specifically bombed. Felt like it was making fun of American exceptionalism and stuff mostly with all the propaganda etc Interesting to have such a bigbudget studio film about facism too. Weird to read that when it was released some people thought it was endorsing facism when the opposite is clearly true

title: Apollo 10½: A Space Age Childhood
summary: A coming-of-age story set in the suburbs of Houston, Texas in the summer of 1969, centered around the historic Apollo 11 moon landing.
josh_notes: Can almost make you nostalgic for a time that you didn't even live through, but that's basically all it is.There's no jeopardy or real storyline and the animation style wasn't my favourite. Maybe would have been better as a live action. Not even Jack Black could make it interesting

title: Ghost in the Shell
summary: In the near future, Major Mira Killian is the first of her kind: A human saved from a terrible crash, who is cyber-enhanced to be a perfect soldier devoted to stopping the world's most dangerous criminals.
josh_notes: Pretty cool, very philosophical, kind of like Blade Runner or something really. Not sure I really understand all the hype but it was interesting. Found it a bit hard to follow at the start tbh. I'd be curious to see the shitty live action version.

title: The Edge
summary: An intellectual billionaire and two other men struggle to band together and survive after getting stranded in the Alaskan wilderness with a blood-thirsty Kodiak Bear hunting them down.
josh_notes: A really good documentary about high level sport and the effect that it takes on your mental health. Good that it covers the fall as well as the rise. Jonathan Trott is the star for sure, especially his testimony at the end.

title: Little Women
summary: Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.
josh_notes: Sweeps you up. All round great feel good movie init.

title: See How They Run
summary: In the West End of 1950s London, plans for a movie version of a smash-hit play come to an abrupt halt after a pivotal member of the crew is murdered.
josh_notes: Pretty funny, Saorise Ronan is great, she can do anything. Maybe she should do more comedies? Sam Rockwell wasn't quite at his best but that was probs more his character than anything else. Pretty good cast, not a great reveal at the end - Charlie Cooper didn't seem angry or scary enough to be the who done it. Fun film though.

title: The Royal Tenenbaums
summary: The eccentric members of a dysfunctional family reluctantly gather under the same roof for various reasons.
josh_notes: One of his best films I think. Perfectly balanced array of well written characters which manages to work. Not as stylized as some of his more recent stuff. Many good halloween costumes. Ben Stiller is great and so is everyone else. Quite sad in a way, I think it's about that feeling of growing older and not being the center of attention anymore

title: Office Space
summary: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.
josh_notes: Such a good film isn't it.

title: The Rock
summary: A mild-mannered chemist and an ex-con must lead the counterstrike when a rogue group of military men, led by a renegade general, threaten a nerve gas attack from Alcatraz against San Francisco.
josh_notes: A classic silly 90s action film. 3 great leads and a pretty good premise (marine threatens to bomb san francisco to get fair compensation for some specific veterans). Lot's of great quotes and an all time great last line out of nowhere. "So do you wanna know who really killed JFK?"

title: Shoplifters
summary: On the margins of Tokyo, a dysfunctional band of outsiders are united by loyalty, a penchant for petty theft and playful grifting. When the young son is arrested, secrets are exposed that upend their tenuous, below-the-radar exist...
josh_notes: A nice understated film about what family means and what it really is. A sad last 20 minutes and an abrupt ending which I didn't especially like. Very naturalistic. Would like to watch it again at some point.

title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
summary: When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status.
josh_notes: Considering how many cameos they manage to cram in it's really good. The music is amazing, especially the one about fucking like the US military fucked bin laden. Funnier than it should be.

title: Moulin Rouge!
summary: A poor Bohemian poet in 1890s Paris falls for a beautiful courtesan and nightclub star coveted by a jealous duke.
josh_notes: Worth a watch just to see how absolutely mad it is. It is completely on drugs. Baffling to me that it would be so popular, at best it should be very divisive. I suppose he really goes for it but I had assumed the music would at least be better than it was (although I don't really like Jukebox musicals especially.) The first 20 minutes are so confusing but it does settle down after that. I liked Ewan McGregor but basically everyone else was a bit much. There are so many cuts in this film.

title: Linoleum
summary: When the host of a failing children's science show endeavors to achieve his childhood dream of becoming an astronaut by constructing a rocket ship in his garage, a series of bizarre events occur that cause him to question his own ...
josh_notes: LFF - Lots of interesting ideas in this, nice cinematography and great colours. The producer was very interesting in the chat afterwards too. Didn't see the twist coming really. Quite liked the synthy score, the performances are good but I thought the ending could have been a bit shorter. Very reminiscent of Brigsy Bear

title: The Woman in the White Car
summary: Hyun-ju, a kind-hearted small-town cop with a razor-sharp mind, is summoned by the local hospital to deal with Do-kyung, who has arrived carrying the limp body of her sister, believed to have been stabbed in a violent attack by he...
josh_notes: LFF - Liked the way it was filmed, performances were good but it was a bit too pulpy with too many revelations for me. It did seem very TV like and afterwards it was revealed it was originally meant to be a two episode TV show. The director was a fan of Scandi Noir and Happy Valley, Broadchurch etc and it definitely showed. I liked the way the flashbacks kept changing but it was a bit much by the end. Also I thought the police were a bit too incompetent/not interesting enough but there you go. Good chat afterwards as usual.

title: Close
summary: The intense friendship between two thirteen-year old boys Leo and Remi suddenly gets disrupted. Struggling to understand what has happened, Léo approaches Sophie, Rémi's mother. "Close" is a film about friendship and responsibility.
josh_notes: LFF - New contender to the film that made me cry the most. Just so many sad scenes from about 20 minutes in, could have cried at any moment. It wasn't totally sad though there was just so many scenes that made you empathise with the characters. The kids were both amazing (the director found the main kid on a train) and the relationship with the mum was complicated and great. The scene on the bus was very memorable. Also looked beautiful throughout, loads of closeups and colourful scenes.

title: Emily the Criminal
summary: Down on her luck and saddled with debt, Emily gets involved in a credit card scam that pulls her into the criminal underworld of Los Angeles, ultimately leading to deadly consequences.
josh_notes: LFF - pretty good for a debut script/feature. Aubrey Plaza probably saves it though, it never quite gets tense enough or funny enough or grimey enough to make it really good. Although I like the general point it's making about people being driven to crime by debt and criminal records and whatnot. Q and A was pretty good, the Q man sucked though. Guy in the cinema also sat down saying 'wow what a space' and then proceeded to look at his pal everytime anything happened which was disctracting haha

title: The Menu
summary: A young couple travels to a remote island to eat at an exclusive restaurant where the chef has prepared a lavish menu, with some shocking surprises.
josh_notes: LFF Surprise film. Did a good job of balancing it’s tone between being quite a funny takedown of Chef's table and also being part thriller. Anya Taylor Joy is great and holds it all together, Fiennes is really good too. I thought it felt a bit like it was being played at 1.1x speed for the first half, they never allowed the tension to build and scenes ended a bit too quickly. Ultimately very similar to Charlie and The Chocolate Factory I thought.

title: The Good Nurse
summary: An infamous caregiver is implicated in the deaths of hundreds of hospital patients.
josh_notes: LFF - Really well acted and creepy, quite uncomfortable to watch in fact. Nicely shot with all the closeups and both the leads were really good. At first I thought Eddie Redmayne was overacting a bit but overall he was a good and complicated villain.

title: New Normal
summary: New Normal is a captured record of 4 days in Seoul, 2022, which is a time of chaos that all the mankind never have been experienced before in entire human history. It depicts the unexpected risks and identity of fears that are hid...
josh_notes: LFF - Not bad but a bit uneven and the stories didn't tie together as effectively as they should have in the final chapter. Not really scary at all other than the split second of the girl falling out the window to try and crush that guy.

title: Father of the Bride
summary: With his oldest daughter's wedding approaching, a father finds himself reluctant to let go.
josh_notes: Just an extremely nice film, doesn't get too mushy. Steve Martin is the best - also funny to see him and Martin Short together after just watching Only Murders in the Building.

title: Cheaper by the Dozen
summary: With his wife doing a book tour, a father of twelve must handle a new job and his unstable brood.
josh_notes: Nostalgic film - I quite clearly remember watching it in the cinema and loving it. In particular the bit with Steve Martin doing the funeral for the frog. It's still fun.

title: Decision to Leave
summary: A detective investigating a man's death in the mountains meets the dead man's mysterious wife in the course of his dogged sleuthing.
josh_notes: For what the actual criminal proceedings lacked in intrigue it really made up for it with the emotional intrigue between the two mains. Both are amazing and complex, good acting guys! Full to the brim of amazing clever funny shots, from the dead guy's eyes looking up at the rock at the start to the crazy cinematic suicide by So on the beach. Looked incredible throughout. Only criticism is that it lacked a bit of the excitement of Oldboy say

title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
summary: The fragile peace between apes and humans is threatened as mistrust and betrayal threaten to plunge both tribes into a war for dominance over the Earth.
josh_notes: Maybe it would have been more enjoyable in the cinema but I just couldn't really get on board with a bunch of CGI apes shouting and what not. The CGI is really good but still. Overall it was basically fine but I just couldn't get into it

title: School of Rock
summary: After being kicked out of his rock band, Dewey Finn becomes a substitute teacher of an uptight elementary private school, only to try and turn his class into a rock band.
josh_notes: Perfect movie. How would anyone else other than Jack Black work in that role? A miracle that it was ever created.

title: I Lost My Body
summary: A story of Naoufel, a young man who is in love with Gabrielle. In another part of town, a severed hand escapes from a dissection lab, determined to find its body again.
josh_notes: Really clever storytelling and smart animation. Quite profound in some ways although I'm not sure what the overall message is - be glad you have hands? Well worth watching - pretty unique and actually quite romantic in parts.

title: Headhunters
summary: An accomplished headhunter risks everything to obtain a valuable painting owned by a former mercenary.
josh_notes: Really keeps you guessing - very original Norwegian crime thriller. The initial setup seems familiar but then it takes you all over the place without ever being too complicated.

title: The Endless Summer
summary: The crown jewel to ten years of Bruce Brown surfing documentaries. Brown follows two young surfers around the world in search of the perfect wave, and ends up finding quite a few in addition to some colorful local characters.
josh_notes: Amazing footage of early surfers travelling the world and basically just having a sick time. I like the light-heartedness of the narration, it wasn't especially informative and could probably have done with some chats with the surfers themselves but it was still pretty fascinating. The older it gets the more interesting it will be to watch. Mad to think that only 6 years ago there was so much undiscovered. Be it Ghanaians that had never seen a surfboard or surf itself. Kind of feels like everyone has seen everything these days, although I guess that isn't true.

title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
summary: In 1890s Wyoming, Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid lead a band of outlaws. When a train robbery goes wrong, they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. After considering their options, they escape to South ...
josh_notes: Has aged very well - could easily have been made in the 00s. Less of an intense western and more of a buddy comedy in a way. The tone is a bit uneven but the characters are extremely cool. Loved the scene with the bike especially the bit shot through the fence. A good film about cool mates.

title: Living
summary: In 1950s London, a humorless bureaucrat decides to take time off work to experience life after receiving a grim diagnosis.
josh_notes: Bill Nighy is really very good and I'm a sucker for films about old grumpy dudes realising that they've become grumpy so I loved it. I liked the way it was told - with him dying with half an hour to go and then having the rest of the story told by the effect he had had on his colleagues. Also I liked that there was a row of 9 14 year olds discussing it after - one saying that it was a sad film and why would anyone want to watch that and one arguing that it was a poignant film that was the point bro.

title: Triangle of Sadness
summary: A fashion model celebrity couple join an eventful cruise for the super-rich.
josh_notes: It was a tiny bit long but I really enjoyed it. Some commendably gross seasick scenes - they really went for it and kept it coming which I think paid off. I thought it was a better version of The Menu - had a bit more to say maybe? Very funny in parts too - his relationship with the Fillipino lady was great, as was the grenade couple. In general they managed a lot of interesting relationships and characters I thought. Woody Harrelson was great too - the whole captain's dinner bit from start to finish was super.

title: The Banshees of Inisherin
summary: Two lifelong friends find themselves at an impasse when one abruptly ends their relationship, with alarming consequences for both of them.
josh_notes: Not quite what I expected - quite short on plot. Enjoyable but didn't find myself wanting to watch it again. Colin Farrell is great though - he plays a great dull Irish dude. Saw it with Tom and Luiza and me and Tom reckoned it was probably an allegory for thr Irish Troubles? Not sure if that is true though. Thinking about it a month later though I think I would like to see it again.

title: Beasts of the Southern Wild
summary: Faced with both her hot-tempered father's fading health and melting ice-caps that flood her ramshackle bayou community and unleash ancient aurochs, six-year-old Hushpuppy must learn the ways of courage and love.
josh_notes: The kid is brilliant as expected but I didn't really like the film at any point, it didn't really make me feel anything. Didn't particularly like/get any of the magical parts and there never felt like there was any real jeopardy either. I don't think it ever made you understand what was so good about their way of life unlike similar kind of outcasty films like Captain Fantastic or Leave no Trace or something.

title: One Cut of the Dead
summary: Things go badly for a hack director and film crew shooting a low budget zombie movie in an abandoned WWII Japanese facility, when they are attacked by real zombies.
josh_notes: Very creative and original but I just didn't really think it was funny or that well executed. Although the one long shot at the start is impressive it didn't really draw me in. Didn't like the music either it felt a bit lift musicy. Clever idea though and I guess the jokes/insight about filmmaking on a low budget was good.

title: Glass Onion
summary: Tech billionaire Miles Bron invites his friends for a getaway on his private Greek island. When someone turns up dead, Detective Benoit Blanc is put on the case.
josh_notes: Lives up to the first one for sure. A great cast and plenty of good twists. Pretty funny as well. My only criticism is that maybe it went too big (and maybe not quite dark enough) - not sure where he goes from here.

title: A Brighter Summer Day
summary: Based on a true story, primarily on a conflict between two youth gangs, a 14-year-old boy's girlfriend conflicts with the head of one gang for an unclear reason, until finally the conflict comes to a violent climax.
josh_notes: To be honest not quite as good as I was hoping. There were some great bits but none of the characters were quite as interesting as in Yi Yi. I would like to watch it again - it definitely didn't drag despite the long runtime, but I didn't leave the cinema with quite the same feeling as I did with Yi Yi.

title: The Phantom of the Open
summary: Maurice Flitcroft, a dreamer and unrelenting optimist, manages to gain entry to the 1976 British Open Golf Championship qualification round despite being a complete novice.
josh_notes: A perfect feel good film for a plane journey. The main character is incredibly likeable with his blind faith, without being all cheesy and stuff. Also the guy in real life must have been absolutely mad.

title: Vengeance
summary: A writer from New York City attempts to solve the murder of a girl he hooked up with and travels down south to investigate the circumstances of her death and discover what happened to her.
josh_notes: Really good premise that manages to capture the whole dating lots of people scene, maybe lacks a little bit more action & mystery - could have made it slightly darker in parts I think. Some funny bits and Ashton Kutcher was cool.

title: Forrest Gump
summary: The history of the United States from the 1950s to the '70s unfolds from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, who yearns to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.
josh_notes: Basically a classic now. Imagine thinking of writing this film and then doing it.

title: Brian and Charles
summary: After a particularly harsh winter Brian goes into a deep depression; completely isolated and with no one to talk to, Brian does what any sane person would do when faced with such a melancholic situation. He builds a robot.
josh_notes: This was okay - kind of forgettable and predictable though that might be part of the haze I was watching it in. The main thing it has going for it is that it's nice and weird.

title: Dune
summary: A noble family becomes embroiled in a war for control over the galaxy's most valuable asset while its heir becomes troubled by visions of a dark future.
josh_notes: Looks great, wish I could have seen it at the IMAX. Didn't find it boring or too long like some people have said. Sets up nicely for a sequel.

title: The Lost City
summary: A reclusive romance novelist on a book tour with her cover model gets swept up in a kidnapping attempt that lands them both in a cutthroat jungle adventure.
josh_notes: Pretty good plane movie - Brad Pitt has a good cameo and Daniel Radcliffe is a good spoilt bad guy. Channing Tatum is always good at these dumb muscly guy roles (like Jump Street).

title: The Hunt
summary: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent li...
josh_notes: Really good plane movie, nice and concise, good action, throughly enjoyed. All the satire doesn't quite land but it does a pretty good job if ye ask me.

title: Batman & Robin
summary: Batman and Robin try to keep their relationship together even as they must stop Mr. Freeze and Poison Ivy from freezing Gotham City.
josh_notes: Mad how different this is to present day superhero movies. There is so much going on and yet so little Batman. Arnold Schwarzenegger and Uma Thurman are actually pretty good but the script is awful, none of it makes much sense and all the quips suck. The tooling up scenes with all their mad suits are great though.

title: The Muppet Christmas Carol
summary: The Muppets present their own touching rendition of Charles Dickens' classic tale.
josh_notes: Up there with the best Christmas movies. Didn't think Michael Caine was quite as good second time around although he does play it straight which is the key.

title: The Game
summary: After a wealthy San Francisco banker is given an opportunity to participate in a mysterious game, his life is turned upside down as he begins to question if it might really be a concealed conspiracy to destroy him.
josh_notes: Kind of an unrealistic premise given the scale of the game Michael Douglas' character is playing (and the scale of the party at the end) but it is really well made and enjoyable if you can ignore that. Maybe could have made the character slightly more sympathetic but otherwise a good movie.

title: Predator
summary: A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.
josh_notes: Very watchable. Fantastic explosions and monster, very 80s action movie.

title: Aftersun
summary: Sophie reflects on the shared joy and private melancholy of a holiday she took with her father twenty years earlier. Memories real and imagined fill the gaps between as she tries to reconcile the father she knew with the man she d...
josh_notes: Incredible film. Looks beautiful, incredibly reminiscent of a summer holiday, what with the colours, the random friendships with kids around the pool and the sense ofgrowing up you get. At the same time the more the film goes on the more melancholy you get, and when you realise what most likely happens after it is pretty devastating. That being said it didn't really leave me sad, more of a mix of feeling happy that they had this nice holiday but also sad as she is trying to piece together the sides of her dad she didn't really know. More than maybe any other film it really captures that sense of never being able to really know someone. I got very sad when I read this review which I think sums it up perfectly: "watched this for the… 6th(?) time today. hurts so good. an all-timer. few fiction movies, if any, have better harnessed the inherently haunted power of old home video footage." Makes you think of all those videos of grandparents etc and wonder what else was happening.

title: 24 Hour Party People
summary: In 1976, Tony Wilson sets up Factory Records and brings Manchester's music to the world.
josh_notes: Enjoyed the way the story was told, with plenty of fictionalised bits and talking to camera, as well as some cleverly interspersed actual footage. Amazingly good British cast, just about everyone seems to be in it. Tony Wilson seems like a very interesting guy, Steve Coogan is really good although he does seem quite Partridge. Think it lost it's way and got a bit boring when it got onto the Happy Mondays for some reason.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
summary: When a murder occurs on the train on which he's travelling, celebrated detective Hercule Poirot is recruited to solve the case.
josh_notes: Perhaps too much of a classic whodunnit/murder mystery dinner party for my liking (although that is partly because a million things since have copied it) but it has a great (really great) cast and kept me guessing. Does seem mad though that Ingrid Bergman won best supporting actress that year - didn't really think she stood out above anyone else.

title: The Celebration
summary: At Helge's 60th birthday party, some unpleasant family truths are revealed.
josh_notes: Shot on a Sony handycam - at times it really looks like something made in drama class at school (but in a good way) so it's all the more impressive when the tension and atmosphere builds and builds in the way that it does. Liked the way it's told with different layers peeling back at each turn.

title: La La Land
summary: While navigating their careers in Los Angeles, a pianist and an actress fall in love while attempting to reconcile their aspirations for the future.
josh_notes: Considering I hated the first scene I really enjoyed the rest. It got better and better and less musical-y with less dance troupes. Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling were really great as usual. Great ending even though really they should have been together, I suppose it is refreshing to have an ending you're not expecting.

title: 101 Dalmatians
summary: An evil high-fashion designer plots to steal dalmatian puppies in order to make an extravagant fur coat but creates an extravagant mess instead.
josh_notes: Glenn Close is good as Cruella but that's about it. The lady that owns the dog is really rubbish and even Hugh Laurie isn't great in this.

title: North by Northwest
summary: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and falls for a woman whose loyalties he begins to doubt.
josh_notes: Aside from the sickly love scene in the train carriage it seemed more modern to me than the other Hitchcock films I've seen. Great storyline with a few twists although it lacks the tension of Psycho or Rear Window. Classic scene where the plane is trying to kill him is great - really unique and almost comedic. Thoroughly entertaining.

title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
summary: Roy Neary, an Indiana electric lineman, finds his quiet and ordinary daily life turned upside down after a close encounter with a UFO, spurring him to an obsessed cross-country quest for answers as a momentous event approaches.
josh_notes: A good big movie that makes you think 'what if those UFO chasers are all right?'. Interesting watching such an old Spielberg movie, he does have a knack of always making them accessible and entertaining. Lacking in the tension of something like the Vast of Night though. Some lovely sky shots.

title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
summary: In the bleak days of the Cold War, espionage veteran George Smiley is forced from semi-retirement to uncover a Soviet Agent within MI6.
josh_notes: Nicely shot, enjoyed the almost always slowly moving camera, very suspenseful and a ridiculous cast. Builds and builds but the payoff isn't really worth it all. Quite hard to follow in parts.

title: The Bourne Ultimatum
summary: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless C.I.A. official and his Agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer.
josh_notes: Pretty great although doesn't wrap everything up as it should. Great bit with the torch and the fan, also the bit when he is watching Pam and says Pam, get some sleep, you look tired. Weeee WEEEE.

title: The Woman in the Window
summary: An agoraphobic woman living alone in New York begins spying on her new neighbors; only to witness a disturbing act of violence.
josh_notes: Stylish and intriguing and all the rest. The only thing that took away from it was the dream twist at the end - I don't think it needed it. Would have been a bold ending if he had died before he found out he would be okay.

title: Chinatown
summary: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer in 1930s Los Angeles finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.
josh_notes: Good score, great performances, quite slow. Probably not quite as good as I had anticipated. Great final line and bold ending.

title: Adaptation.
summary: A lovelorn screenwriter becomes desperate as he tries and fails to adapt 'The Orchid Thief' by Susan Orlean for the screen.
josh_notes: Very very clever, but never takes itself quite as seriously as Synecdoche. Not sure I've ever seen a film so successfully meta - to the point where the third act is clearly written by his twin. But then how could it be? He dies? Also Nicolas Cage is so good as the twins - very funny.

title: Romeo + Juliet
summary: Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.
josh_notes: At times it felt like I was watching a foreign film with no subtitles - When it didn't, I enjoyed it. It's very bold like all of his films (which most of the time I don't like) but this was better as it wasn't totally style over substance like Gatsby was. I think it is probably as good an adaptation as there could be for me, but unfortunately I just don't particularly like shakespeare. If me not being able to understand what they're saying makes me stupid or uncultured, then I am stupid and/or uncultured, but also that means I didn't enjoy the film.

title: School of Rock
summary: After being kicked out of his rock band, Dewey Finn becomes a substitute teacher of an uptight elementary private school, only to try and turn his class into a rock band.
josh_notes: Perfect movie. I think the key was getting kids that play all the instruments as it means they come across more like actual school kids in a band rather than school kids acting as school kids playing in a band.

title: Along the Coast
summary: A humorous travelogue of the French Riviera.
josh_notes: Based on this I could watch Agnes Varda make a travel film of absolutely anywhere and be captivated. Looks absolutely incredible given it was shot in the 50s (it was rescanned in 2015 but still), like going on holiday. Fascinating seeing people going about their holidays back then in such amazing detail. Great sarcastic commentary too and almost twists at the end when it takes a negative turn.

title: The Player
summary: A Hollywood studio executive is being sent death threats by a writer whose script he rejected, but which one?
josh_notes: Clever, well acted and never really goes where you think it will. Also like the meta happy hollywood ending (or is it a sad ending because he doesn't get his comeuppance?). Cool seeing all the cameos and enjoyed the long shots.

title: Under the Tree
summary: When Baldwin and Inga's next door neighbours complain that a tree in their backyard casts a shadow over their sundeck, what starts off as a typical spat between neighbours in the suburbs unexpectedly and violently spirals out of c...
josh_notes: Dark throughout with a surprisingly dark ending. Shot nicely, wouldn't say it was especially funny. The stuffed dog was pretty shocking, it was clever how the film slowly revealed how evil the main lady was

title: Emma.
summary: In 1800s England, a well meaning but selfish young woman meddles in the love lives of her friends.
josh_notes: Started promisingly with plenty of Bill Nighy but ultimately let down by an uninteresting story and an unlikeable main character. I liked the choreography of some scenes, felt almost like a musical with no music. Too long as well.

title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
summary: An insane American general orders a bombing attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.
