josh_notes: To be honest not quite as funny as I anticipated - maybe that sort of anti america/anti-war comedy was more groundbreaking then. That being said it's still clever and well written and Peter Sellers is amazing in multiple roles

title: Porco Rosso
summary: In 1930s Italy, a veteran World War I pilot is cursed to look like an anthropomorphic pig.
josh_notes: A little simpler and more based in reality than other Ghibli films, but no less magical. Looks beautiful and I enjoyed the simplicity of the story. Porco Rosso is straight up cool as well.

title: Clueless
summary: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school's pecking scale. Seeing herself as a matchmaker, Cher first coaxes two teachers into dating each other.
josh_notes: More consistently fun than the most recent adaptation of Emma although still held back by the lacklustre story and unlikeable main character. Also felt that the girl she was setting up was a bit less believable, it didn't make much sense that she was so easily controlled by/in awe of Cher because she didn't really lack confidence/popularity or have a reason to look up to her. Maybe the most 90s film I've seen haha. Also Paul Rudd

title: Leave No Trace
summary: A father and his seventeen-year-old daughter are living an ideal existence in a vast urban park in Portland, Oregon when a small mistake derails their lives forever.
josh_notes: The two main characters are really well acted and convincing, nice visuals of the forest etc. Ultimately just a little bit more boring than I expected. Mark Kermode's favourite film of the year in 2018!

title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
summary: After being mistaken for an actor, a New York thief is sent to Hollywood to train under a private eye for a potential movie role, but the duo are thrown together with a struggling actress into a murder mystery.
josh_notes: Great script, funny and stylish. Entertaining throughout. All round good film if you ask me.

title: Hale County This Morning, This Evening
summary: A kaleidoscopic and humanistic view of the Black community in Hale County, Alabama.
josh_notes: Shot beautifully, and had some great shots: The flailing tube man, the sunlight going through the trees and smoke, the kid with his hair stuck in the basketball net. Very real in it's style, no narration and not much narrative. There is something clever about the whole thing but in some ways it did get a little boring.

title: Point Break
summary: An F.B.I. Agent goes undercover to catch a gang of surfers who may be bank robbers.
josh_notes: I had a great time watching this. Would like to see it with a crowd. It's the perfect balance between over the top and serious. I thought the scene with Keanu and Busey were in the police station in their surf gear was hilarious and silly but then there are also great action sequences like all the skydiving ones and the chase on foot especially. Also slightly surprising ending. 'This is stimulating but we're outta here'

title: Dead Pigs
summary: A bumbling pig farmer, a feisty salon owner, a sensitive busboy, an expat architect and a disenchanted rich girl converge and collide as thousands of dead pigs float down the river towards a rapidly-modernizing Shanghai.
josh_notes: Brilliantly intertwines multiple storylines, A farmer who's pigs die who owes money who part owns the house of his sister who refuses to sell to a company that wants to build flats who are owned by the father of a girl who falls for the pig farmers son who wants to impress his dad. Works really well for the most part but the end just falls a bit flat. The conclusion seems to say that it's best to just sell up and move into a small flat in the city? No one really gets their comeuppance and they don't really resolve the American character's storyline. Did he lie about qualifying as an architect? Why is he in China at all? Other than that though I liked it, will be intrigued to see if she writes another chinese film rather than some more DC shit. Very stylish and looks like it was made on a much bigger budget than it was.

title: Bao
summary: A Chinese-Canadian woman suffering from empty nest syndrome gets a second shot at motherhood when one of her handmade dumplings comes alive.
josh_notes: Really liked the animation style and the way everyone looked a bit like they had been steamed. Everything looks unbelievably tasty. Also so much happens in such a short film, it manages to get close to the emotion of a feature length film without even saying anything. One of Pixar's best shorts (although they're all good). A lovely story

title: Sanjay's Super Team
summary: Sanjay loves cartoons and comics, while his father tries to draw him into his Hindu traditions. Reluctance turns into awe-inspiring adventure as the boy embarks on an amazing journey, returning with a new perspective they can both...
josh_notes: More personal than Bao but less interesting. Still nice as any other pixar short and a sweet ending.

title: One Man Band
summary: Two buskers engage in a petty feud over a child's donation.
josh_notes: Funny ending. Not as good as Bao or Sanjay's.

title: I'm Thinking of Ending Things
summary: Full of misgivings, a young woman travels with her new boyfriend to his parents' secluded farm. Upon arriving, she comes to question everything she thought she knew about him, and herself.
josh_notes: Really really really well acted, not seen Jessie Buckley in anything before (I don't think) but she was great and I always love Jesse Plemons. Pretty confusing, particularly the ending, but captivating throughout. Emma's theory was that it is all told from the Janitor's perspective and that this is all his imagination. I think that's probably about right, and that it's all him wondering what could have been. Also quite scary I thought - the basement and ice cream shop especially. Didn't enjoy it as much as adaptation or Being John Malkovich, more similar to Synecdoche.

title: Fantastic Mr. Fox
summary: An urbane fox cannot resist returning to his farm raiding ways and then must help his community survive the farmers' retaliation.
josh_notes: Charming and a bit snappier than some of Wes Anderson's other films. Incredible animation, looks amazing. Good fun

title: Grizzly Man
summary: A devastating and heart-rending take on grizzly bear activists Timothy Treadwell and Amie Huguenard, who were killed in October of 2003 while living among grizzly bears in Alaska.
josh_notes: First Herzog documentary I've seen. Incredibly well made and edited, Herzog manages to add to Treadwell's fascinating character at regular intervals. He's a friendly wildlife enthusiast, he's a failed actor, he's a recovering alcoholic, he struggles with his lack of fortune with women, he bloody loves bears, he rages against society, he places himself in his own action film, he puts his girlfriend in danger, and then he becomes increasingly arrogant, believing himself to be the only person that could protect the bears (from what?) but most strangely of all (imo) he films it all himself. But to what end? All that footage with no real feedback? To me it seemed that it was most likely to combat his loneliness, and the bears just happened to be the thing he latched on to. A bit like the guy who becomes obsessed with orchids in Adaptation before swiftly being able to move onto something else. Interesting that he managed to capture this period where the technology existed to pretty easily film all this footage, but before he could get it out into the public very quickly. I'm keen to see more Herzog films I thought he really managed to get every last drop out of this subject, with some weird quirky bits too like how he shot the coroner (who just seemed like an off guy). Also I wonder how Treadwell would have done nowadays, I think he might have found his calling on TikTok. "If it doesn't scare the cows, who cares?" I like the Roger Ebert review that says "I have a certain admiration for his courage, recklessness, idealism, whatever you want to call it, but here is a man who managed to get himself and his girlfriend eaten, and you know what? He deserves Werner Herzog."

title: Cairo Station
summary: A newspaper salesman at the train station in Cairo develops an unhealthy obsession with a woman who sells refreshments.
josh_notes: Ahead of it's time with the way it looks at Male psychology, but mainly I just thought it was interesting to see what Egypt might have been like in the 50s.

title: The Truman Show
summary: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.
josh_notes: Prophetic and just the right amount of funny. Sometimes a bit on the nose but maybe that's just watching through a 2021 lense.

title: The Other Side of Hope
summary: A poker-playing restaurateur and former traveling salesman befriends a group of refugees newly arrived to Finland.
josh_notes: Similar in both story and tone to Le Havre, but this time a refugee is taken under the wing of a man that walks out on his wife to buy a restaurant. Deadpan funny in parts, touches of surrealism such as the chef cleaning the window, then leaning through it. Didn't quite enjoy it as much as Le Havre but can't put my finger on why. He tells these stories of compassion very well and simply though.

title: Nosferatu
summary: Vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Hutter's wife.
josh_notes: Interesting to watch such an old film, never especially scary but I did like the shadow of the Vampire going up the stairs at the end.

title: Babyteeth
summary: Milla, a seriously ill teenager, falls in love with a drug dealer, Moses, her parents' worst nightmare.
josh_notes: Boldly directed, good story and well acted. I liked the way it was split into different vignettes/chapters with little descriptions. Moses was especially great. I also liked the little looks to camera every now and then as though she knew everyone was watching her. Didn't overdo them either.

title: The Matrix
summary: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.
josh_notes: Not as complicated as I remember thinking it was when I watched it 10+ years ago. It's a good action film but I'm not sure it goes beyond that really? Especially now that all the technological advances made in The Matrix have been used over and over and probably superseded. Enjoyable still but it's mad how high the rating is on IMDb.

title: The Blue Umbrella
summary: In a small village when a little girl's prescious umbrella is stolen, things goes wrong for a greedy tea seller who was very much interested in buying that umbrella from her.
josh_notes: The rain is beautifully animated and I liked the sentient pavement etc. Weird slowmo bits that don't work kind of ruin it but otherwise it's pretty sweet.

title: Queen & Slim
summary: A couple's first date takes an unexpected turn when a police officer pulls them over.
josh_notes: Great setup, interesting subject well told from various perspectives. Surprisingly romantic given how it starts, the two main characters were great. Sad ending and I was hoping they would get away but I can see why they wanted it to end that way. They do become immortal in a way I guess. But given the young kid had already died earlier on it would have been nice if they had escaped to Cuba.

title: Raising Arizona
summary: When a childless couple--an ex-con and an ex-cop--decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.
josh_notes: Good fun. Exactly what  is meant by a 'screwball' comedy I guess. Nicolas Cage is great and looks weird and old considering how young he must have been. Might go dressed as HI and Ed for a halloween party. I liked the slight surrealness of it

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
summary: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.
josh_notes: One of the better Harry Potter films. Everyone is at a classic age and it starts to be a bit darker. Umbridge is a great baddy too.

title: Wild Rose
summary: A troubled young Glaswegian woman dreams of becoming a Nashville country star.
josh_notes: Cheesy I guess but not as cheesy as I thought it would be based on the first couple of minutes. Still has an edge to it and even though I don't like country music the music was good. Jessie Buckley is great again. I reckon she'll have a shout at an oscar in the next few years. Between this and I'm Thinking of Ending Things she has pretty good range.

title: Unforgiven
summary: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan and a young man, The "Schofield Kid."
josh_notes: I've not seen a great deal of Westerns so I don't have much to compare it to but I really liked it. A great, tense shootout at the end. When Clint Eastwood starts drinking you know it's about to go down. Also I liked the way it didn't portray any of them as outright heroes - nor did it make the killing look easy with the focus on the psychological toll their past lives had taken on them. "We all have it comin, Kid"

title: The Accountant
summary: As a math savant uncooks the books for a new client, the Treasury Department closes in on his activities, and the body count starts to rise.
josh_notes: The storyline was basically alright but Ben Affleck's character was just flat out ridiculous. It felt like the whole film revolved around the title and oh but he also has guns. They did make an effort to make you think at the end I guess.

title: Toni Erdmann
summary: A practical joking father tries to reconnect with his hard working daughter by creating an outrageous alter ego and posing as her CEO's life coach.
josh_notes: Bizarre and ridiculous throughout but manages to find the right balance between comedy and drama. It's basically about a lady so wrapped up in her work that her dad decides to go to extreme lengths to get her to lighten up. Her dad is an all time great character and it's a clever/rare premise. I think the overall message of the film is that no one should have any problem with having fun and I am on board with that. The hairy suit and naked reception at the end is really great. Probably the longest comedy film I've ever seen and maybe will ever see but it doesn't feel too long (although you could definitely watch it in two sittings)

title: The Pleasure of Love in Iran
summary: A couple find their erotic love mirrored perfectly in the architecture and mosaics of Iran.
josh_notes: Short film about architecture and love, made in Iran. Not as interesting as other Varda films I've watched perhaps but still beautiful and meandering. Iran looks amazing in 1976. I think it is an outtake from a feature length film.

title: Saint Frances
summary: After an accidental pregnancy turned abortion, a deadbeat nanny finds an unlikely friendship with the six-year old she's charged with protecting.
josh_notes: Smartly tackles multiple difficult subjects without ever falling into preachiness. Funny and sweet and brilliantly written. Bit of a shame it didn't get an oscar nomination for best screenplay I think it must have had an outside shot.

title: Palm Springs
summary: Stuck in a time loop, two wedding guests develop a budding romance while living the same day over and over again.
josh_notes: Manages to rework Groundhog Day and not make you feel like you should have just watched Groundhog Day. Clever and funny and well cast.

title: An American Werewolf in London
summary: Two American college students on a walking tour of Britain are attacked by a werewolf that none of the locals will admit exists.
josh_notes: Perfect balance of funny and scary. It's a really great premise in that it kind of focuses more on the horror of becoming a werewolf than the werewolf from a victim's point of view. Brett Goldstein always says how sexy it is which I guess is sort of true although I don't think it would have crossed my mind if he hadn't said it. A bit filmed on Hampstead Heath which was cool.

title: Promising Young Woman
summary: A young woman, traumatized by a tragic event in her past, seeks out vengeance against those who crossed her path.
josh_notes: Very entertaining but not as ground breaking/timely/smart as I think people seem to be making out. Really stylish. There was just quite a few bits that I didn't think made sense - the scene where Alison Brie gives her the phone and then basically tells her to fuck off? Strange. When she is suddenly asleep on the road and smashes that guys car? Are we supposed to sympathise with that? Strange. Also kind of out of character as she is really calculating otherwise. The first half or so was brilliantly uncomfortable to watch but I think it loses it's way a bit towards the end, like it had been a bit rushed. All the points it makes are true and smart but it could have been less heavy handed and more effective as a result if you ask me, which seems to be characteristic of a few big films lately (Marvel). Intrigued to see what Emerald Fennell does next.

title: If Anything Happens I Love You
summary: In the aftermath of tragedy, two grieving parents journey through an emotional void as they mourn the loss of a child.
josh_notes: I liked the idea of shadows illustrating emotions that people can't express and also the (sort of) twist ending. Quite powerful in a short space of time. Didn't particularly like the animation style. Won Best Animated Short

title: Julie & Julia
summary: Julia Child's story of her start in the cooking profession is intertwined with blogger Julie Powell's 2002 challenge to cook all the recipes in Child's first book.
josh_notes: Starts off alright but then gets a bit boring. Well acted and stuff but not a lot happens and it wasn't one of those food films where the food really looks amazing.

title: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
summary: A world-class playboy and part-time secret agent from the 1960s emerges after thirty years in a cryogenic state to battle with his nemesis Dr. Evil.
josh_notes: Hasn't aged as badly as you might expect. Shame that there isn't really any comedy films in the same vein around at the moment. That kind of silly spoof stuff seems to have died out for a bit.

title: Bad Trip
summary: This mix of a scripted buddy comedy road movie and a real hidden camera prank show follows the outrageous misadventures of two buds stuck in a rut who embark on a cross-country road trip to NYC. The storyline sets up shocking real...
josh_notes: Inventive reworking of Jackass type pranks although a little less extreme for the most part. Clever the way they work a story into it. The best pranks trn out to be the ones where you're just seeing how people react to movie-type stories playing out in real life. E.g. the diner scene, the car mechanic bit when he sees his crush and the car accident. Funny. Bad name.

title: The Red Turtle
summary: A man is shipwrecked on a deserted island and encounters a red turtle, which changes his life.
josh_notes: The animation is incredible and it is very meditative but I found it a little too slow overall. I really liked the style though.

title: Hot Fuzz
summary: A skilled London police officer, after irritating superiors with his embarrassing effectiveness, is transferred to a village where the easygoing officers object to his fervor for regulations, as a string of grisly murders strikes ...
josh_notes: Even better than I remembered. Nonstop fun. Smart, clever, stylish.

title: Presto
summary: A stage magician's rabbit gets into a magical onstage brawl against his neglectful guardian with two magic hats.
josh_notes: Very funny Pixar short - similar to a Looney Tunes episode. Clever and stuff with the two hats.

title: The 39 Steps
summary: A man in London tries to help a counter-espionage agent, but when the agent is killed and the man stands accused, he must go on the run to save himself and stop a spy ring that is trying to steal top-secret information.
josh_notes: Maybe the earliest Hitchcock film I've watched. Good but not as thrilling as some of his later ones. Wasn't really captivated by the story.

title: Sound of Metal
summary: A heavy metal drummer's life is turned upside down when he begins to lose his hearing and he must confront a future filled with silence.
josh_notes: Thoroughly deserving of it's Best Sound Oscar. Really felt like you could understand what it might be like to go deaf. After leaving the cinema it did seem like you had just experienced his life which is what films are always trying to do. Great performances all round. There was a Q&A with the director afterwards which was really good. He spoke about trying to get a point-of-hearing (like point of view) of Ruben which worked really well. Also he said about how it was rare for a film to be completely first person, which is surprisingly true. Well worth watching.

title: Wild Child
summary: A rebellious Malibu princess is shipped off to a strict English boarding school by her father.
josh_notes: It was close to being nearly pretty good. So many montages. I really don't like Emma Roberts for some reason but didn't mind her in this. There was a few laughs and stuff and I guess she was a wild child.

title: Gladiator
summary: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.
josh_notes: Glad I finally made it round to watching this on the big screen. Very grand and big and loud so it was worth avoiding on TV. Reminded me of Lord of The Rings. Enjoyable but don't feel like I need to see it again.

title: Beau travail
summary: An ex-Foreign Legion officer recalls his once-glorious life of leading troops in Djibouti.
josh_notes: Really hard to describe or even say whether or not I liked it. Pretty unique. Loads of beautiful shots, weirdly hypnotic and rhythmic. Kind of let down by the ending. Will have to watch again in a few years time I think.

title: Logan Lucky
summary: Two brothers attempt to pull off a heist during a NASCAR race in North Carolina.
josh_notes: Amazing cast - really entertaining heist film. Clever and funny, probably preferred it to Ocean's Eleven tbh.

title: Boogie Nights
summary: Back when sex was safe, pleasure was a business and business was booming, an idealistic porn producer aspires to elevate his craft to an art when he discovers a hot young talent.
josh_notes: Really funny, incredible cast - so many good performances - John C Reilly, Mark Wahlberg, Heather Graham, Philip Seymour Hoffman, The Colonel as he looks at Dirk's dong, etc. First half is really good fun as well, the music is nonstop bangers for the first hour or so. Very excited to watch some other PTA films.

title: The Naked Gun 2½: The Smell of Fear
summary: Lieutenant Frank Drebin discovers that his ex-girlfriend's new beau is involved in a plot to kidnap a scientist who advocates solar energy.
josh_notes: Perhaps not as funny as the first one (and maybe the 3rd one?) but still good.

title: Nobody
summary: A docile family man slowly reveals his true character after his house gets burgled by two petty thieves, which, coincidentally, leads him into a bloody war with a Russian crime boss.
josh_notes: Very similar to John Wick in a lot of ways but with a few different twists etc. Bob Odenkirk is really good, both believable as an action hero and as a boring dad. Very entertaining.

title: L.A. Confidential
summary: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.
josh_notes: Really great characters with great variety and a top cast. I like the way time is taken to understand the motiviations behind each character - Buzz and his anti woman beating, thingy and his reason for going into the police, Kevin spacey and forgetting why he joined. Entertaining all the way through.

title: Cléo from 5 to 7
summary: Cleo, a singer and hypochondriac, becomes increasingly worried that she might have cancer while awaiting test results from her doctor.
josh_notes: Interesting near-real-time premise. Looked amazing, Agnes Varda always has a great eye for everyday people in the background etc. Kind of existential throughout as she wonders about the results of her scan. A lot can happen in 2 hours.

title: Manhattan Murder Mystery
summary: A middle-aged couple suspects foul play when their neighbor's wife suddenly drops dead.
josh_notes: Woody Allen plays his classic character but this time it's in a more intriguing and surprisingly exciting story. One of his funniest performances (that I've seen). Has so many good lines in that mumbly speak-to-himself-to-the-audience thing that he does. Diane Keaton also great and I liked the handheld camera vibe. Weirdly it has really young Zach Braff in it also.

title: Splash
summary: A young man is reunited with a mermaid he briefly encountered as a boy and falls in love with her without knowing her secret.
josh_notes: A really fun film. Weirdly it is responsible for popularising the name Madison, which seems crazy to me. Also nominated for best original screenplay. Tom Hanks is great, as is John Candy. Weirdly adult in a way, why is the mermaid so horny? Maybe just a mermaid thing.

title: Luca
summary: On the Italian Riviera, an unlikely but strong friendship grows between a human being and a sea monster disguised as a human.
josh_notes: Incredibly colourful and more joyful than some pixar films, with less of the heavy messages. Sacha Baron Cohen has a great cameo as a deep sea fish. I liked the way it focused almost completely on friendship. V nice, shame it didn't get a cinema release.

title: Out of Sight
summary: A career bank robber breaks out of jail, and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a U.S. Marshal he has kidnapped.
josh_notes: Some of the best chemistry I can remember seeing between Jennifer Lopez and George Clooney although if it wasn't for that then it might be a bit forgettable. A sexy film for sure.

title: Mystery Men
summary: A group of inept amateur superheroes must try to save the day when a supervillain threatens to destroy a major superhero and the city.
josh_notes: Might have enjoyed it when I was 12/pre Marvel and the reinvention of superhero movies. Not as funny as the premise once sounded. Superhero films tend to be funny nowadays anyway so it probably doesn't land the same as it was intended to.

title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
summary: A young Chinese warrior steals a sword from a famed swordsman and then escapes into a world of romantic adventure with a mysterious man in the frontier of the nation.
josh_notes: Reminiscent of Gladiator in some ways with it's grand costumes etc. Fight scenes are amazing, will have to check out some other wuxia films like House of Flying Daggers and King Hu. Looks fantastic too.

title: Riders of Justice
summary: Markus goes home to his teenage daughter, Mathilde, when his wife dies in a train crash. All appears to be a tragic accident until a mathematics geek, who was also a fellow passenger on the train, and his two colleagues show up.
josh_notes: Surprisingly funny and very nicely shot. The fat tech guy who was in The Killing is hilarious (as are the rest of his mates), and Mads Mikkelsen is as good as he is in everything else. Didn't know much about the film going into it. Weirdly feel-good ending after quite a lot of murdering.

title: Happy Gilmore
summary: A rejected hockey player puts his skills to the golf course to save his grandmother's house.
josh_notes: One of my favourite films from the ages of 12-17 and it still holds up. A proper feel good film. Glad that I still found it funny. It lands right in the sweet spot that other Adam Sandler films from the same time don’t always manage.

title: Hustlers
summary: Inspired by the viral New York Magazine article, Hustlers follows a crew of savvy former strip club employees who band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.
josh_notes: I think it was let down by the original story that it was based on - all the performances were great, Jlo and Wu especially but the storyline never really comes to a head and explodes like it threatens to. It just kind of gets to a point where they get arrested and then ends. Didn't think it was all that visually impressive either.

title: A Quiet Place Part II
summary: Following the events at home, the Abbott family now face the terrors of the outside world. Forced to venture into the unknown, they realize the creatures that hunt by sound are not the only threats lurking beyond the sand path.
josh_notes: Not as good as the first one, mostly because you've already seen the monsters so there it's harder for the film to build tension. Because of that it also wasn't as quiet and therefore not as tense but it was still a good thriller and the premise still holds up. Not sure there should be a 3rd though. Opening sequence was probably the best bit.

title: Collateral
summary: A cab driver finds himself the hostage of an engaging contract killer as he makes his rounds from hit to hit during one night in Los Angeles.
josh_notes: Compelling all the way through, Jamie Foxx is great in his role as the taxi driver, getting more and more scared and reckless as the film goes on. Tom Cruise is also good, he should play more villains and his grey hair looks pretty sick. Great soundtrack and interesting editing too.

title: Little Dieter Needs to Fly
summary: German-American Dieter Dengler discusses his service as a U.S. naval pilot in the Vietnam War. Dengler also revisits the sites of his capture and eventual escape from the hands of the Viet Cong, recreating many events for the camera.
josh_notes: Not quite as compelling as Grizzly Man but an amazing story all the same. Not only is it a fascinating story on paper but the way he gets Dieter to relive it, and watching him remember over and over again without flinching is amazing to watch. The story itself is enough but the way he manages to show us something hard to define about human nature is what makes it into a properly good documentary.

title: Free Guy
summary: When Guy, a bank teller, learns that he is a non-player character in a bloodthirsty, open-world video game, he goes on to become the hero of the story and takes the responsibility of saving the world.
josh_notes: Didn’t quite live up to a promising premise. Didn't really like the score and it wasn't really funny enough outside of Taika Watiti. Jodie Comer and Ryan Reynolds are good but I never really find him that funny. Also it was a bit too long. By no means terrible but wouldn't watch again.

title: American Graffiti
summary: A group of teenagers in California's central valley spend one final night after their 1962 high school graduation cruising the strip with their buddies before they pursue their varying goals.
josh_notes: Almost like a historical document Reminded me a little of Stand By Me.

title: Inherent Vice
summary: In 1970, drug-fueled Los Angeles private investigator Larry "Doc" Sportello investigates the disappearance of a former girlfriend.
josh_notes: Amazingly different to basically any other film I can remember, but not in a Beau Travail different way, more like the whole thing is a hazy dream with the odd tiny detail missing to make it seem like nothing makes sense. Funny and the print looked amazing. Joauin Phoenix is great. Didn't enjoy it quite as much as Boogie Nights. Can definitely see why some people wouldn't like it but depends on your expectations.

title: Pig
summary: A truffle hunter who lives alone in the Oregon wilderness must return to his past in Portland in search of his beloved foraging pig after she is kidnapped.
josh_notes: Could be turned into a crazed revenge thriller but instead it is mostly a more understated film about grief and food. Nicolas Cage is restrained, deep and occassionally funny and there was some very nice cinematography. Liked the line about only having a few things to really care about in life.

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
summary: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.
josh_notes: I was expecting it to be a little slow given the runtime but it really wasn't. Clint Eastwood is unbelievably cool, and The Ugly is great. Music really was incredible, it really pulled you into the film and it also looked great (I think it was a 2003 restoration + extended version). Would love to see the others in the cinema now.

title: Philomena
summary: A world-weary political journalist picks up the story of a woman's search for her son, who was taken away from her decades ago after she became pregnant and was forced to live in a convent.
josh_notes: An interesting story very well told. I like the way it showed two perspectives on how to deal with the crimes committed by the nuns - anger or forgiveness. Multi-faceted and quite moving when she realises her son had been looking for her before she died.

title: Picnic at Hanging Rock
summary: During a rural summer picnic, a few students and a teacher from an Australian girls' school vanish without a trace. Their absence frustrates and haunts the people left behind.
josh_notes: Has a really unique mood to it - unsettling but not in an over the top way. Amazing cinematography. Thought it lost a bit of it's vibe in the last third for some reason but I still enjoyed it.

title: Boiling Point
summary: Two disquieted junior baseball players seek revenge on the local yakuza for attacking their coach.
josh_notes: Hard to follow, quite strange but darkly funny. After reading a bit about it online afterwards I think I like it more than whilst I was watching it. Very deadpan, quite slow with outbursts of violence. Interesting main character and Kitano himself plays an absolute madman. Not quite as good as Fireworks.

title: Erin Brockovich
summary: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.
josh_notes: Uplifting and funny in parts. Enjoyed the relationship between her and her boss. Interesting story and Julia Roberts is really good in it. I liked the biker but he didn't seem particularly convincing for some reason.

title: Force Majeure
summary: A family vacationing in the French Alps is confronted with a devastating avalanche.
josh_notes: Different to how I expected - I thought it would be funnier but it was more a dark comedy, with the humour coming from the way a ski resort could magnify their problems. Felt slightly absurd too. I think it will make a good play depending on if they manage to recreate the isolation/feel of a ski resort. Slightly too long maybe but did enjoy the long shots that you seem to get in scandinavian cinema in particular.

title: The Harder They Fall
summary: When an outlaw discovers his enemy is being released from prison, he reunites his gang to seek revenge.
josh_notes: Firstly, Jay Z was there so that boosts the score a little. Ultimately it was enjoyable but the script wasn't the best and the storyline was annoyingly thin as I thought most of the characters were pretty good. Performances were good, main dude was great, could have done with a bit more LaKeith Stanfield though. Very bold and in your face which I liked. Not sure why everything was so new though - all the sets, costumes etc looked like they were fresh from the shops. WORLD PREMIERE

title: Sliding Doors
summary: A London woman's love life and career both hinge, unknown to her, on whether or not she catches a train. We see it both ways, in parallel.
josh_notes: Sort of clever I guess but also pretty forgettable. I do like John Hannah though

title: C'mon C'mon
summary: When his sister asks him to look after her son, a radio journalist embarks on a cross-country trip with his energetic nephew to show him life away from Los Angeles.
josh_notes: A sweet film about a boy who has to be looked after by Joaquin Phoenix whilst his mum is looking after his dad who is bipolar. Really well acted and captures the feeling of not really knowing what the future holds and having to accept that. The relationship/chemistry between the two main characters is great and the kid is amazing, they really manage to illustrate how an adult and a child can grow to understand one another. Jackroyd pointed out that it's like Big Daddy but in black and white which is kind of true haha. Surprise film at the LFF

title: Hit the Road
summary: Follows a chaotic, tender family that is on a road trip across a rugged landscape and fussing over the sick dog and getting on each others' nerves. Only the mysterious older brother is quiet.
josh_notes: The kid was really great and the first half an hour or so was really good - funny and intriguing but it didn't go anywhere really after that. I was a fan of the music though, especially the scene with the kid sticking his head out of the roof. Iran looks like a cool place to drive around though I gotta say.

title: The Missing Picture
summary: Rithy Panh uses clay figures, archival footage, and his narration to recreate the atrocities Cambodia's Khmer Rouge committed between 1975 and 1979.
josh_notes: Nice animation style, colourful and dream like which is what the VR stuff should be imo - either that or completely realistic. Also liked the idea of using it to show the viewer scenes from his childhood that he didn't think he could capture on film. The old cinema seats setting was cool

title: Azor
summary: Yvan De Wiel, a private banker from Geneva, goes to Argentina in the midst of a dictatorship to replace his partner, the object of the most worrying rumours, who disappeared overnight.
josh_notes: Brilliantly atmospheric without ever being able to say why. Everything and everyone is just very slightly off. Looked great, interesting premise with a Swiss private banker going to Argentina to meet his partner (who has disappeared)'s clients. Interesting Q&A afterwards, mad how much research he had done - pretending to be a banker and meeting clients in Argentina and Switzerland. Worth watching.

title: Compartment Number 6
summary: As a train weaves its way up to the arctic circle, two strangers share a journey that will change their perspective on life.
josh_notes: For some reason I just thought it was all great and I left in a really good mood. Lhoja is a great, well written, not just your average tough guy turned nice, character and I think films on trains just seem to work. Very funny, very claustrophobic for the first 20 minutes or so, partly down to the setting, partly down to her awkward acting and the stress of the whole situation. There is a great shot, that's slightly longer than it might usually be, of their car driving down a snowy road in peace that made me feel suddenly relieved and I realised that I was quite stressed for the previous 15 minutes or so. Really nice ending with her grinning in the car too, you don't know what might happen next but it captured that giddy feeling really well. Quite want to go on a long train journey in Russia now too. Won da Grand Prix.

title: The Lost Daughter
summary: A woman's beach vacation takes a dark turn when she begins to confront the troubles of her past.
josh_notes: Complex, intriguing throughout. Are we supposed to sympathise with her character? It seems like it at first but then you realise she is just like the parents she seems to criticise. But then also she is kind of self aware and maybe even hates herself for being so selfish? Olivia Colman is incredibly hard to read in this which I guess was the point - it was emphasised by a large % of the film being closeups of her face as if the camera was trying really hard to see what was going on in her head. Jessie Buckley was great too.

title: Petite Maman
summary: Nelly has just lost her grandmother and is helping her parents clean out her mother's childhood home. She explores the house and the surrounding woods. One day she meets a girl her age building a tree-house.
josh_notes: As the guy introducing it warned us, it was very charming. A really great premise - what if you were friends with your parents when they were your age, simple but does open up endless questions. Kids were very cute and had a classic walk although not as good as the kid in Cmon Cmon or Hit the Road. Céline Sciamma was there which was pretty cool, everyone clapping made her cry so guess that's payback for PoaLoF.

title: No Time to Die
summary: James Bond has left active service. His peace is short-lived when Felix Leiter, an old friend from the CIA, turns up asking for help, leading Bond onto the trail of a mysterious villain armed with dangerous new technology.
josh_notes: Very good I thought. Funny, didn't feel as long as it was, slightly different feel to some other bond films. As good as Casino Royale. Ana De Armas 10 minute cameo was great - just casually smashed it then shook hands and disappeared. I reckon they should have a long break before the next one now though.

title: All About My Mother
summary: Pedro Almodovar's Oscar-winning comedy (Best Foreign Film, 1999) about a bereaved mother, and overwrought actress, her jealous lover and a pregnant nun.
josh_notes: Sick poster for a start. First Almodovar film I've watched - I like all the colours and the kind of soap operat vibe, think I'll need to see a couple others to decide whether they're up my street or not. Full of very interesting characters - sometimes so interesting as to not really seem real - but good performances and an intriguing story.

title: Seven Samurai
summary: Farmers from a village exploited by bandits hire a veteran samurai for protection, who gathers six other samurai to join him.
josh_notes: Well worth watching on the big screen, despite being 4 hours including interval, it never really felt like it. Really liked the main guy, the quiet guy and the crazy guy especially. Quite funny in parts too which I wasn't expecting.

title: The Card Counter
summary: Redemption is the long game in Paul Schrader's THE CARD COUNTER. Told with Schrader's trademark cinematic intensity, the revenge thriller tells the story of an ex-military interrogator turned gambler haunted by the ghosts of his p...
josh_notes: Pretty similar to his last film First Reformed with Ethan Hawke but nowhere near as good in my opinion. Tortured guy drinks and writes in his journal and tries to find some kind of redemption. Oscar Isaac is great but the rest of the main cast sucked. Not seen Tiffany Haddish in a serious role before and she really came across like she was 'acting' -her tone was all weird for some reason. Didn't really have a lot of resolution at the end either and couldn't really understand the main guy's motivations a lot of the time. Cool opening credit font though

title: Heat
summary: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.
josh_notes: Al Pacino is great, quite Nicolas Cagey with his random outbursts - especially the scene when he finds his wife cheating on him with Ralph(?). Great script, mad shootout with the failed bank heist, pretty violent, great ending scene. I liked the way it went into quite a lot of detail into the main characters family lives and relationships with their partners - it really made them feel more real than in similar crime films.

title: Little Women
summary: Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.
josh_notes: Well directed and absorbing. Acting all brilliant, especially Saoirse Ronan. Cleverly directed with the different timelines e.g. Beth's death.

title: A Simple Plan
summary: Three blue-collar acquaintances come across millions of dollars in lost cash and make a plan to keep their find from the authorities, but it isn't long before complications and mistrust weave their way into the plan.
josh_notes: Very similar to Fargo, both in premise (do gooder commits crime and it escalates) and setting (snowy) but more tense. BillyBobThornton is great as the main guy's brother, a different character than he normally plays. A lot of crows.

title: The French Dispatch
summary: A love letter to journalists set in an outpost of an American newspaper in a fictional twentieth century French city that brings to life a collection of stories published in "The French Dispatch Magazine".
josh_notes: Outrageous cast, more Wes Anderson-esque than ever - if you don't like him, you will not like this film. Perhaps more forgettable for it's short story format but charming and lovely to look at nevertheless. I liked the 1st story about the painter and the 3rd story about the chef best, couldn't really follow Chamalet's one. Jeffrey Wright was especially good.

title: Pirates
summary: Three eighteen-year-old friends journey from North to South London to celebrate New Year's Eve at the turn of the millennium.
josh_notes: Much funnier than I was expecting, nice and short. Amazing atmosphere at the cinema with loads of the cast's friends and families plus crew etc. Great Q&A too with Reggie and the crew afterwards. Great UK Garage soundtrack was a key part of the film, especially the club scene and the scene with them all singing in the car.

title: Beats, Rhymes & Life: The Travels of A Tribe Called Quest
summary: Michael Rapaport documents the inner workings and behind the scenes drama that follows this innovative and influential band to this day.
josh_notes: Interesting - didn't really know a great deal about the relationships between the different members - nor about the Native Tongues and all that. Nothing ground breaking but I enjoyed it and the music was sick

title: Drive My Car
summary: A renowned stage actor and director learns to cope with a big personal loss when he receives an offer to direct a production of Uncle Vanya in Hiroshima.
josh_notes: Perfectly paced, superb acting and quite subtle. Hard to really put into words but it was great. Quite long but not boring. The shot of them holding their cigarettes out of the roof as they drive to her home is an all timer. A lot of long conversations and long scenes which were great.

title: Idiocracy
summary: Corporal Joe Bauers, a decisively average American, is selected as a guinea pig for a top-secret hibernation program but is forgotten, awakening to a future so incredibly moronic he's easily the most intelligent person alive.
josh_notes: The premise is good and the future world that is created is funny, and maybe even accurate but I didn't really find myself laughing all that much. Office Space is far superior.

title: Chungking Express
summary: Two melancholy Hong Kong policemen fall in love: one with a mysterious female underworld figure, the other with a beautiful and ethereal waitress at a late-night restaurant he frequents.
josh_notes: Really good - looked incredible, really stylish and clever and different but not impenetrable like I thought it might be. Lots of slow motion and blur and cool angles. Liked all the characters, and the script - a lot of quotable lines of musings on love etc. The music was also great. Second story reminded me a little bit of Amelie with the quirky girl and also the colours involved. Also a little bit like the short story they talk about in Drive My Car, weirdly enough. Awful people sat behind me though which was annoying.

title: House of Gucci
summary: When Patrizia Reggiani, an outsider from humble beginnings, marries into the Gucci family, her unbridled ambition begins to unravel their legacy and triggers a reckless spiral of betrayal, decadence, revenge, and ultimately...murder.
josh_notes: Definitely longer than it needed to be and surprisingly low on mad fashion but it was pretty enjoyable overall. Lady Gaga and Adam Driver were both great in their own way and the story was an interesting one. That being said I think it could have done with focusing a bit more on her plot at the end, it felt like they glossed over her plan/how she and Salma Hayek were planning on getting away with it/what her endgame was/what it was that suddenly motivated her to do it. Jared Leto was mad, not sure if it was in a good way or not but he was extra.

title: Boiling Point
summary: Enter the relentless pressure of a restaurant kitchen as a head chef wrangles his team on the busiest day of the year.
josh_notes: Absolutely ludicrous how they ever managed to film this in one shot. Very tense, felt like an incredibly realistic portrayal of the stress involved with a night running a restaurant. All the cast were great, especially Stephen Graham and the guy on table 7 who was exceedingly good at playing a difficult customer. Good Q & A afterwards too in which they pointed out there wasn't really even a script! Hope it gets some recognition

title: Morvern Callar
summary: After her beloved boyfriend's suicide, a mourning supermarket worker and her best friend hit the road in Scotland, but find that grief is something that you can't run away from forever.
josh_notes: Very minimal and strange film. Samantha Morton is a great lead - you can sort of see the internal struggles she has as she tries to figure her way through her boyfriend's suicide and the sudden wealth that comes from the book. But she manages to do so without a great deal of dialogue which is impressive. Not quite as good as You Were Never Really Here but has some similarities. Arguably a christmas film even.

title: The Night Before
summary: On Christmas Eve, three lifelong friends spend the night in New York City looking for the Holy Grail of Christmas parties.
josh_notes: Not a christmas classic but funny enough to be worth watching. Especially the bit with Seth Rogen texting Mindy Kaling's guy about his dick.

title: Dead Man's Shoes
summary: A disaffected soldier returns to his hometown to get even with the thugs who brutalized his mentally-challenged brother years ago.
josh_notes: So bleak and grey that it essentially feels like a horror film. Not really enjoyable but very good. Really well edited - clever slow reveal of the brother's death & Paddy Considine's hallucinations. Would only ever work as a British film. Thought it was slightly an odd choice for him to say he was embarassed of his brother at the end - that wasn't the impression given the rest of the time, but maybe he was confessing that so the other guy would feel better about killing him? Not sure. Feel quite tired after watching it for some reason.

title: Strictly Ballroom
summary: A maverick dancer risks his career by performing an unusual routine and sets out to succeed with a new partner.
josh_notes: A proper feel good film, perfectly captures that kind of small town drama/niche community feeling. Very funny too. Baz Luhrmann's best film? Probs.

title: Klaus
summary: A simple act of kindness always sparks another, even in a frozen, faraway place. When Smeerensburg's new postman, Jesper, befriends toymaker Klaus, their gifts melt an age-old feud and deliver a sleigh full of holiday traditions.
josh_notes: Nice new origin story for Santa Claus, imaginitively animated - not many films with this style around these days. Sweet ending when it turns out he visits him every year on Christmas eve. Music was awful for some reason which let it down a bit as the songs were used at key moments.

title: A Fish Called Wanda
summary: In London, four very different people team up on a jewel heist, then try to double-cross one another for the loot, complicated by their efforts to fool a very proper barrister.
josh_notes: Hectic and stuff but not really as laugh out loud funny as I thought it might be. I liked the recurring joke with Palin accidentally killing animals and John Cleese and Jamie Lee Curtis were good.

title: Da 5 Bloods
summary: Four African-American vets battle the forces of man and nature when they return to Vietnam seeking the remains of their fallen squad leader and the gold fortune he helped them hide.
josh_notes: Good, but not quite as good as I'd hoped. Less interesting story and not as stylish as Do the Right Thing. A lot of shifts in tone some of which don't quite work and the modern day stuff looks a bit bland for some reason. Delroy Lindo was really good though and I did like the way it was interweaved with pictures from the war etc. Also I did learn about the Vietnam war.

title: The Last Duel
summary: The Knight Jean de Carrouges must settle the dispute over his wife Marguerite by challenging his squire to a duel to the death.
josh_notes: Great performances and liked the way it was told from three different perspectives - not seen that done very often but it worked really well. Should have been a hit

title: The Muppet Christmas Carol
summary: The Muppets present their own touching rendition of Charles Dickens' classic tale.
josh_notes: Surprisingly I don't think I've seen this all the way through before but it is classic. Michael Caine makes it by playing it completely straight which makes anything any of the muppets do much funnier.

title: The Santa Clause
summary: When a man inadvertently makes Santa fall off his roof on Christmas Eve, he finds himself magically recruited to take his place.
josh_notes: Pretty standard Christmas film, didn't love it, didn't hate it. Not really funny enough though.

title: Muppet Treasure Island
summary: The Muppets set sail in search of treasure, with Jim Hawkins and Long John Silver.
josh_notes: Still has the muppet charm and Tim Curry is good but it's not quite as funny/well done as a Christmas Carol. The music isn't quite as good (although there are a couple of good songs) but it's still all pretty watchable. I wish they had made more Muppets adaptations of books etc. there's probably loads that would work well.

title: The French Connection
summary: A pair of NYPD detectives in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a heroin smuggling ring based in Marseilles, but stopping them and capturing their leaders proves an elusive goal.
josh_notes: Engrossing and well acted. Great famous chase scene although it has since been copied a bagillion times. Quite an abrupt ending which I'm not sure I liked.

title: Thunder Road
summary: Jimmy Arnaud eulogizes his mother.
josh_notes: Surprisingly sad but always pushing the boundary of what can be funny. Funeral scene at the beginning sets up the whole film.

title: Jojo Rabbit
summary: A young German boy in the Hitler Youth whose hero and imaginary friend is the country's dictator is shocked to discover that his mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their home.
josh_notes: First half was disappointing but got better. Sometimes the tone just didn't quite land for me and I don't think it was quite funny enough. I think the imaginary friend needed to be set up somehow. Not as funny as Taika's other films but not terrible.

title: Edge of Tomorrow
summary: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.
josh_notes: Interesting premise, good action sequences and different enough to stand out. Enjoyed.

title: Little Women
summary: Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.
josh_notes: Well directed and absorbing. Acting all brilliant, especially Saoirse Ronan. Cleverly directed with the different timelines e.g. Beth's death.

title: Okja
summary: A young girl risks everything to prevent a powerful, multinational company from kidnapping her best friend - a fascinating beast named Okja.
josh_notes: Jake Gylenhall great as a deranged celebrity vet but not in it enough. The last 3rd was great but some of the rest of it was a bit on the nose. Too often it felt like the cast were just speaking to the audience. Looked good tho and I get the point, which is probably the whole point init/

title: Stand by Me
summary: After the death of his childhood best friend, a writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.
josh_notes: All round great movie about friendship in your childhood. Holds up very well and just felt real. Nice colours too.

title: Sorry to Bother You
summary: In an alternate present-day version of Oakland, telemarketer Cassius Green discovers a magical key to professional success, propelling him into a universe of greed.
josh_notes: Really interestingly directed - loads of cool details such as when his flat is growing and also the cool earrings etc. Funny and pertinent. Felt the ending was rushed or else would have given it an 8.5 or 9. Surreal too.

title: Rear Window
summary: A photographer in a wheelchair spies on his neighbors from his Greenwich Village courtyard apartment window, and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder, despite the skepticism of his fashion-model girlfriend.
josh_notes: Great premise and so many classic shots. The whole idea of someone being stuck in a wheelchair being able to see everything his neighbours are up to is great.

title: Uncut Gems
summary: With his debts mounting and angry collectors closing in, a fast-talking New York City jeweler risks everything in hope of staying afloat and alive.
josh_notes: Fast paced, loud and quite funny at times. Brilliant twist ending really well done. Relieved when I left the cinema. Adam Sandler as great as people had said.

title: Missing Link
summary: Mr. Link recruits explorer Sir Lionel Frost to help find his long-lost relatives in the fabled valley of Shangri-La. Along with adventurer Adelina Fortnight, this trio of explorers travel the world to help their new friend.
josh_notes: Pretty funny, brilliant animation. Really liked the style but I think the story needed a bit of fleshing out/a few changes of direction.

title: Field of Dreams
summary: Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella is inspired by a voice he can't ignore to pursue a dream he can hardly believe. Supported by his wife, Ray begins the quest by turning his ordinary cornfield into a place where dreams can come true.
josh_notes: Enjoyed the magical feel of the movie - a bold film to have made. Didn't totally grip me but I can imagine it being quite affecting if your dad had died. A movie about dreams

title: Psycho
summary: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.
josh_notes: Proper classic. The shower scene really is very well done and the score creates lots of tension.

title: Eighth Grade
summary: An introverted teenage girl tries to survive the last week of her disastrous eighth grade year before leaving to start high school.
josh_notes: Just as good as before - didn't realise how good the score was on first watch

title: Se7en
summary: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.
josh_notes: Well acted, interesting throughout but I think it could have done with having Kevin Spacey in it a bit more. Pacing was a bit off I felt - too slow at the beginning, too quick at the end (most of the murders take place in the last half an hour) The ending is really the key part and unfortunately I already knew what happens which did spoil it a bit. Enjoyed the dark colour palette/look of the film. Also it has aged well.

title: Moonstruck
summary: Loretta Castorini, a bookkeeper from Brooklyn, New York, finds herself in a difficult situation when she falls for the brother of the man she has agreed to marry.
josh_notes: Very funny, classic romcom with Cher and Nicolas Cage. Both performances really good in their own ways, surprised I've not seen Cher in more things. Nicholas Cage surprisingly classic considering it was so early in his career. Really liked the whole character of the moon. Has aged pretty well.

title: Boy
summary: Boy, an 11-year-old child and devout Michael Jackson fan who lives on the east coast of New Zealand in 1984, gets a chance to know his absentee criminal father, who has returned to find a bag of money he buried years ago.
josh_notes: Really nicely shot - felt like it really captured rural New Zealand, felt very real, like something Taika had experienced. Child acting was also great - especially liked Boy's silent brother.

title: Nightcrawler
summary: When Louis Bloom, a con man desperate for work, muscles into the world of L.A. crime journalism, he blurs the line between observer and participant to become the star of his own story.
josh_notes: Nailed the dark tone and subject matter but some strange music choices did detract from the impact a bit. I figure they were trying to emulate an aspirational movie about rising up in an industry but in this situation in a morally reprehensible industry which I get but I just think that wasn't as good as the alternative. Jake Gyllenhall was amazing - so scary and hard to read. Could never quite understand his motives or anything. He was weird and charismatic and it was also interesting that he started as a criminal in the first scene and remained that way throughout. Kind of a success story.

title: Onward
summary: In a magical world full of technological advances, elven brothers Ian and Barley Lightfoot set out on an adventure to resurrect their late father for a day.
josh_notes: Funny but not as funny as Toy Story 3, sad but not as sad as Coco. Thoughtful but not as thoughtful as Inside Out.

title: Minding the Gap
summary: Filmmaker Bing Liu searches for correlations between his skateboarder friends' turbulent upbringings and the complexities of modern masculinity.
josh_notes: Navigated a tricky tightrope between just being a skateboarding movie and becoming something much more serious on domestic violence and how it can be repeated across generations. Manages to do it incredibly well, helped by several really interesting and different characters.

title: Fighting with My Family
summary: A former wrestler and his family make a living performing at small venues around the country while his kids dream of joining World Wrestling Entertainment.
josh_notes: Funny, feel good movie. Much better than it had any right to be, especially given how little I care for wrestling. Florence Pugh was really great as was her brother and Nick Frost was athe funniest he's been since the Edgar Wright movies. Good stuff.

title: Booksmart
summary: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realize they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into o...
josh_notes: Not quite as rewatchable as Superbad always is but still brilliant. Funny, loads of good characters, great cast, great soundtrack and also really well directed.

title: Call Me by Your Name
summary: In 1980s Italy, romance blossoms between a seventeen-year-old student and the older man hired as his father's research assistant.
josh_notes: Didn't quite live up to my expectations but was still enjoyable. Timothee was great as was the guy who played his dad. Looked beautiful and I didn't mind the slow pace but didn't particularly like Armie Hammer's character. When compared to Happy as Lazarro just wasn't as good.

title: Charade
summary: Romance and suspense ensue in Paris as a woman is pursued by several men who want a fortune her murdered husband had stolen. Whom can she trust?
josh_notes: Hasn't really aged all that well and I don't really think the direction was particularly special but it did have a lot of good twists and I enjoyed the plot.

title: Zodiac
summary: Between 1968 and 1983, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.
josh_notes: Although it is long, it kept your interest throughout. Kept looking for a time to go to the toilet but there were no moments to rest. Great cast and story. Didn't even really mind that they didn't catch the killer at the end which in other instances would have left me frustrated. Preferred it to se7en.

title: Groundhog Day
summary: A narcissistic, self-centered weatherman finds himself in a time loop on Groundhog Day.
josh_notes: A classic. Funny, original and somehow not creepy even though it could be on paper.

title: Oldboy
summary: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in five days.
josh_notes: Disturbing story with a brilliant twist. Very intense movie reminiscent of many Hollywood movies that are probably derivative of it. Engrossing throughout. Must watch. Visceral.

title: Vice
summary: The story of Dick Cheney, an unassuming bureaucratic Washington insider, who quietly wielded immense power as Vice President to George W. Bush, reshaping the country and the globe in ways that are still felt today.
josh_notes: Interesting way of telling the story but I didn't quite think it worked quite as well as in The Big Short. Jarring at times (which I suppose was the intention) but I just felt it got in the way of the story.Given that this was about a well known figure rather than a well known story I just think it made it harder to understand what did and did not happen. Great performance from Christian Bale and Sam Rockwell though.

title: The Wind that Shakes the Barley
summary: Against the backdrop of the Irish War of Independence, two brothers fight a guerrilla war against British forces.
josh_notes: Unwavering and informative film about the Irish war for independence. Never seen a Ken Loach film before I don't think so it was very interesting. Some parts I didn't understand because of the Irish accent or lines being muttered but overall it was very interesting and a good story that English people should know more about. Also thought it was interesting that they seemed to leave in lots of lines where the actor had stumbled slightly which I suppose added realism.

title: Blindspotting
summary: While on probation, a man begins to re-evaluate his relationship with his volatile best friend.
josh_notes: Good way of tackling it's issues. Quite funny and the main guy was really good. Some of the rap scenes landed (particularly the final one) some didn't. Manages to balance drama and comedy well though.

title: Sense and Sensibility
summary: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.
josh_notes: Enjoyed it more than I expected. Even funny in parts and plenty of twists. Still find it hard to get on with period dramas though really.

title: Kicking & Screaming
summary: Family man Phil Weston, a lifelong victim of his father's competitive nature, takes on the coaching duties of a kids' soccer team, and soon realizes that he's also taking on his father's dysfunctional way of relating.
josh_notes: The sort of film where nothing really happens - sometimes works sometimes doesn't. has something about it but I kind of felt like they thought the dialogue was better than it was. Feels very much like a film about the director's friends (which I'm sure it was) so it kind of felt like you had to be there.

title: Shrek 2
director: Andrew Adamson, Kelly Asbury, Conrad Vernon
summary: Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.
josh_notes: Pretty much a classic. Not as good as the first one I don't think. Not really any animated films that are quite in the same vein at the moment - i.e. purely a comedy. Weird to see how the animation is starting to look dated.

title: Three Identical Strangers
summary: In 1980 New York, three young men who were all adopted meet each other and find out they're triplets who were separated at birth. But their quest to find out why turns into a bizarre and sinister mystery.
josh_notes: Just a ridiculous story to be honest. The documentary does well to tell it with limited footage etc and keeps a steady pace with a twist every 20 minutes or so.

title: Love Wedding Repeat
summary: While trying to make his sister's wedding day go smoothly, Jack finds himself juggling an angry ex-girlfriend, an uninvited guest with a secret, a misplaced sleep sedative, and the girl who got away in alternate versions of the sa...
josh_notes: A really great cast and set but felt like it was made in a real rush. Tim Key was very funny as he always is but felt like everything else was trying a bit hard. Felt like a list of funny things that could happen at a wedding jammed into a story. Shows how hard it is to make something like 4 weddings etc

title: Big Night
summary: New Jersey, 1950s. Two brothers run an Italian restaurant. Business is not going well as a rival Italian restaurant is out-competing them. In a final effort to save the restaurant, the brothers plan to put on an evening of incredi...
josh_notes: Really enjoyed this film. Surprised I hadn't heard of it before. You can tell it was made with real love for food  which I liked, and Stanley Tucci and his pal were really great. Good twist when it turns out Secondo isn't perfect. Lot's of really clever shots of the meal too - the spinning shot in the restaurant, the shot of the table when everyone is full and the one of the guy singing into the camera. Also the final shot of the omelette cooking is great.

title: Eddie the Eagle
summary: The story of Eddie Edwards, the notoriously tenacious British underdog ski jumper who charmed the world at the 1988 Winter Olympics.
josh_notes: Worthwhile feel good movie. Great story, well told and well acted. Nothing much else to say really.

title: Only Yesterday
summary: A twenty-seven-year-old office worker travels to the countryside while reminiscing about her childhood in Tokyo.
josh_notes: Didn't really get to watch the whole thing but enjoyed what I saw. Especially nostalgic even for a Ghibli movie.

title: Legally Blonde
summary: Elle Woods, a fashionable sorority queen, is dumped by her boyfriend. She decides to follow him to law school. While she is there, she figures out that there is more to her than just looks.
josh_notes: Wish I had seen it sooner. If I had I think it would have reached cult status like Mean Girls. Not quite as funny but pretty close. Plenty of plot holes but none of them matter. Enjoyed it more than I expected (and I did expect to enjoy it). Best part was when the witness' boyfriend stormed out of the courtroom.

title: Primer
summary: Four friends/fledgling entrepreneurs, knowing that there's something bigger and more innovative than the different error-checking devices they've built, wrestle over their new invention. C b
josh_notes: Taking into account it was shot on a budget of $7k and written, directed, edited, performed by one guy (who also did the music) it's kind of amazing. Clever in the way it purposefully confuses so that you are in the same position as the characters. All condensed into under 80 minutes.

title: First Reformed
summary: A minister of a small congregation in upstate New York grapples with mounting despair brought on by tragedy, worldly concerns and a tormented past.
josh_notes: Slow and unflinching. Well acted and great script but I thought a few times it was building to a satisfying crescendo only for it it to stop. Great shot of the whiskey and pepto and also Ed Balq is a villain despite only being in one scene.

title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
summary: On an isolated island in Brittany at the end of the eighteenth century, a female painter is obliged to paint a wedding portrait of a young woman.
josh_notes: Really beautiful throughout, many shots framed like paintings, particularly those from the perspective of Marianne the painter. Great ending when she sees the portrait of Heloise holding the book open on page 28. NICE, great stuff. Slightly confused about the actual portrait of a lady on fire as it's not clear when she painted that, but I suppose it doesn't matter

title: Local Hero
summary: An American oil company has plans for a new refinery and sends someone to Scotland to buy up an entire village, but things don't go as expected.
josh_notes: Incredibly charming and low key, a relaxing movie to watch. Loved Burt Lancaster's character of an incredibly rich, incredibly eccentric (though not in the usual way) oil magnate. Quietly funny in parts with strange moments such as the webbed feet. Peter Capaldi very good (and young) also. Supposed to be coming to the West End in musical form which I imagine could work very well.

title: Top Secret!
director: Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, Jerry Zucker
summary: An American rock and roll singer (Val Kilmer) becomes involved in a Resistance plot to rescue a scientist (Michael Gough) imprisoned in East Germany.
josh_notes: Very very similar to Airplane! with a few extra musical numbers. Some classic gags - the tally chart in the cell, the cow etc. I think it suffered slightly from a lack of Leslie Nielsen but it was still very funny.

title: Under the Skin
summary: A mysterious young woman seduces lonely men in the evening hours in Scotland. However, events lead her to begin a process of self-discovery.
josh_notes: Beautiful and a little haunting. Amazing soundtrack and the story of how they filmed it is great - luring members of the public into the van with Scarlett Johannsen and then making them characters. Lost some of it's draw in the final third I felt. But still a must watch. The score really is brilliant, I must emphasise that. It's like all the noises are just right? Yeah. Especially the one underwater.

title: Shirkers
summary: A woman explores the events surrounding a film she and her friends began making with a mysterious stranger decades ago.
josh_notes: Fascinating story, although I don't feel like they ever really got to the bottom of Georges Cardona's motives. A very strange situation for them to have been through, would have been quite heartbreaking I imagine. Some of the footage of the original film looked lovely.

title: Howl's Moving Castle
summary: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.
josh_notes: Probably my favourite ghibli film so far although I did feel it lost it's way in the final act. The plot became confusingly opaque in a way that the first hour wasn't. Full of imagination and charm. Especially enjoyed the weird flying machines and the animation of the moving castle itself.

title: Mystic Pizza
summary: Three teenage girls come of age while working at a pizza parlor in the Connecticut town of Mystic.
josh_notes: The relationship between the 3 main characters and the character's themselves were the best bit of the movie. Ultimately though not particularly memorable, just missing a little something something.

title: Jiro Dreams of Sushi
summary: A documentary on 85-year-old sushi master Jiro Ono, his renowned Tokyo restaurant, and his relationship with his son and eventual heir, Yoshikazu.
josh_notes: Like watching a magician. Incredibly tasty and inspiring look at dedication to one's work. I found it a little sad that he had spent his whole life doing that one thing, but I suppose in another way quite energizing.

title: American Beauty
summary: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.
josh_notes: Interesting lighting, very stagey. Great all round. Kevin Spacey was great as he usually is - somehow starts off being a bit of a dweeb and then gains charisma. I liked how it kind of portrayed all the characters as having flaws but also no one being completely flawed - even the guy who eventually kills Kevin Spacey.

title: Under the Silver Lake
summary: Sam, a disenchanted young man, finds a mysterious woman swimming in his apartment's pool one night. The next morning, she disappears. Sam sets off across LA to find her, and along the way he uncovers a conspiracy far more bizarre.
josh_notes: Frustrating at times (possibly on purpose) but compelling and ambitious. Full of effort and ideas. A really unique movie and Andrew Garfield is great. Similar vibes to Mullholland Drive (they even cast that guy who gets spooked by the homeless dude).

title: Vertigo
summary: A former San Francisco police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with the hauntingly beautiful woman he has been hired to trail, who may be deeply disturbed.
josh_notes: Didn't really enjoy it quite as much as either Psycho or Rear Window, though I think that is largely down to the story which I just think was a little implausible/confused, particularly in the third act. Really liked the rhythm of the first 70 mins with long, slow chase scenes that are kept interesting by the score followed by action/dialogue. Didn't really understand the third act when he was trying to get her to dress like madeleine - did he really not realise it was her? Why was he so forceful about it? Were we supposed to sympathise with him because he was in mourning? I think it was hard to as you didn't really see them fall in love - he just followed her and they talked a couple of times and then bang they were in love.

title: Roxanne
summary: The large-nosed C.D. Bales is in love with the beautiful Roxanne; she falls for his personality but another man's looks.
josh_notes: Not sure how well it has aged with respect to some of the romantic elements (is it creepy that Steve Martin was the one writing all the letters?) But it is funny and he is as good as ever. To be honest the concept was a bit overly simple for it to be that enjoyable.

title: Over
summary: Over presents a crime scene. During the course of 9 wide shots, we watch an intriguing story unfold. What's happened in this quiet neighbourhood? A murder, hit-and-run, an accident? The reality is profound, and deeply unexpected.
josh_notes: Part of Weareone film festival. Cleverly told backwards through about 10 different shots.

title: The Breadwinner
summary: In 2001, Afghanistan is under the control of the Taliban. When her father is captured, a determined young girl disguises herself as a boy in order to provide for her family.
josh_notes: Beautifully animated, heartbreaking story. Well told essentially following two stories - one myth being told by Parowan and then her reality. The style of the animation was great - particularly the mythical sections which had multiple layers a bit like kubo and the two strings or similar.

title: Do the Right Thing
summary: On the hottest day of the year on a street in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, everyone's hate and bigotry smolders and builds until it explodes into violence.
josh_notes: Unbelievably relevant given it was made 31 years ago (!) the story is scarily similar to what has been happening in America right now what with Radio Raheem being choked by the police and the ensuing riots leaving the neighborhood confused as to what action they should have taken. Very good at getting across how complicated these things are.
