Sal the store owner clearly isn't racist, but you can understand his customer's anger to an extent - it's the way they direct it which is important. Sal obviously didn't intend for Radio Raheem to be killed but if he had just given in to Buggin Out then he would have lived. The violence at the end relieves some pressure but then the next day what has changed? Nothing - as implied by the radio presenter who says it will be even hotter today. Really colourful with a million cool shots and interesting camerawork. A must watch for sure.

title: Annihilation
summary: A biologist signs up for a dangerous, secret expedition into a mysterious zone where the laws of nature don't apply.
josh_notes: Tense, mysterious, maybe let down by confusing ending and science of prism(??). Some very tense scenes and an interesting score though. Not as polished as Ex Machina despite the kind of similar endings.

title: Guava Island
summary: A young musician seeks to hold a festival to liberate the oppressed people of Guava Island, even if only for a day.
josh_notes: Beautiful opening credits - essentially just a long music video but it looks really great. Rihanna surprisingly alright although why does she not sing?? and Donald Glover remains amazingly talented. Interesting to see if they ever make a full length feature together with Hiro Murai. Simple storyline ultimately let it down but it's just under an hour so/

title: Midnight Run
summary: A bounty hunter pursues a former Mafia accountant who is also being chased by a rival bounty hunter, the F.B.I., and his old mob boss after jumping bail.
josh_notes: Not all that original in it's format but really well done. Robert DeNiro and the other guy he's with keep the film interesting. Witty with a few twists. Would like it more but it's been done a billion times since

title: What We Do in the Shadows
summary: Viago, Deacon, and Vladislav are vampires who are struggling with the mundane aspects of modern life, like paying rent, keeping up with the chore wheel, trying to get into nightclubs, and overcoming flatmate conflicts.
josh_notes: Seen it several times now but it is still funny and original. Stu is an all time classic character. Didn’t know until now that it was based on a 2005 short with the same cast (including Stu).

title: The Day Shall Come
summary: An impoverished preacher who brings hope to the Miami projects is offered cash to save his family from eviction. He has no idea his sponsor works for the FBI who plan to turn him into a criminal by fueling his madcap revolutionary...
josh_notes: Didn't land in quite the same way as Four Lions where you could fully sympathise with the characters. I think they needed a bit more emphasis that it was based on a real actual mental story because a lot of the time it just seemed too crazy to be true and that it probably was (if you didn't know)

title: So Undercover
summary: A tough, street-smart private eye is hired by the FBI to go undercover in a college sorority.
josh_notes: Maybe deserves better than 6% on RT but then again not sure how anyone could argue that it was good. Weird that Kelly Osborne is in it. Surprisingly complicated plot.

title: Monos
summary: On a remote mountaintop, eight kids with guns watch over a hostage and a conscripted milk cow.
josh_notes: Amazingly shot gritty film about child guerilla soldiers in Colombia/South America. Some amazing shots, particularly in the mountains in the first half when they are constantly high above the clouds, and in the water once they are in the jungle later on. Great performances from a bunch of non actors and a great, sparse and primitive sounding score.

title: Captain Fantastic
summary: In the forests of the Pacific Northwest, a father devoted to raising his six kids with a rigorous physical and intellectual education is forced to leave his paradise and enter the world, challenging his idea of what it means to be...
josh_notes: Maybe not as funny as I'd hoped but more an exploration of parenting methods? The kids were really good though and Viggo Mortensen nominated for Best Actor

title: The Vast of Night
summary: One night in New Mexico, in the late 1950s, a switchboard operator and radio DJ discover a strange audio frequency which could change the future forever.
josh_notes: Very simple premise, really cleverly done. Made outstanding use of a very small budget. The ridiculously fast dialogue was an interesting tool to build tension in the first fifteen minutes, maybe could have been used later on? Some of the camera work was really great and the long pieces of dialogue - when operating the switchboard, taking the call from Billy and talking to the old lady were great and occassionally very unnerving. Made me want to look away. Interested to see what the director does next. Bet he gets picked up to direct a superhero movie or something. (according to Wiki he has made a revenge thriller about the honeybee industry, so sounds great)

title: Pride
summary: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.
josh_notes: Almost on the verge of being too sappy but somehow it manages to hold itself back. Very affecting and mostly pretty uplifting. When the miners turned up at the end it was great, heart swelling. Even quite funny in parts and a great story I was not aware of of people coming together, even though their cause is different. Everyone should watch, especially at the moment. Shows that just because something doesn't affect you doesn't mean you can't help.

title: Little Miss Sunshine
summary: A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in their VW bus.
josh_notes: A nice, feel good, simple film. Steve Carell was great (in fact everybody was). I thought I would really love it but it wasn't quite as good as hoped, although had a fair few laughs. Similar in some ways to The Way Way Back (family coming together, similar cast, summery) but didn't think it was quite as funny or warming in the same way.

title: The Inbetweeners 2
summary: Jay, Neil, Simon, and Will reunite in Australia for a holiday.
josh_notes: Seen it before (possibly in the cinema when it came out?) Surprised how funny it was second time around. For some reason I expect to not find the Inbetweeners funny anymore but NO. Surprisingly good.

title: Team America: World Police
summary: Popular Broadway actor Gary Johnston is recruited by the elite counter-terrorism organization Team America: World Police. As the world begins to crumble around him, he must battle with terrorists, celebrities and falling in love.
josh_notes: Great because it knows exactly what it is and completely leans into it. More than most films I can think of. It will probably age eventually but still funny this time.

title: Citizen Kane
summary: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance: 'Rosebud.'
josh_notes: Different to how I was expecting - almost like a biopic. Incredible sets and performances, ridiculous to think it was made in 1941 by an untested filmmaker. You can see all the parts that he was experimenting - with the camera angles, lighting, miniature sets and transitions that have all been passed on and used a million times since. I suppose that is what makes it such a revered film. The actual story wasn't quite as interesting.

title: The Great Beauty
summary: Jep Gambardella has seduced his way through the lavish nightlife of Rome for decades, but after his 65th birthday and a shock from the past, Jep looks past the nightclubs and parties to find a timeless landscape of absurd, exquisi...
josh_notes: Won Best Foreign Language Film. Some interesting camerawork lots of fluid shots followed up with stationary ones - very similar to some shots in Citizen Kane as it happens and there was even some similarities in the themes. The shot of him smoking in the dark in bed as he rolled over was sick. Music and performances were great. Opening party scene was incredibly involving, the way it was filmed with different people appearing almost in time with the music felt like a very real representation of that kind of party.

title: Adult Life Skills
summary: Anna (Jodie Whittaker) is comfortable living in her mom's garden shed making funny videos all day, but as she approaches 30, she starts feeling the pressure to move on and "grow up" without compromising her youthful spirit.
josh_notes: Pretty nice all round. Emotional ending. Funny every now and then. Jodie Whittaker ideal casting. Nothing really special.

title: The Big Lebowski
summary: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.
josh_notes: Opening credits are cool. The characters are really great, fully formed but all based on a simple few ideas. Good soundtrack, thoroughly enjoyable really. Not sure why I didn't particularly like it the first time I saw it.

title: The King of Comedy
summary: Rupert Pupkin is a passionate yet unsuccessful comic who craves nothing more than to be in the spotlight and to achieve this, he stalks and kidnaps his idol to take the spotlight for himself.
josh_notes: Surprisingly funny in parts, and up to date in it's commentary on celebrity (particularly the ending). Outrageous how much of Joker was based on it, is that even allowed? Robert DeNiro was great as was Jerry Lewis and Marsha.

title: Tramps
summary: A young man and woman find love in an unlikely place while carrying out a shady deal.
josh_notes: Given the constraints (short, low budget, small cast) I thought it was super. In only 80 minutes managed to tell a full story and get you really rooting for the main characters. Stylish without shoving it in your face. Felt like a very real relationship cleverly developed just by two people doing the odd nice thing for one another rather than any grand romantic gestures.

title: The Shining
summary: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.
josh_notes: Surprisingly scary still and not as dated as I had expected. I did feel like the story was lacking a little bit (maybe that's on purpose). I get what Stephen King is saying when he says Jack Nicholson was miscast as he already seems crazy at the beginning of the movie. It was a great performance but would be more interesting and true to the story if it was about his descent into madness, otherwise what is it even about?

title: Being John Malkovich
summary: A puppeteer discovers a portal that leads literally into the head of movie star John Malkovich.
josh_notes: Just the right amount of weird. Really liked all the low ceiling stuff in the office and the receptionist who had a degree in speech impediments but couldn't understand what anyone was saying was hilarious. John Malkovich was somehow the perfect person for them to be inside. Also Cameron Diaz was really good (and unrecognisable).

title: Tenet
summary: Armed with only one word, Tenet, and fighting for the survival of the entire world, a Protagonist journeys through a twilight world of international espionage on a mission that will unfold in something beyond real time.
josh_notes: Really brilliant in parts but ultimately I think it was just too complicated. Possibly better on second viewing. Great tailoring, acting was good but too difficult to understand without being able to pause and make notes. Also I'm sure there were several plotholes and the motive for the bad guy really didn't add up (as they often don't). Also tricky to hear what people were saying.

title: Da Kath & Kim Code
summary: Film adaptation of the Australian comedy series Kath and Kim.
josh_notes: Funny - just a long Kath and Kim episode really.

title: Memento
summary: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.
josh_notes: Inventive, backwards story telling. Worked incredibly well am surprised it isn't used in more films. Like the ultimate version of an unreliable narrator. Better than Tenet. Tenet is just what happens if you throw money at a clever story like this. They are similar in many ways but in Tenet all the add-ons detract from the movie where Memento keeps it simple (or simple enough). That being said I think there should have been a stronger motive for him to kill Teddy - maybe him making it clearer that he has been using him to kill whoever.

title: RBG
summary: The exceptional life and career of U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who has developed a breathtaking legal legacy while becoming an unexpected pop culture icon.
josh_notes: I'm not sure that it ever really gets right into the subject but it is interesting and RBG is obviously an important force for change. On a separate note I question whether heroism towards a supreme court judge is really healthy for society as a whole. Even when basically deserved I think it reflects badly on the partisan nature of the times.

title: The Emperor's New Groove
summary: Emperor Kuzco is turned into a llama by his ex-administrator Yzma, and must now regain his throne with the help of Pacha, the gentle llama herder.
josh_notes: Different vibe to most Disney films from that era. Funny and a bit mad. Kronk steals the show.

title: Fahrenheit 11/9
summary: Filmmaker Michael Moore examines the current state of American politics, particularly the Donald Trump presidency and gun violence, while highlighting the power of grassroots democratic movements.
josh_notes: Good documentary - first Michael Moore one I have seen. Came to some different conclusions than I anticipated ( I feel like I knew why Trump had managed to get elected but clearly didn't know the full picture) Stuff about teachers having to wear fitbits and do a certain number of steps to get health insurance was INSANE and Obama didn't look good at the flint stuff.

title: Inside Llewyn Davis
summary: A week in the life of a young singer as he navigates the Greenwich Village folk scene of 1961.
josh_notes: As the reviews say, this is very melancholy. Great soundtrack, even though it isn't realllllllly my kind of music. Captures the struggles of an artist pretty well but I thought maybe it would work better if he had a bit more about him but was still turned down? Not sure but maybe that was the point. The performances were all great

title: The 40-Year-Old Virgin
summary: Goaded by his buddies, a nerdy guy who's never "done the deed" only finds the pressure mounting when he meets a single mother.
josh_notes: Absolutely outrageous cast and some iconic scenes. A classic of the era. Waxing scene is hilarious and it's a sweet story in some ways - doesn't just point and laugh at Steve Carell like it could. End dance scene is so good.

title: Memories of Murder
summary: In a small Korean province in 1986, two detectives struggle with the case of multiple young women being found raped and murdered by an unknown culprit.
josh_notes: Despite being really pretty dark, Bong still finds a way of making it funny. Not just funny in places but pretty consistently funny, Song's character is all over the place and his performance is great. The flying kicks are the best flying kicks I've personally seen and the whole thing looked brilliant and dark. Quite scary in places, walking back in the rain was unnerving given all the murders take place in the rain. All round fantastic film.

title: Spirited Away
summary: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches and spirits, a world where humans are changed into beasts.
josh_notes: Overtakes Howl's Moving Castle as my favourite Ghibli film mainly because the story just moves along a little better. Incredibly imaginative and beautiful to look at. Some good funny side characters like the giant baby/rat and the Duck spirits. Very good.

title: Borat
summary: Kazakh TV talking head Borat is dispatched to the United States to report on the greatest country in the world. With a documentary crew in tow, Borat becomes more interested in locating and marrying Pamela Anderson.
josh_notes: Crude and brilliant. Funny throughout even if every single joke doesn't land. Basically as outreageous as I remember. I wonder if it would work now in the same way what with everyone having camera phones? Guess will find out with the sequel

title: Kajillionaire
summary: A woman's life is turned upside down when her criminal parents invite an outsider to join them on a major heist they're planning.
josh_notes: Really managed to keep you guessing throughout which I liked. Gina Rodriguez was really good, the film really got going when she turned up. Evan Wood was transformed from Westworld - I reckon her voice was a bit too ridiculous, too deep to be funny anymore. Enjoyably different. Really liked the surreal touches like the death scene and the bubbles leaking down the wall. Was just the right amount of weird without being over the top.

title: Rocks
summary: A young teenage girl finds herself struggling to take care of herself and her younger brother after being abandoned by their single mother with no choice but to live out on the streets.
josh_notes: Moving, incredibly realistic coming of age story. Seemed almost like the audience was just watching a real life unfold. That kind of effect seems quite straight forward but actually must be so difficult to get across. All the first time actors were great, especially in the (presumably) improvised scenes in school and on the train etc. Immanuel was especially brilliant. Weirdly abrupt ending I thought.

title: Another Round
summary: Four high-school teachers consume alcohol on a daily basis to see how it affects their social and professional lives.
josh_notes: Interesting to see alcohol portrayed in the way the vast majority of the population experience it on screen. Surprising that it is so surprising but it is rare outside of high school movies like Superbad to see such a positive spin. Handled all the issues well with Tommy's death and Peter's drama with his wife. Mads is really really great, subtle across a broad spectrum of intoxication and confidence ending in a classic dance scene at the end. The rest of the main cast, also great. Funny and feel-good but also maybe makes a great point? Will start day drinking on Monday.

title: Gold for Dogs
summary: Esther follows her crush from the south of France to Paris at summer's end.
josh_notes: Hard to know what to make of it really. Looked great throughout, interesting enough storyline but it never really pulled me in for some reason.

title: Jago: A Life Underwater
summary: An award-winning documentary about Rohani, an 80-year-old hunter who dives on a single breath descending to great depths for several minutes. Set against the spectacular backdrop of the Togian Islands of Indonesia.
josh_notes: Very simple but must have been incredibly complicated to shoot. Jago is a fascinating guy, would have been amazing to have been there making the film. Beautiful underwater shots and poetic pace. I would have liked to hear more about Jago and how he lived, they didn't go into that much detail.

title: Borat Subsequent Moviefilm
summary: Borat returns to America from Kazakhstan to America, this time to reveal more about the American culture, the COVD-19 pandemic, and the political elections.
josh_notes: Was never going to be as funny or outrageous as the original but it was good enough and said enough to justify it's existence. Occasionally reached the peak of the original for example in the Sinagog

title: Escape from Alcatraz
summary: Alcatraz is the most secure prison of its time. It is believed that no one can ever escape from it, until three daring men make a possibly successful attempt at escaping from one of the most infamous prisons in the world.
josh_notes: Tense and moody (mainly down to Clint Eastwood just being moody anyway) but I never felt like there was any real sense of jeopardy. It always seemed like the plan would be successful and didn't seem like Wolf was going to do Frank any damage. Probably ended a little quickly too. It was entertaining for sure just not quite as much as I anticipated. Also the real life plan was marginally more complicated and interesting so not sure why they didn't tell that.

title: The Personal History of David Copperfield
summary: A modern take on Charles Dickens's classic tale of a young orphan who is able to triumph over many obstacles.
josh_notes: Full of whimsy but never takes itself too seriously. Funnier than The Death of Stalin I thought and more well rounded. Really amazing cast - Daisy May Cooper and Hugh Laurie especially (and Dev Patel)

title: Le Havre
summary: When an African boy arrives by cargo ship in the port city of Le Havre, an aging shoe shiner takes pity on the child and welcomes him into his home.
josh_notes: First time I have seen a Aki Kaurismäki film - thoroughly enjoyed it. Simple, smart, with a message that isn't hammered into you but rather presented as obviously the right thing to do. I liked the deadpan acting (not quite as deadpan as I had expected) and still camerawork, the light and shade lighting and non-vibrant colours. V good and quite uplifting/inspirational.

title: Fireworks
summary: Nishi leaves the police in the face of harrowing personal and professional difficulties. Spiraling into depression, he makes questionable decisions.
josh_notes: Violent but never gratuitously so. Sparse dialogue at times which I liked. Couldn't follow it at the beginning - wasn't sure if the guy with sunglasses was also the main guy which was my fault really. Well directed and stuff just didn't quite land for me. Would like to watch it again though.

title: Alien
summary: The crew of a commercial spacecraft encounters a deadly lifeform after investigating an unknown transmission.
josh_notes: Really well designed in every way - good array of characters (although part of me things some of them are just too thick), amaing set design, and alien design. Hasn't really dated much at all. Sigourney Weaver a great hero. Also glad they saved the cat.

title: Make Up
summary: On a remote holiday park in Cornwall, a young woman is drawn into a mysterious obsession when she suspects her boyfriend has cheated on her.
josh_notes: Spooky vibes in Cornwall. Doesn't quite go where you think it will and has a lot of clever bits that can be read in different ways. Never fully reaches the spooky climax that it could though.

title: National Treasure
summary: A historian races to find the legendary Templar Treasure before a team of mercenaries.
josh_notes: Surprising how bad the reviews were looking back as it is fairly well loved now. Just a fun adventure movie of which their aren't that many. I don't think the plot was really really outlandish relative to similar films. Nicolas Cage is always worth watching

title: Silence
summary: In the 17th century, two Portuguese Jesuit priests travel to Japan in an attempt to locate their mentor, who is rumored to have committed apostasy, and to propagate Catholicism.
josh_notes: Beautiful examination of how far faith can take you and how everyone will interpret it slightly differently.

title: The Bourne Identity
summary: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.
josh_notes: Extremely watchable, great action sequences with a bit of wit thrown in as well as an intriguing plot. Like if James Bond was more good imo. Has been emulated numerous times since and it's influence can clearly be seen.

title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum
summary: John Wick is on the run after killing a member of the international assassins' guild, and with a $14 million price tag on his head, he is the target of hit men and women everywhere.
josh_notes: Watched next to compare with Bourne - The fight scenes are similarly inventive but way more silly and more violent. John Wick's killcount must be in the 100s. Looks great and the choreography is amazing. Some classic (and pretty gruesome) deaths like the stabbing in the eye, the horse kicks and the karate chop on the spine of a book.They've really found a good formula and run as far as they can with it

title: Love Actually
summary: Follows the lives of eight very different couples in dealing with their love lives in various loosely interrelated tales all set during a frantic month before Christmas in London, England.
josh_notes: Everytime you watch it you have a different storyline. Manages to get you interested in nearly every character/storyline which is pretty impressive given how many there are. Some of the script is a bit shaky but that doesn't really affect the film.

title: The Da Vinci Code
summary: A murder inside the Louvre, and clues in Da Vinci paintings, lead to the discovery of a religious mystery protected by a secret society for two thousand years, which could shake the foundations of Christianity.
josh_notes: There were a few bits when I felt like it could have made a good movie but overall it seemed too silly - like National Treasure without the self-awareness/Nicolas Cage. The overall plot would be interesting in itself and it was entertaining mostly but just not really good? Also - too long.

title: Easy A
summary: A clean-cut high school student relies on the school's rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.
josh_notes: It's a fun movie with a good cast but it never gets close to Superbad/Eighth Grade/Booksmart etc. Just isn't quite funny enough consistently enough and some of the narration style sort of grates with me. That said it does tackle a different premise to most Teen films.

title: The Bourne Supremacy
summary: When Jason Bourne is framed for a CIA operation gone awry, he is forced to resume his former life as a trained assassin to survive.
josh_notes: Similar to the first one but everything is just slightly better. The watching Pam bits are classic. Better action scenes too - less silly.

title: The Lighthouse
summary: Two lighthouse keepers try to maintain their sanity while living on a remote and mysterious New England island in the 1890s.
josh_notes: Moody and dark and funny. The black and white looks amazing, (especially the shots of the light in the bedroom at the start and Willem Defoe being buried) not sure the film would even have worked in colour. Top tier perfomances. Good farting

title: Stories We Tell
summary: A film that excavates layers of myth and memory to find the elusive truth at the core of a family of storytellers.
josh_notes: Very cleverly told story involving her whole family. Less about the story itself and more about the way in which memory and storytelling works (with a few twists for good measure). Would be interested to see anyone's life story told in this way really.

title: Christmas with the Kranks
summary: With their daughter, Blair, away in Peru, Luther and Nora Krank decide to skip Christmas all together until she decides to come home, causing an uproar when they have to celebrate it at the last minute.
josh_notes: Rubbish christmas movie with a good cast. What is the message? Christmas is only Christmas if you spend a fortune on it? Help your awful, rich neighbours when they need to throw a Christmas party last minute? No idea who's side we are supposed to be on. Also fails to be funny at any point which really kills it.

title: Rare Exports
summary: In the depths of the Korvatunturi mountains, 486 meters deep, lies the closest ever guarded secret of Christmas. The time has come to dig it up. This Christmas everyone will believe in Santa Claus.
josh_notes: Surprisingly dark but also with a bit of deadpan humour. Interesting story that is almost a parody of horror films when undead beasts are awaken but it is always serious about it. A good premise that is well shot and looks really nice too. If you were a kid you'd be scared of Santa forever though. Surprised it hasn't been remade in English (not that it needs it, but it would do well)

title: La haine
summary: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.
josh_notes: Intense, in your face, smart, funny, brilliant. Looks amazing throughout with some really cool shots (Flying one, shot alongside the cars when they're trying to steal one, massive dolly zoom, when they're peeing in the bathroom and with the mirror). Mad ending as well, was good to watch with an audience because it's quite sudden and then silence and you could feel the quiet in the cinema.

title: Galaxy Quest
summary: The alumni cast of a space opera television series have to play their roles as the real thing when an alien race needs their help. However, they also have to defend both Earth and the alien race from a reptilian warlord.
josh_notes: Wasn't quite as funny as I remembered but the premise is top tier and it's a brilliant cast.

title: Miracle on 34th Street
summary: A lawyer and a little girl must prove that a man claiming to be Santa Claus is the real thing.
josh_notes: Feel like after the court case they should have focused more on the magic that people were believing in Santa (like they do in Elf) and less on the girl getting all her wishes (including a massive house). I think that is the key source of emotion in the film, not the if you believe in Santa you get rich message that it sort of descends into in the end. Otherwise it is very nice and Richard Attenborough is an amazing Santa.

title: Batman Returns
summary: While Batman deals with a deformed man calling himself the Penguin wreaking havoc across Gotham with the help of a cruel businessman, a female employee of the latter becomes the Catwoman with her own vendetta.
josh_notes: Dark as batman should be and also pretty funny, probably the Tim Burton film I have enjoyed most. Michael Keaton isn't really a great batman but Michelle Pfeiffer is great and Danny DeVito is scary and mad and also great.

title: Dick Johnson Is Dead
summary: A daughter helps her father prepare for the end of his life.
josh_notes: Incredibly intimate, sad and often funny. A good way to look at dementia (if there is one) and death. If you're a filmmaker and you know death is coming you may as well do something with it ! Inventive throughout but especially with the funeral ending, which destroyed me. As an aside, I'm not sure if the horn was intentionally funny but either way I'd like it at my funeral. It helped cut through the crying. The whole thing seemed like a nice way to remember her dad

title: Die Hard
summary: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.
josh_notes: Deservedly a classic - surprised I have't seen it before frankly. One of those films that has a bit of everything. Also it has not dated at all, in part because there are so many poor imitations of it. Surprisingly funny and also clearly a Christmas film.

title: It's a Wonderful Life
summary: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.
josh_notes: It's a wonderful film.

title: Soul
summary: After landing the gig of a lifetime, a New York jazz pianist suddenly finds himself trapped in a strange land between Earth and the afterlife.
josh_notes: Looks amazing - would love to have seen it in the cinema (or even on a bigger TV). Funny and great in parts but can't help but feel that it is much more muddled and even a little unfinished compared with Pixar's best efforts.

title: Singin' in the Rain
summary: A silent film star falls for a chorus girl just as he and his delusionally jealous screen partner are trying to make the difficult transition to talking pictures in 1920s Hollywood.
josh_notes: Normally I'm pretty anti-dance but the dances in this are really really great. A funny, happy film, more enjoyable than I thought it would be. Good songs too.

title: Frances Ha
summary: A New York woman apprentices for a dance company and throws herself headlong into her dreams, even as the possibility of realizing them dwindles.
josh_notes: Always enjoy films that really focus on friendship and this does it really well. The score is great and varied and different, much funnier than Noah Baumbach's other films I've watched. Funny and sad and Greta Gerwig is charming.

title: Mary Poppins Returns
summary: A few decades after her original visit, Mary Poppins, the magical nanny, returns to help the Banks siblings and Michael's children through a difficult time in their lives.
josh_notes: Mostly captured magical nature of original. Most songs not all that memorable but fun and Dick VD cameo v good.

title: Free Solo
summary: Alex Honnold faces the biggest challenge of his career, climbing El Capitan in Yosemite National Park. He pursues it Free Solo which means climbing without a rope and alone.
josh_notes: Surprisingly funny and palm sweatingly tense. Crazy doco and even interesting emotionally with the dudes girlfriend

title: Dumplin'
summary: Willowdean ('Dumplin'), the plus-size teenage daughter of a former beauty queen, signs up for her mom's Miss Teen Bluebonnet pageant as a protest that escalates when other contestants follow her footsteps, revolutionizing the page...
josh_notes: Feel-good and a slightly different take on a high school bullying movie. Jennifer Anniston also good

title: I Don't Feel at Home in This World Anymore
summary: When a depressed woman is burgled, she finds a new sense of purpose by tracking down the thieves alongside her obnoxious neighbour. But they soon find themselves dangerously out of their depth against a pack of degenerate criminals.
josh_notes: Dark revenge thriller comedy - nicely shot with a dark palette despite being pretty upbeat in a weird way. Funny in parts and very watchable but story could have done with some twists and whatnot. Also directed Blue Ruin and Green Room.

title: Touch of Evil
summary: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping and police corruption in a Mexican border town.
josh_notes: Orson Welles movie from the 50s - amazingly shot  and an interesting watch but soundtrack lacking and some odd overacting in the middle ruined it a little. Story good if a little predictable and dated.

title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
director: Bob Persichetti, Peter Ramsey, Rodney Rothman
summary: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.
josh_notes: Amazing animation but a little relentless. Funny but not really worth seeing at the cinema. Surprisingly complicated storyline.

title: Sour Grapes
summary: Documentary about the fine and rare wine auction market centering around a counterfeiter who befriended the rich and powerful and sold millions of dollars of fraudulent wine through the top auction houses.
josh_notes: Intriguing story from the underworld of wine auctions. Very well made documentary that successfully brings together lots of separate parties in a coherent narrative. Story just runs out of steam at the end but worth a watch.

title: American Psycho
summary: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.
josh_notes: Reasonably funny in it's surrealism despite it's dark subject matter. Christian Bale is amazing and also somewhat like Dave.

title: About a Boy
summary: Will, who attends single parent meetings to woo women, meets Marcus, a troubled 12-year-old boy. As they become friends, Will learns to be responsible while he helps Marcus with his studies.
josh_notes: Uplifting story and reasonably funny. Hard to believe that Hugh Grant would be so easily forgiven for making up a baby to bang girls though.

title: The Breaker Upperers
summary: For the right price, BFFs Jen and Mel will ruthlessly end any romance. But when one grows a conscience, it threatens to derail their relationship.
josh_notes: Good premise but ultimately could have just been a ten minute sketch of how to break up couples in funny ways

title: Searching
summary: After his teenage daughter goes missing, a desperate father tries to find clues on her laptop.
josh_notes: Interestingly shot movie about a guy tracing his missing daughter using her laptop etc. all shown from the perspective of various screens. Good twists and turns

title: Can You Ever Forgive Me?
summary: When Lee Israel falls out of step with current tastes, she turns her art form to deception.
josh_notes: Well acted , interesting plot, yeah, good.

title: Risky Business
summary: A Chicago teenager is looking for fun at home while his parents are away, but the situation quickly gets out of hand.
josh_notes: Pretty dated both in storyline and the way it looks. Worth watching only to see Tom Cruise as a baby coolboi

title: Zapped!
summary: A high school science nerd gains telekinetic powers after a laboratory accident and uses them for revenge upon bullies.
josh_notes: Worthwhile watch as always. Terrible in so many ways but entertaining in so many others.

title: Roma
summary: A year in the life of a middle-class family's maid in Mexico City in the early 1970s.
josh_notes: Beautifully shot, moving and occasionally harrowing portrait of a maid working for a wealthy family in Mexico City

title: Eighth Grade
summary: An introverted teenage girl tries to survive the last week of her disastrous eighth grade year before leaving to start high school.
josh_notes: Funny and (I think) very accurate portrait of being 14/15. Well acted and the kid (gabe) she hangs out with at the end is hilarious. Brilliant

title: Sing Street
summary: A boy growing up in Dublin during the 1980s escapes his strained family life by starting a band to impress the mysterious girl he likes.
josh_notes: A boy sent to a bad school after his parents go broke forms a band to impress a girl. Started really well but after a while the music went really downhill and was no longer believably set in the 80s. The band starts off playing cool music but ends up sounding a bit too much like Mcfly for their popularity to be believed. The film ends up focusing too much on the girl and not enough on the characters in the band who are more interesting/fun if you ask me. Also the ending not totally believable/didn't make a lot of sense.

title: The Perfect Man
summary: A lonely mother begins receiving romantic e-mails from a secret admirer, unaware that this perfect man is really a creation of her daughter who is trying to cheer her up.
josh_notes: Pretty classic Hillary Duff movie. Storyline was pretty unbelievable but funny because of how bad it was.

title: Sometimes Always Never
summary: A detective fantasy / family drama where a love of words helps a father reconnect with a missing son.
josh_notes: Bill Nighy brilliantly deadpan in a movie about scrabble and family relationships. Interestingly shot and occasionally deliberately dated (e.g. driving scenes) which gave it a unique style. V enjoyable

title: The Guilty
summary: A police officer assigned alarm dispatch duty enters a race against time when he answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman.
josh_notes: Brilliantly tense film about an emergency services call centre in Denmark. All takes place in one room as the main dude Asger answers calls. The story twists a few times and you find yourself imagining what is going on at the other end of the line. Superbly told at a relentless pace. Amazing how at the end of the film you feel like you've seen all the events that take place on the other end of the phone.

title: This Is Spinal Tap
summary: Spinal Tap, one of England's loudest bands, is chronicled by film director Marty DiBergi on what proves to be a fateful tour.
josh_notes: Classic cult comedy mockumentary about a fake band. V funny etc etc

title: Four Lions
summary: Four incompetent British terrorists set out to train for and commit an act of terror.
josh_notes: Classic terrorist satire. As funny and perfectly balanced as ever.

title: Border
summary: A customs officer who can smell fear develops an unusual attraction to a strange traveler while aiding a police investigation which will call into question her entire existence.
josh_notes: Weird and unnerving Swedish fantasy about an outcast with a heightened sense of smell that learns she is a troll. Not an enjoyable watch - emotional but hard to empathise with such odd looking things. A hard watch too given lots of the subject matter. Too much growling and a horrifying sex scene make this a bad watch.

title: Some Like It Hot
summary: After two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.
josh_notes: As expected it was a little dated - Marilyn Monroe's character is a bit desperate and dim but it's still funny and you can understand why it is a classic.

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
summary: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.
josh_notes: Mad, bloody and entertaining. Stylish and interesting to watch now when so much of it has been parodied/copied in other films/tv etc.

title: Us
summary: A family's serene beach vacation turns to chaos when their doppelgängers appear and begin to terrorize them.
josh_notes: Tense and scary (particularly in the first half) but still entertaining. Interesting themes and allegorical storylines. Funny at times which helped relieve some of the tension. Very good but perhaps not quite as enjoyable as get out.

title: Airplane!
director: Jim Abrahams, David Zucker, Jerry Zucker
summary: After the crew becomes sick with food poisoning, a neurotic ex-fighter pilot must land a commercial airplane full of passengers safely.
josh_notes: Airplane!

title: Hanna
summary: A sixteen-year-old girl who was raised by her father to be the perfect assassin is dispatched on a mission across Europe, tracked by a ruthless intelligence agent and her operatives.
josh_notes: Relentless thriller about Saoirse Ronan trying to get from Morocco to Berlin without being caught by the CIA. Interesting storyline but never really fully explains her past. Her performance great. Shot with lots of cuts and loud music which mostly works but ocassionaly detracts from the action scenes I thought. Director also directed Darkest Hour and Atonement

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
summary: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.
josh_notes: See Kill Bill Volume 1

title: Get Out
summary: A young African-American visits his White girlfriend's parents for the weekend, where his simmering uneasiness about their reception of him eventually reaches a boiling point.
josh_notes: Entertaining from start to finish and keeps you guessing. Funny too

title: When Harry Met Sally...
summary: Harry and Sally have known each other for years, and are very good friends, but they fear sex would ruin the friendship.
josh_notes: Slightly different formula to normal romcoms and quite modern in a way despite the fact it is nearly 30 years old. Enjoyable but not especially funny or romantic to be honest.

title: I, Tonya
summary: Competitive ice skater Tonya Harding rises amongst the ranks at the U.S. Figure Skating Championships, but her future in the activity is thrown into doubt when her ex-husband intervenes.
josh_notes: Surprisingly funny biopic about Tonya Harding. Alison Janney brilliant as her nasty, incredibly pushy mother. Interestingly told.

title: Mid90s
summary: Follows Stevie, a thirteen-year-old in 1990s-era Los Angeles who spends his summer navigating between his troubled home life and a group of new friends that he meets at a Motor Avenue skate shop.
josh_notes: Funny and touching. Extremely cool. Felt almost like an incredibly accurate period piece of the 90s being shot by the cast. The main kid was really good and considering most of the cast are skateboarders they were almost all very good. Really good soundtrack too.

title: Game Night
summary: A group of friends who meet regularly for game nights find themselves entangled in a real-life mystery when the shady brother of one of them is seemingly kidnapped by dangerous gangsters.
josh_notes: Better than the generic advertising would suggest. A few twists and Jesse Plemons is hilarious.

title: The Break-Up
summary: A couple's break-up proceeds to get uglier and nastier by the moment as each tries to keep their luxurious condo from the other.
josh_notes: Pretty average romcom but fairly watchable. Vince Vaughan's character is a bit too much of an ass and there is nothing in the film that makes you want them to get together.

title: Burning
summary: Jong-su bumps into a girl who used to live in the same neighborhood, who asks him to look after her cat while she's on a trip to Africa. When back, she introduces Ben, a mysterious guy she met there, who confesses his secret hobby.
josh_notes: Amazingly shot dark story about a man whose friend disappears after spending time with a mysterious rich dude. Tense throughout for no real reason other than the way it was shot. Use of music was great - barely any in the first half or so so when it was used it had more impact. Lots of brilliant shots e.g greenhouse door, dancing, birds and jogging in the mist. Ending left me wanting a little bit more.

title: Avengers: Endgame
summary: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.
josh_notes: Does as good a job as possible of tying up an extremely complicated universe. Funny in parts (Taika, Thor & Paul Rudd in particular) but a bit lacking in any kind of twist. Also how boring is Captain America? Dullest character ever. Still good overall

title: Tickled
summary: Journalist David Farrier stumbles upon a mysterious tickling competition online. As he delves deeper he comes up against fierce resistance, but that doesn't stop him getting to the bottom of a story stranger than fiction.
josh_notes: Weirdly dark investigation into the online world of competitive tickling. Takes a turn that few would expect. Interesting subject matter although couldn't help but feel that Louis Theroux would have got more out of the interviews.

title: Synecdoche, New York
summary: A theatre director struggles with his work, and the women in his life, as he creates a life-size replica of New York City inside a warehouse as part of his new play.
josh_notes: Relentlessly confusing but never quite becomes impossible to understand. Often witty and the best bits are the more upbeat ones but ultimately quite depressing. Definitely worth watching.

title: Blade Runner
summary: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.
josh_notes: Visually amazing and surprisingly not at all dated. Intriguing storyline and multi layered universe. Probably worth rewatching

title: Long Shot
summary: Journalist, Fred Flarsky, reunites with his childhood crush, Charlotte Field; now one of the most influential women in the world. As she prepares to run for president, Charlotte hires Fred as her speechwriter, and sparks fly.
josh_notes: Really funny and very modern romcom with Seth Rogen & Charlize Theron. Seth Rogen's character surprisingly works really well and they kind of do seem right for one another despite their differences which is kind of why it works. Charlize Theron seems like maybe she should be president? Notably funny sex scene also. A future cult classic perhaps.

title: The Princess Bride
summary: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.
josh_notes: An enjoyable watch particularly the camp moments. Mandy Patinkin as Inigo Montoya is great but the rest of it didn't quite work for me. Disappointing overall given it's reputation and cast.

title: Pokémon: Detective Pikachu
summary: In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective.
josh_notes: Very funny and full of nostalgia. Could easily have been terrible but in actual fact, they nailed it and the likenesses (?) of the pokemon was always spot on.

title: Spectre
summary: A cryptic message from James Bond's past sends him on a trail to uncover the existence of a sinister organisation named SPECTRE. With a new threat dawning, Bond learns the terrible truth about the author of all his pain in his mos...
josh_notes: Pretty typical bond film. A couple of moments where they tried to make it funny maybe but not enough. Pretty sure it's full of plot holes/unexplained plot but cba trying to think about it too much. Completely forgettable.

title: Tully
summary: A struggling mother of three forms an unexpected bond with the night nanny hired to help with her newborn baby.
josh_notes: Interesting portrayal of motherhood and how it can affect. Good twist that made total sense but I did not see coming. Witty in parts. Made by the same guy that directed Juno. Charlize Theron and Mackenzie Davis v good.

title: Office Space
summary: Three company workers who hate their jobs decide to rebel against their greedy boss.
josh_notes: Always relevant, always funny.

title: Woman at War
summary: Halla becomes a determined environmental activist, but this threatens a long-held hope of hers.
josh_notes: Light hearted Icelandic film about a lady taking on big smelting industry in Iceland. Beautiful scenery, clever soundtrack and interestingly shot. Good script too.

title: The Secret Life of Pets
summary: The quiet life of a terrier named Max is upended when his owner takes in Duke, a stray whom Max instantly dislikes.
josh_notes: Not bad, not noteworthy

title: Tropic Thunder
summary: Through a series of freak occurrences, a group of actors shooting a big-budget war movie are forced to become the soldiers they are portraying.
josh_notes: Underrated, amazing cast. Tom Cruise and RDJr especially.

title: The Kindergarten Teacher
summary: A kindergarten teacher in New York becomes obsessed with one of her students who she believes is a child prodigy.
josh_notes: Thought provoking, morally ambiguous story about a Kindergarten teacher going to excessive lenghts to ensure that one of her students talent doesn't go unnoticed. Takes it further than anticipated. For some reason just a bit difficult to empathise with any of the characters.

title: Rope
summary: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party after strangling their former classmate to death.
josh_notes: Hitchcock movie that takes place in a single apartment. Amazingly modern looking - partly down to al l the camera techniques etc that are still copied today. Tense and chlaustrophobic.

title: Alan Partridge
summary: When famous DJ Alan Partridge's radio station is taken over by a new media conglomerate, it sets in motion a chain of events which see Alan having to work with the police to defuse a potentially violent siege.
josh_notes: Future comedy classic, thoroughly rewatchable and densely packed with jokes.

title: Blazing Saddles
summary: In order to ruin a western town, a corrupt politician appoints a black Sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary.
josh_notes: Funny in parts and must have been outrageous at the time of release. Not quite as good as hoped.

title: Young Adult
summary: Soon after her divorce, a fiction writer returns to her home in small-town Minnesota, looking to rekindle a romance with her ex-boyfriend who is now happily married and has a newborn daughter.
josh_notes: Very similar to Tully - similar structure and in the same way, unsure whether enjoying the movie until the last 15 minutes. Twist/revelation not as impactful however. Patton Oswalt funny and Charlize Theron good but overall nothing special.

title: See You Yesterday
summary: Two Brooklyn teenage prodigies, C.J. Walker and Sebastian Thomas, build makeshift time machines to save C.J.'s brother, Calvin, from being wrongfully killed by a police officer.
josh_notes: Some shaky science (although that could be said for all time travel films I suppose) but a different Caribbean/African American spin on a time travel story. Cool soundtrack in parts, some bits I felt were trying too hard to be emotional.

title: Boyz n the Hood
summary: Follows the lives of three young males living in the Crenshaw ghetto of Los Angeles, dissecting questions of race, relationships, violence, and future prospects.
josh_notes: Brilliantly acted, tense and emotional. Great soundtrack and lots of great characters. Top stuff. Also note that the director was only 24 when he made it, fair play.

title: Despicable Me 2
summary: When Gru, the world's most super-bad turned super-dad has been recruited by a team of officials to stop lethal muscle and a host of Gru's own, He has to fight back with new gadgetry, cars, and more minion madness.
josh_notes: Fun and pretty well animated. Minions get a bit tiresome though and there isn't as many good jokes for adults as some other family films. Toy Story 2 a million times better.

title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
summary: A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.
josh_notes: Enjoyable although slightly lacking in romance and comedy. A bit different at least.

title: Despicable Me
summary: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.
josh_notes: Better than the 2nd one as the storyline is a bit more interesting. A bit more peril from the whole recital bit.

title: Infernal Affairs
summary: A story between a mole in the police department and an undercover cop. Their objectives are the same: to find out who is the mole, and who is the cop.
josh_notes: Engrossing despite the relatively simple initial premise. Well made and fast moving worth a watch. The Departed was adapted from this.

title: Red Joan
summary: The story of Joan Stanley, who was exposed as the K.G.B.'s longest-serving British spy.
josh_notes: Very intriguing storyline based on a true story told pretty unimaginitively. Should have been more exciting and Judi Dench should have been in it more.

title: Rocketman
summary: A musical fantasy about the fantastical human story of Elton John's breakthrough years.
josh_notes: Does very well at giving the impression that the story is exactly how Elton John would remember it. Creatively told and Taron Egerton is great.

title: In the Loop
summary: A political satire about a group of skeptical American and British operatives attempting to prevent a war between two countries.
josh_notes: Funny but not quite as good as the series. Not sure it translated quite as well to a movie format.

title: Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging
summary: The story centers on a 14-year-old girl who keeps a diary about the ups and downs of being a teenager, including the things she learns about kissing.
josh_notes: Pretty good coming of age movie from the same lady that made Bend it Like Beckham. Fun.

title: Toy Story 4
summary: When a new toy called "Forky" joins Woody and the gang, a road trip alongside old and new friends reveals how big the world can be for a toy.
josh_notes: Possibly the funniest of the Toy Story films. Animation incredible! Pretty similar storyline to previous films but that doesn't really matter.

title: Hot Rod
summary: Self-proclaimed stuntman Rod Kimble is preparing for the jump of his life - to clear fifteen buses to raise money for his abusive stepfather Frank's life-saving heart operation.
josh_notes: Silly

title: Vagabond
summary: An ordinary man who comes across surprising circumstances that place him in the center of a huge corruption scandal.
josh_notes: Incredibly modern in it's style, moving an well acted. Told in a long series of short moving shots which give the impression you are just passing through the story.

title: Geostorm
summary: When the network of satellites designed to control the global climate starts to attack Earth, it's a race against the clock for its creator to uncover the real threat before a worldwide Geostorm wipes out everything and everyone.
josh_notes: Awful, not even bad in a good way. Story makes absolutely no sense. Why are the astronauts all so unprofessional?

title: I Am Mother
summary: In the wake of humanity's extinction, a teenage girl is raised by a robot designed to repopulate the earth. But their unique bond is threatened when an inexplicable stranger arrives with alarming news.
josh_notes: A well told, simple premise that leaves questions. Stylish and intriguing.

title: Bend It Like Beckham
summary: Two ambitious girls, despite their parents' wishes, have their hearts set on careers in professional football.
josh_notes: Feel good as ever and (I imagine) a very accurate portrayal of a British Indian family. Felt like the romantic ending between her and the coach was unnecessary as the movie was more about her family and friendship with Kiera Knightley. But I mean what can you do?

title: Sky Ladder: The Art of Cai Guo-Qiang
summary: Trace the rise of contemporary artist Cai Guo-Qiang from childhood in Mao's China to global art world superstar, and join his quest to realize his lifelong obsession: Sky Ladder.
josh_notes: Interesting subject matter although not a great narrative structure I didn't think.

title: Happy as Lazzaro
summary: An unceasingly kind Italian peasant and his family are blatantly exploited by a tobacco baroness.
josh_notes: Very pretty and interesting Italian movie. Lazarro was a brilliant character - kind to the point that it's funny and then beyond to the point where it is surreal. Really good watch.

title: A Serious Man
summary: Larry Gopnik, a Midwestern physics teacher, watches his life unravel over multiple sudden incidents. Though seeking meaning and answers amidst his turmoils, he seems to keep sinking.
josh_notes: Farcical and dry humoured. Very coen brothers with it's mildly eccentric characters. V enjoyable.

title: The Godfather
summary: Don Vito Corleone, head of a mafia family, decides to hand over his empire to his youngest son Michael. However, his decision unintentionally puts the lives of his loved ones in grave danger.
josh_notes: Perfect in lots of ways. Numerous great characters, acting is obviously great and the storyline was engaging. Understandably a classic

title: Booksmart
summary: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realize they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into o...
josh_notes: Like Superbad but about girls. Very very funny, superbly written, one of the most accurate portrayals of the kind of slight outcasts the film is about.  Very reminiscent of school which is hard to capture and also surprisingly nicely shot including a beautiful underwater scene.

title: Muriel's Wedding
summary: A young social outcast in Australia steals money from her parents to finance a vacation where she hopes to find happiness, and perhaps love.
josh_notes: Charming and very Australian. Toni Collette in one of her first roles. Funny but not quite funny enough to rank higher.

title: Mr. Roosevelt
summary: After a loved one falls ill, 25 year old struggling comedian Emily Martin returns to her college town of Austin, Texas and must come to terms with her past while staying with her ex-boyfriend and his new girlfriend.
josh_notes: Pretty, charming feel good movie. Nice opening credits, funny dinner scene, has a nice homemade feel to it.

title: We Are Little Zombies
summary: Four Japanese orphans form a rock band.
josh_notes: Uniquely shot, very funny Japanese comedy about 4 kids that meet at their parents' funerals. Nauseating camerawork at times but an incredible variety of shots - almost felt like the director was just experimenting throughout. Close to a 9 but I felt the part in the middle where they formed a band could have been shot better and it was also a little long. Full of video game graphics and the deadpannest of deadpan comedy. Very good. Director won short film prize at Sundance

title: Los Reyes
summary: Chola and Football are a couple of street dogs that live in the Los Reyes skatepark. A microcosm is organized around them, composed of things, animals and young adolescents in conflict with an adult world that they reject but are ...
josh_notes: Documentary following a couple of dogs hanging out together in a skate park in Chile. Meditative and some nice shots. Interesting to see how different people might project different characteristics onto the dogs.

title: The Amazing Johnathan Documentary
summary: What begins as a documentary following the final tour of a dying magician - "The Amazing Johnathan" - becomes an unexpected and increasingly bizarre journey as the filmmaker struggles to separate truth from illusion.
josh_notes: Best seen without reading much about it before hand (similar to Tickled). Very funny and well executed considering the restraints. Probably could have done with about twenty minutes more 'documentary' style footage but I guess that couldn’t be helped.

title: The Godfather Part II
summary: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.
josh_notes: Similar in many ways to The Godfather. Cleverly told with many different stories happening across different timelines at once. Not sure I would agree that it was better than the first but it's very close.

title: Dazed and Confused
summary: The adventures of high school and junior high students on the last day of school in May 1976.
josh_notes: Cool movie, great soundtrack and cast. Not much in the way of a story but an interesting snapshot of that period. Alright, alright alright.

title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood
summary: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.
josh_notes: Does a good job of making you feel like you are in Hollywood in that time but felt a bit like it was made up of a bunch of skits. Great soundtrack but nothing much really happened and it all felt a bit disjointed.

title: What a Girl Wants
summary: An American teenager learns that her father is a wealthy British politician running for office. Although she is eager to find him, she realizes it could cause a scandal and cost him the election.
josh_notes: Pretty classic style teen movie with Colin Firth and Amanda Bynes. Not terrible

title: True Grit
summary: A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.
josh_notes: Beautifully shot, and very well paced. A few great performances and a lovely score. Funny in parts - an all round good movie. Very Coen BrothersY

title: The Farewell
summary: A Chinese family discovers their grandmother has only a short while left to live and decide to keep her in the dark, scheduling a wedding to gather before she dies.
josh_notes: All the relationships between the different family members felt very authentic. Even though you knew pretty much where the story was going it was still hard-hitting when it got there. Surprisingly funny too.

title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
summary: Two overly imaginative pranksters named George and Harold hypnotize their principal into thinking he's a ridiculously enthusiastic, incredibly dimwitted superhero named Captain Underpants.
josh_notes: Although I fell asleep with half an hour to go, from what I saw this was just as funny as I remember finding the books. A heck of a lot of jokes for the adults too. Sock puppet scene was hilarious.

title: Snowpiercer
summary: In a future where a failed climate change experiment has killed all life except for the survivors who boarded the Snowpiercer (a train that travels around the globe), a new class system emerges.
josh_notes: Amazing that such a critically and audience acclaimed film can be so full of plotholes! Why was he so shocked that they were eating cockroaches (and where were they getting them from?) Why didn't they just blow up the train from the back? Why was a child literally the only thing that could fix that part of the train? What was the deal with the club carriage? Why was Chris Evans cast? Aside from that Tilda Swinton was great and the general premise was kind of interesting. Most of the action scenes were good and the whole set design was cool, packing every shot into a narrow train carriage etc. Ultimately pretty disappointing but not awful.

title: Back to the Future Part II
summary: After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip.
josh_notes: Fun and feel good - Pretty much exactly lived up to expectations.

title: Ad Astra
summary: Astronaut Roy McBride undertakes a mission across an unforgiving solar system to uncover the truth about his missing father and his doomed expedition that now, 30 years later, threatens the universe.
josh_notes: Emotionally dramatic for a space movie and visually impressive in a different way than usual. Some surreal scenes, Brad Pitt great and story gripping. Good stuff.

title: Between Two Ferns: The Movie
summary: Zach Galifianakis and his oddball crew take a road trip to complete a series of high-profile celebrity interviews.
josh_notes: Pretty much just a long version of one of the interviews which means it is very funny and lacks any kind of proper storyline. Very funny bloopers reel at the end. Probably would have rather they just released full interviews with all the guests but it was still good.

title: The Nice Guys
summary: In 1970s Los Angeles, a mismatched pair of private eyes investigate a missing girl and the mysterious death of a porn star.
josh_notes: Funny and surprisingly stylish. Quite a complicated plot for a film full of comedy but that makes it interesting and open to repeat viewings. Fast paced.

title: Lady Bird
summary: In 2002, an artistically inclined 17-year-old girl comes of age in Sacramento, California.
josh_notes: Not quite as funny as I had expected but an all round great film anyway. Well shot and full of good performances. Great cast too.

title: National Theatre Live: Fleabag
summary: A rip-roaring look at some sort of woman living her sort of life. With family and friendships under strain and a guinea pig cafe struggling to keep afloat, Fleabag suddenly finds herself with nothing to lose.
josh_notes: Surprisingly similar to the series. Just as funny and well acted, especially considering the limitations of a one-person show.

title: El camino
summary: Elliot, 31, a product of the Washington D.C. foster care system, has spent most of his life moving from place to place. When he is contacted by Matthew, a childhood friend from "the system" dying of cancer, Elliot goes to be by hi...
josh_notes: A nice return to the Breaking Bad universe. I've seen plenty of reviews talking about how it's unnecessary and it probably is but so what. Storyline wasn't bad, some great shots. Forgot how great a character Todd is.

title: Pulp Fiction
summary: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
josh_notes: Cleverly told and enjoyable throughout. Great soundtrack.

title: Joker
summary: During the 1980s, a failed stand-up comedian is driven insane and turns to a life of crime and chaos in Gotham City while becoming an infamous psychopathic crime figure.
josh_notes: Enjoyable overall but let down in several places. Some of the music was really great but there were several occasions where the choice of music was bizarre such as the gary glitter bit and the bit where the Wall Street guys were singing to him on the train (that especially made no sense, why would they be singing? Dumb). Also it was too explicit when talking about his emotions i.e. him just saying I have bad thoughts or saying society has left him behind etc etc rather than showing it. The ending was good (if troubling) although can't help but think Robert De Niro wasn't really trying - some of his questions to the Joker when he was on the talk show having just confessed to a triple murder just seemed ridiculous. "oh how did you feel about killing them lol?". Film did look really nice. Also didn't help that the person behind me at the cinema was talking after nearly every single piece of dialogue.

title: You Were Never Really Here
summary: A traumatized veteran unafraid of violence tracks down missing girls for a living. When a job spins out of control, Joe's nightmares overtake him as a conspiracy is uncovered leading to what could be his death trip or his awakening.
josh_notes: Stylish, short, tense. Joaquin Phoenix much better than in Joker. Movie has just the right amount of mystery - you aren't completely sure what is happening and why he is doing what he does but there is just enough hints to piece most of it together. Score was really really good. CCTV, underwater, hotel shots especially good.

title: Parasite
summary: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.
josh_notes: All round thoroughly entertaining. Funny in parts, dark, stylish, fast paced and relevant. Sets are amazing, great framing. Gets across a similar point than snowpiercer in a far more effective and engaging way. Really enjoyable.

title: Kiki's Delivery Service
summary: A young witch, on her mandatory year of independent life, finds fitting into a new community difficult while she supports herself by running an air courier service.
josh_notes: Beautifully animated as you would expect. Story not especially interesting. Music very good. Disney-like

title: Ex Machina
summary: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.
josh_notes: Really stylish, thought provoking and well acted. Amazing sets and the dance scene is absolutely classic.

title: Melvin Goes to Dinner
summary: Award-winning comedy about a lonely young man who finds himself at a restaurant with two strangers and his best friend.
josh_notes: Did a great job making a dinner with friends into an interesting watch. Almost documentary like in many ways even down to some of the camerawork. Short and snappy.

title: Joe Versus the Volcano
summary: When a hypochondriac learns that he is dying, he accepts an offer to throw himself in a volcano at a tropical island, and along the way there, learns to truly live.
josh_notes: Quite weird in many ways, Great opening 20 minutes with the super depressing workplace etc. Enjoyable because it's so different.

title: The Prestige
summary: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians in 1890s London engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.
josh_notes: Entrhalling throughout, always have the feeling you are beind duped by the movie. Christian Bale's accent is a bit weird though. Also the fact that it relied on real magic (Tesla's machine) wasn't ideal.

title: The Other Guys
summary: Two mismatched New York City detectives seize an opportunity to step up like the city's top cops, whom they idolize, only things don't quite go as planned.
josh_notes: Funny but not quite as funny as I remembered. Some classic scenes - aim for the bushes, and the whole bit with Will Ferrell's wife being plain and a bitch are great though.

title: The Lost City of Z
summary: A true-life drama, centering on British explorer Major Percival Fawcett, who disappeared whilst searching for a mysterious city in the Amazon in the 1920s.
josh_notes: Looks amazing - great and complicated story which would have been hard to get across on film but they mostly managed. Some points felt like they crammed too much in but on the other hand they probably could have made it even longer.

title: Mary and Max
summary: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-year-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-year old, severely obese man living in New York.
josh_notes: Bittersweet, funny and superbly animated claymation.

title: Elf
summary: Raised as an oversized elf, Buddy travels from the North Pole to New York City to meet his biological father, Walter Hobbs, who doesn't know he exists and is in desperate need of some Christmas spirit.
josh_notes: A christmas classic. Funny as always and the bit at the end when everybody is singing in central park is so good.

title: Christmas Wedding Planner
summary: While planning her cousin's lavish wedding, Kelsey Wilson's world is turned upside down when Private Investigator Connor McClean shows up. Connor, hired by a unnamed source, disrupts the upcoming nuptials but manages to win Kelsey...
josh_notes: Weird plot and totally forgettable. Not really bad enough to be enjoyable to be honest

title: Knives Out
summary: A detective investigates the death of the patriarch of an eccentric, combative family.
josh_notes: Really enjoyable from start to finish. Fast paced but quite long and with some great payoffs at the end. Good stuff.

title: A Christmas Prince
summary: When a reporter goes undercover as a tutor to get the inside scoop on a playboy prince, she gets tangled in some royal intrigue and ends up finding love - but will she be able to keep up her lie?
josh_notes: Surprisingly alright - Seemed like it had a higher budget than most of these xmas movies that get churned out and the acting wasn't terrible or anything so yeah.

title: You've Got Mail
summary: Book superstore magnate Joe Fox and independent book shop owner Kathleen Kelly fall in love in the anonymity of the Internet, both blissfully unaware that he's trying to put her out of business.
josh_notes: Holds up surprisingly well I thought. Tom Hanks character perhaps borders on creepy? Certainly a fine line with the way he manipulates her. Could have done with alonger ending where she explains how she feels/has a go at him for lying.

title: Good Boys
summary: Three 6th grade boys ditch school and embark on an epic journey while carrying accidentally stolen drugs, being hunted by teenage girls, and trying to make their way home in time for a long-awaited party.
josh_notes: Pretty much just Superbad remade with younger kids. Very funny in parts though and probably ruder. Perfect for watching on plane.

title: Shazam!
summary: A newly fostered young boy in search of his mother instead finds unexpected super powers and soon gains a powerful enemy.
josh_notes: Slightly more interesting than your average superhero movie although I did feel it wasn't quite funny enough.

title: The Lion King
summary: After the murder of his father, a young lion prince flees his kingdom only to learn the true meaning of responsibility and bravery.
josh_notes: (DNF) - Boring remake - Watched for an hour but it just felt like a shot for shot (but worse in every way) remake of the original so didn't feel like I needed to see the end. Scar no longer scary. What made The Jungle Book remake enjoyable was the fact that it was slightly different to the original cartoon.

title: Ready or Not
summary: A bride's wedding night takes a sinister turn when her eccentric new in-laws force her to take part in a terrifying game.
josh_notes: Simple premise, fast paced, good fun. Main character performance was really good too I thought.

title: The Kid Who Would Be King
summary: Alex, a 12-year-old boy, and his friends fight an evil sorceress with the help of Excalibur, the sword of King Arthur, in a bid to save the world from her atrocities.
josh_notes: A lot of fun, I thought the way they did the magic was really clever and helped reduce the need for special effects. Can imagine 12 year olds absolutely loving it.

title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
summary: Over the course of five social occasions, a committed bachelor must consider the notion that he may have discovered love.
josh_notes: Funny and smart. Didn't feel dated at all which was quite surprising given all the romcoms that have been influenced by it since.

title: A Simple Favor
summary: Stephanie is a single mother with a parenting vlog who befriends Emily, a secretive upper-class woman who has a child at the same elementary school. When Emily goes missing, Stephanie takes it upon herself to investigate.
josh_notes: Incredibly stylish and sharp-looking. Enjoyed most of it but let down by the ending. Feel like it could have made a 9/10 if it had just managed to be a little bit darker/bloodier like it kept hinting.

title: O Brother, Where Art Thou?
summary: In the deep south during the 1930s, three escaped convicts search for hidden treasure while a relentless lawman pursues them.
josh_notes: Looks amazing with all the yellow leaves and fields. A typical Coen Brothers movie with great music. Some funny bits and good performances but couldn't help thinking the storyline was lacking a bit.

title: White Noise
summary: Dramatizes a contemporary American family's attempts to deal with the mundane conflicts of everyday life while grappling with the universal mysteries of love, death, and the possibility of happiness in an uncertain world.
josh_notes: Pretty weird but I liked it. I guess it's about death and worrying about death and how odd the human mind is and how futile/pointless lots of information is. Nice dread filled film to start off the year. Adam Driver is great as always. Maybe Greta Gerwig is a bit underused? Random dance scene in the end credits is good. Weirdly high budget I thought.

title: Avatar: The Way of Water
summary: Jake Sully lives with his newfound family formed on the extrasolar moon Pandora. Once a familiar threat returns to finish what was previously started, Jake must work with Neytiri and the army of the Na'vi race to protect their home.
josh_notes: Saw in 4D - was pretty mad. There were bubbles, the seat shook around loads, there was smoke and splashing and rain. All very intense for a 3 hour movie - probably wouldn't go through that again although it was fun. The movie itself was pretty good, some great action scenes and underwater stuff that looked amazing. The rain and smoke for clouds were probably most effective - also the boat scenes where it felt like we were bobbing up and down in our seats. Ended kind of in the exact same way as the first one though I think. Also Spyder is a shitty character and not a great actor.

title: Miller's Crossing
summary: Tom Reagan, an advisor to a Prohibition-era crime boss, tries to keep the peace between warring mobs but gets caught in divided loyalties.
