josh_notes: John Turturro is amazing but overall I didn't find it all that entertaining. Pretty typical Coen Brothers movie with a bunch of interesting characters, but I think it was lacking the humour & intersting plot of say, Fargo. Maybe just not my type of film.

title: The Producers
summary: After putting together another Broadway flop, down-on-his-luck producer Max Bialystock teams up with timid accountant Leo Bloom in a get-rich-quick scheme to put on the world's worst show.
josh_notes: Very funny main song and when they do the show it was great, thought there might have been more to it than that but there wasn't really!

title: Wildlife
summary: A teenage boy must deal with his mother's complicated response after his father temporarily abandons them to take a menial and dangerous job.
josh_notes: Quiet and subtle and very nicely shot. Shares some themes with Aftersun - realising that your parents are flawed and how to navigate that. Doesn’t really have the same emotional impact or warmth though. Carey Mulligan is pretty great although I think her character changes too quickly.

title: Tár
summary: Set in the international world of Western classical music, the film centers on Lydia Tár, widely considered one of the greatest living composer-conductors and the very first female director of a major German orchestra.
josh_notes: Cate Blanchett is incredibly good - can't imagine anyone else in that role really. Definitely some JK Simmons in Whiplash vibes. Really kept me interested throughout, not quite on the edge of my seat but it rolls along at a good pace. Kind of put off by the ending - I get it but it just felt slightly too comical in a jarring way. Overall it was very good though and didn't feel long at all.

title: The Fabelmans
summary: Growing up in post-World War II era Arizona, young Sammy Fabelman aspires to become a filmmaker as he reaches adolescence, but soon discovers a shattering family secret and explores how the power of films can help him see the truth.
josh_notes: Really good, some of it felt so personal in a way that you don't often get from these big films. In particular the scene with his mum tapping on the piano with her big nails, that felt like it must be a really vivid memory. Basically Steven Spielberg shooting his own biopic which is pretty cool. Paul Dano and Michelle Williams both great - mad that Paul Dano hasn't won an oscar at any point he's good in absolutely everything. Really good bit breaking the 4th wall towards the end.

title: Le pupille
summary: Follow the rebellious girls of a Catholic boarding school before Christmas, a time of war and scarcity.
josh_notes: Wish there were more mid length short films like this - I'd be curious to see what other directors could do. This one is nice enough, some similar themes to Happy as Lazarro. Not really enough happening though other than some sweet kids.

title: The Florida Project
summary: Set over one summer, the film follows precocious six-year-old Moonee as she courts mischief and adventure with her ragtag playmates and bonds with her rebellious but caring mother, all while living in the shadows of Walt Disney Wo...
josh_notes: Beautifully shot - super vivid colours which I suppose are also meant to reflect the disneyfied area of Florida that it takes place. Moonie is great, especially that second to last scene where it all gets too much for her and she breaks down to her friend, that felt so real and was extra emotional given how tough and unaffected she had been up until that point. I thought the stylistic clash at the end didn't really work - might have been better on a better quality TV? On mine it just looked like we were suddenly watching a bad YouTube video. Willem Dafoe is great and extremely likable for once.

title: City of God
summary: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.
josh_notes: Super stylish and full of so many stories. Amazing that they manage to cover so many different characters without ever losing the audience. Felt very real. Bené is great, his party was so good that you knew something bad was going to happen. Rocket and L'il Dice also great characters. Favela Goodfellas.

title: Before Sunrise
summary: A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together.
josh_notes: Lives up to it's reputation as being one of the most romantic things ever. Their relationship is somehow so believable despite the fact it takes place over only a few hours, and by the end you are really feeling like they are, hoping you can see them again in 6 months. Basically one long amazing chat.

title: Babylon
summary: A tale of outsized ambition and outrageous excess, it traces the rise and fall of multiple characters during an era of unbridled decadence and depravity in early Hollywood.
josh_notes: Full on chaos in the best way, what a big movie. They really went for it you gotta hand it to them! The party scene at the beginning is so good, the music is noisy and great and Brad Pitt is very funny. He makes a great entrance with his fake italian schtick shot from behind. 2nd best vomit scene of the 2022 Oscar picks. Good poop joke/4th wall break too.

title: Whisper of the Heart
summary: A love story between a girl who loves reading books, and a boy who has previously checked out all of the library books she chooses.
josh_notes: An Only Yesterday type Ghibli film in that it kind of meanders along with some interesting ideas every now and then and then comes to an end. I liked bits of it - the cat and the books and the message about needing to work at your creativity but I didn't love it. It lacked some of the humour and imagination of the better ones. I did like the music though.

title: The Mummy
summary: An ancient Egyptian princess is awakened from her crypt beneath the desert, bringing with her malevolence grown over millennia, and terrors that defy human comprehension.
josh_notes: It's a shame you don't get these fairly big budget adventure movies that often anymore. The Lost City is the only recent example I can think of but that was a fair bit smaller. Pretty fun and Brendan Fraser is good & dashing. A bit long though.

title: Zombieland: Double Tap
summary: Columbus, Tallahassee, Wichita, and Little Rock move to the American heartland as they face off against evolved zombies, fellow survivors, and the growing pains of the snarky makeshift family.
josh_notes: Firstly, it is mad that the original Zombieland came out in 2009, secondly this is pretty funny. Zoey Deutch was annoying at first but by the end she was easily the funniest character. Good stuff, very watchable.

title: Taxi
summary: Banned from making movies by the Iranian government, Jafar Panahi poses as a taxi driver and makes a movie about social challenges in Iran.
josh_notes: This is the first Panahi film I have seen which might be a bit backwards but I liked it. Very witty and smartly constructed, although I liked it more before I realised it was scripted/semi-scripted. Interested to see some of his other stuff. Also Iran is pretty fascinating in general.

title: Alita: Battle Angel
summary: A deactivated cyborg's revived, but can't remember anything of her past and goes on a quest to find out who she is.
josh_notes: Good action sequences, kinda boring in the middle - I'd struggle say what happened in that middle hour, although to be fair to it the storyline was pretty original I guess. Good CGI and the last 20 minutes got pretty compelling and made me want to see a sequel.

title: Prisoners
summary: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.
josh_notes: Reminded me quite a lot of Silence of the Lambs - thrilling throughout, great cinematography and an interesting detective. Some really great scenes - when he's driving Anna to the hospital with all the rain going past, the priest's basement, talking to Paul Dano like it's confession. Also makes you question your own ethics because you do sympathise with Hugh Jackman.

title: Cold War
summary: In the 1950s, a music director falls in love with a singer and tries to persuade her to flee communist Poland for France.
josh_notes: Incredible looking, the black and white cinematography is spectacular and every shot is kind of like an interesting photograph, but I could never really empathise with the main couple. Most of their problems seemed to me to be self made - like why did she leave Paris, and why did he go back to Poland. Maybe it's saying something about how people always think the grass is greener idk. But the acting was great and so was the music. Would have liked to see it in a cinema.

title: Creed
summary: The former World Heavyweight Champion Rocky Balboa serves as a trainer and mentor to Adonis Johnson, the son of his late friend and former rival Apollo Creed.
josh_notes: Must have been pretty daunting coming up with a successor to the Rocky films but they completely nailed it.Good enough story, great fight scene at the end, Sylvester Stallone is really great. What more could you want? (from a successor to Rocky). Also didn't know Ryan Coogler was so young, FP to him.

title: Greener Grass
summary: Suburban soccer moms find themselves constantly competing against each other in their personal lives as their kids settle their differences on the field.
josh_notes: A really mad, very original satire. Really takes the whole suburbia thing to the next level. The side plot with Beck Bennett being obsessed with pool water is a super duper good bit. The way he is constantly walking around with a huge water bottle is very funny. Also the bit with Julian calling his mum a school. Took a while to get into it but after that basically every line was funny in some way. Cool music, v good & strange.

title: Oslo, August 31st
summary: One day in the life of Anders, a young recovering drug addict, who takes a brief leave from his treatment center to interview for a job and catch up with old friends in Oslo.
josh_notes: Very realistic, understated portrayal of addiction and depression. Very similar In lots of ways to The Worst Person in the World, similar shots, similar scenes in some cases but the themes are different. Really well written, it's essentially a bunch of different conversations that Anders is having with people as he tries to connect to someone but (a bit like aftersun) there are just little bits you are left to pick up on to understand his inner thoughts. Kept hoping that he was going to connect with something and find a reason to live but perhaps the ending is more realistic than that.

title: Walkabout
summary: Two city-bred siblings are stranded in the Australian Outback, where they learn to survive with the aid of an Aboriginal boy on his "walkabout": a ritual separation from his tribe.
josh_notes: Maybe the most nature I've seen in a film? Lots of cool cinematography that kind of felt improvised in the same way I would when making a super 8 film (though obviously much more successfully lol). I guess that comes from the handheld cameras. Pretty unique overall.

title: Hard Boiled
summary: A tough-as-nails cop teams up with an undercover agent to shut down a sinister mobster and his crew.
josh_notes: Mad style mad action cop film from Hong Kong. Probably would have enjoyed it more after a few beers. The final fight is really great & it's all super dramatic.

title: As Good as It Gets
summary: A single mother and waitress, a misanthropic author, and a gay artist form an unlikely friendship after the artist is assaulted in a robbery.
josh_notes: Strange to me that this film was so highly rated/reviewed at the time - not nearly as well put together as Broadcast News felt (although still with some unlikeable relationships). Helen Hunt is good but I feel Like Jack Nicholson is just not believably reformed enough for her to be into him. There were bits I liked but I think it has probably aged poorly.

title: Bringing Out the Dead
summary: Haunted by the patients he failed to save, a monumentally burned-out Manhattan ambulance paramedic fights to maintain his sanity over three increasingly turbulent nights.
josh_notes: Really interesting and possibly undersung Martin Scorsese film all about empathy and things. Lots of crazy camerawork - especially when riding in the ambulance - fast motion, sideways shots, shots from the front that were a bit like the shots at the end of Prisoners. Nicolas Cage was great and a little more restrained than usual - I'd like to see what other big directors would do with him like maybe PTA. Especially liked the shot of Ving Rhames looking up at the camera when getting the punks to hold hands and try and revive the singer. Cool soundtrack and use of sound too. Weird that it isn't as well liked as other Scorsese films - maybe paramedics don't seem interesting enough or something?

title: Finding Vivian Maier
summary: A documentary on the late Vivian Maier, a nanny whose previously unknown cache of 100,000 photographs earned her a posthumous reputation as one of the most accomplished street photographers.
josh_notes: Obsessive subject matched perfectly with an obsessive director - what a great coincidence that he should come across such a fascinating story, many other people might have stopped earlier on in the story but he keeps digging. Makes you realise there might be tens of thousands of stories like this out there (but that doesn't make it any less interesting). At first I thought he might have revealed too much of the story too soon but it keeps going, with other layers being peeled back (mental health/hoarding/France etc) as it goes. Amazing pictures too, I particularly love the self portraits in the shiny things and the wonky mirror being carried into a skip. Makes you want to take one million photos.

title: The Muppet Movie
summary: Kermit and his newfound friends trek across America to find success in Hollywood, but a frog legs merchant is after Kermit.
josh_notes: The Muppets really nail funny profound songs don't they. Lots of mad cameos, lots of great songs. Moving right along/ Can you picture that/ the rainbow connection are my favourites. Lots of good silly gags too.

title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie
director: Aaron Horvath, Michael Jelenic, Pierre Leduc
summary: A plumber named Mario travels through an underground labyrinth with his brother Luigi, trying to save a captured princess.
josh_notes: Weirdly lacking in fun/excitement/stuff. Covered all the bases from the games and stuff but not much more than that. Found it hard to stay awake tbh. Also not enough Luigi!

title: Cloverfield
summary: A group of friends venture deep into the streets of New York on a rescue mission during a rampaging monster attack.
josh_notes: Kinda nauseating with how it's shot but pretty imaginative and watchable.

title: 12 Angry Men
summary: The jury in a New York City murder trial is frustrated by a single member whose skeptical caution forces them to more carefully consider the evidence before jumping to a hasty verdict.
josh_notes: A perfect courtroom drama. It's all so well written and acted but it also uses a lot of cool camera angles and things which elevates it even more. Some sick burns too. I liked the impact of the heat too.

title: The Irishman
summary: An illustration of Frank Sheeran's life, from W.W.II veteran to hit-man for the Bufalino crime family and his alleged assassination of his close friend Jimmy Hoffa.
josh_notes: It's long (we did watch it across 3 different viewings), but it's not slow at all. Crime epic in a similar vein to Casino. The de-aging was interesting - didn't really find it off-putting though it was noticeable, potentially just because everyone knows what he looked like at that age anyway. DeNiro was obviously amazing, but not as good as Al Pacino. It was actually a pretty sad story - he works all his life for other bosses, then kills one of his only friends, and by the end, everyone else has died and he's alone with nothing to show for it.

title: The Favourite
summary: In early 18th-century England, the status quo at the court is upset when a new servant arrives and endears herself to a frail Queen Anne.
josh_notes: Less funny than I was expecting, but the characters were really great and ambiguous. I liked the way there was no clear villain/good guy, they were all three complex and flawed but also likeable, which is very hard to do. The cinematography was really interesting with loads and loads of fisheye shots and wide angle stuff. Not sure what the reasoning was but I liked it. It was all very stylish without taking you away from the story.

title: The Hand of God
summary: In 1980s Naples, young Fabietto pursues his love for football as family tragedy strikes, shaping his uncertain but promising future as a filmmaker.
josh_notes: Would love to have seen it in the cinema because the cinematography is beautiful. So many amazing locations too - where the Little Monk is, where he meets Capuano, the island they have the big family dinner on etc. My favourite parts are the slightly magical bits, the monk, the strange locations, the running joke of his sister being in the toilet. Overall I didn't really get into the main character which is what maybe let it down. I think it needed a stronger central performance maybe. I should rewatch The Great Beauty now because I remember that being incredible.

title: Ratatouille
summary: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.
josh_notes: Weirdly I'm not sure I've ever actually watched it from the very beginning as I couldn't remember any of the bits with Remy and his family living out in the French countryside. As much as I enjoyed it I don't think it is as good as Pixar's best work, although the last 20 minutes or so are brilliant. By the way what a hilarious premise. Rat can cook, yeah, and he tells a human how to cook, and also he tells him how to cook by pulling his hair yeah sure why not.

title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
summary: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.
josh_notes: Prety good film to watch on the coronation day I suppose! Not as good as The Life of Brian but it's full of great sketches etc. I always remember the best one being the black knight that gets his arms and legs chopped off but I think I've seen it too many times now. All very nice and silly.

title: Cinema Paradiso
summary: A filmmaker recalls his childhood when falling in love with the pictures at the cinema of his home village and forms a deep friendship with the cinema's projectionist.
josh_notes: Packed full of nostalgia and movie-love, similar in many ways to The Fablemans. Loved the relationship between young toto and Alfredo especially, a powerful example of the impact an adult friend can have on a child, as well as the effect of cinema. Also similar to The Fablemans in the way it felt like it was full of little specific memories - the knitting unravelling as his mum runs to the door, the random things happening in the cinema (at one point a guy gets shot I think?), etc. Didn't make me cry like it did Emma but maybe on a rewatch.

title: Only Lovers Left Alive
summary: A depressed musician reunites with his lover. However, their romance, which has already endured several centuries, is disrupted by the arrival of her uncontrollable younger sister.
josh_notes: Normally vampires are a bit naff but Jim Jarmusch thought what if vampires were the coolest people ever? Tilda Swinton is obviously a good choice to play a slick vampire but I wouldn't have had Tom Hiddlestone down as a rocker. I liked the style and the characters but it just ran out of steam once Eve's sister left, and then nothing much else really happened. Great cast all round though.

title: Big Daddy
summary: A lazy law school graduate adopts a kid to impress his girlfriend, but everything doesn't go as planned and he becomes the unlikely foster father.
josh_notes: If this came out now would it get better reviews? It's not at all believable but it has a lot of heart and Adam Sandler is Adam Sandler. Hard to really evaluate it because I loved it so much growing up haha.

title: Rye Lane
summary: Two youngsters reeling from bad breakups who connect over an eventful day in South-London.
josh_notes: Lots of imaginative choices elevates it from being a pretty classic romcom. Very enjoyable. Low End Theory is thoroughly deserving of it's place as a key part of the plot, about time someone made a movie about that.

title: Run Fatboy Run
summary: Five years after jilting his pregnant fiancée on their wedding day, out-of-shape Dennis decides to run a marathon to win her back.
josh_notes: How did this date so fast! Movies are already so different to this, and people running isn't really funny anymore but there were a few good gross gags and Dylan Moran is always pretty watchable. Must be weird to always be cast as the guy who runs about with a fag in his mouth being a loose cannon.

title: My Cousin Vinny
summary: Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.
josh_notes: Loved this. One of those feel good movies like The Way Way back where it just feels like everything clicks together perfectly. Joe Pesci is perfect, when he gets going at the end it really got me going. Also Marisa Tomei's outfits are amazing and she is great.

title: Punch-Drunk Love
summary: Socially frustrated Barry Egan calls a phone-sex line to curb his loneliness. Little does he know it will land him in deep trouble and will jeopardize his burgeoning romance with the mysterious Lena.
josh_notes: Loved this too! Incredibly creative and quite stress inducing score(and matching ligjhting), offbeat plot, brilliant Adam Sandler performance and a vague sense of magic throughout. That bit when the light comes on in the phone box :O lovely stuff. Also the bit where he is running around the flats trying to find Lena's apartment and then he runs through the door and they kiss - very nice, so smooth. (lots of running in this film)

title: Death Proof
summary: Two separate sets of voluptuous women are stalked at different times by a scarred stuntman who uses his "death proof" cars to execute his murderous plans.
josh_notes: Overall it didn't quite work but it was interesting for the first 20 minutes or so. After that the dialogue got kind of inconsequential and I lost interest a bit. The distressed film and the odd cuts were kind of jarring but I didn't mind them. Memorable ending although I didn't enjoy it as much as I had hoped. I did like the structure though: one story to build the guy up, one to smack him down. Well worth a watch at least.

title: Three Colors: Blue
summary: A woman struggles to find a way to live her life after the death of her husband and child.
josh_notes: It was pretty blue I must say! All kinds of stuff happening in all the shots, really great score and depiction of depression/grief. Very much looking forward to watching the other films in the trilogy

title: White Men Can't Jump
summary: A remake of the 1992 film about a pair of basketball hustlers who team up to earn extra cash.
josh_notes: Kind of like Uncut Gems if Uncut Gems was more lighthearted, made in the 90s and was about basketball. Lots of great trash talking, also maybe the first film to make me think maybe I could like basketball. Weirdly it was actually a bit depressing to see Woody Harrelson keep making the same mistake, fair play to Ron for not letting him win at the end. Good movie.

title: I Love You, Man
summary: Friendless Peter Klaven goes on a series of man-dates to find a Best Man for his wedding. But, when his insta-bond with his new B.F.F. puts a strain on his relationship with his fiancée, can the trio learn to live happily ever after?
josh_notes: This holds up as an extremely nice movie. Jason Segel and Paul Rudd have amazing friend chemistry. I love friends, therefore I love this movie.

title: Hustle
summary: A basketball scout discovers a phenomenal street ball player while in Spain and sees the prospect as his opportunity to get back into the NBA.
josh_notes: If I knew more about basketball I definitely would have liked this more. The main basketball dude was pretty likeable and it was a good enough story, I just probably didn't get all the detail. Lots of cool shots on the court and stuff - maybe too many really - but the director was having fun. Also I love Adam Sandler still. Mad how many pro basketball players were in it - imagine if a similar movie was made about football (other than Goal!)

title: The Darjeeling Limited
summary: A year after their father's funeral, three brothers travel across India by train in an attempt to bond with each other.
josh_notes: Really liked this! The relationship between the three brothers was great and more grounded than some of his more recent films. Pretty simple story about healing and baggage and travelling. For some reason didn't think I'd like this one but I was wrong.

title: The Long Goodbye
summary: Private investigator Philip Marlowe helps a friend out of a jam, but in doing so gets implicated in his wife's murder.
josh_notes: Rarely have I ever seen a cooler dude in a movie. He's as cool as he is scared of the doberman. The murder plot isn't the best but it's so stylish and well paced it doesn't matter. The camerawork is great I love all the slow inquisitive zooms and movement. Also one of the few films that makes me wish I smoked, especially walking around the supermarket striking matches on whatever and picking up catfood with a fag hanging out my mouth. How cool. Also Arnold Schwarzenegger a surprising bonus.

title: Asteroid City
summary: Following a writer on his world famous fictional play about a grieving father who travels with his tech-obsessed family to small rural Asteroid City to compete in a junior stargazing event, only to have his world view disrupted fo...
josh_notes: Went into this with lower expectations given some of the mixed reviews and focus on it's lack of narrative (maybe like the French Dispatch which I didn't love) but to be honest I thought it was ruddy great. Jason Schwarzmann plays a tougher guy than usual and it's his best role in a Wes Anderson film, all the bits between him and Scarlett Johansson are the best bits. Lots of witty lines and funny kids, the alien is great, the set is unbelievably nice and there is a fair amount of stuff happening, as well as all the style. Cast is mad good - Schwarzmann, Johansson, kid from eigth grade, Ed Norton, Friend, Wright, Swinton, Hawke Hanks. I think there was some meaning to the ending with Margot Robbie and stuff but I can't quite decipher it.

title: Fallen Angels
summary: This Hong Kong-set crime drama follows the lives of a hitman, hoping to get out of the business, and his elusive female partner.
josh_notes: As stylish as you would expect with it's pixelated/slowmo/wideangle/closeup/blurs etc etc and has some surprisingly funny side bits with the mute guy when he is 'working' in other people's businesses. I don’t think the story of missed loves quite resonated with me as it might have if my life was in a different place but it was still very much worth watching. Plus I liked the soundtrack (often very western?) and the allusions to Chungking Express.

title: Sicario
summary: An idealistic FBI agent is enlisted by a government task force to aid in the escalating war against drugs at the border area between the U.S. and Mexico.
josh_notes: Not sure why I didn't like this the first time round. At first it seems like a pretty standard Mexico cartel film but really there is a lot more to it and it’s a bit more of a commentary on America's war on drugs I suppose. I think the only thing letting it down was the reason for Emily Blunt's character being there seemed a bit convenient/unexplained. She was very good though and del Toro was amazing. Still not sure it carried quite enough tension as say Prisoners but it was a good watch. Also a nice score and looked great throughout.

title: Gregory's Girl
summary: Gregory is a normal teen who is infatuated with a classmate. He must work to win her affection.
josh_notes: So many similarities to Local Hero in terms of style and score. Really liked it, felt like a great summary of adolescence, particularly with all the little tangents and unexplained side stories (the Penguin, the headmaster playing piano, the pervy teachers). Combined with the final vaguely dreamy sequence in the evening where he has 3 dates it very much resembles what it feels like to look back on teenagehood.It's noticably an extremely friendly film - there is no meanness or enemy at any point, which I think was nice as that's mostly how I remember school. Also had maybe the best haircuts.

title: Assault on Precinct 13
summary: A Highway Patrol Officer, two criminals and a station secretary defend a defunct Los Angeles precinct office against a siege by a bloodthirsty street gang.
josh_notes: Emma really didn't like it and I sort of understand why, the action scenes aren't particularly spectacular and the plot is very simple, but that's kind of why I liked it. I enjoyed the low key energy of the weird gang and the sudden killings of quite a few seemingly important characters (most shocking being the ice cream girl). The score is really really good, a very catchy precursor to the Goldeneye N64 soundtrack and considering this was basically a student film it's pretty amazing. I like the way the gang members are always just running about in a horde, that was a weird and cool choice.

title: Assault on Precinct 13
summary: A Highway Patrol Officer, two criminals and a station secretary defend a defunct Los Angeles precinct office against a siege by a bloodthirsty street gang.
josh_notes: Enjoyed it more than last time - Chris Addison and Gabe (Young Lankenstein) in particular are great.

title: Oppenheimer
summary: The story of American scientist, J. Robert Oppenheimer, and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.
josh_notes: Loved it - so many great performances and an interesting story really well told. Really high paced, never felt it's 3 hour runtime but the script must have been gigantic, it felt like it was non stop dialogue. So good seeing it in IMAX with loads of people as well. I know some people didn't like the bit after the bomb went off and felt it was unnecessary but I would strongly disagree, I loved that bit and that was a bit where I didn't know what was going to happen.

title: Barbie
summary: Barbie suffers a crisis that leads her to question her world and her existence.
josh_notes: So funny and original, who would have thought a movie about Barbie could be so good. Should have know Ryan Gosling would be great (see The Nice Guys & the SNL sketches) but he's gotta be in the race for best supporting actor. He's so good at switching his facial expressions and his song was real good. Might go and see it again. Also had a lovely vietnamese in between the two films.

title: Opening Night
summary: A failed Broadway singer who now works as a production manager must save opening night on his new production by wrangling his eccentric cast and crew.
josh_notes: Perhaps a bit on the long side but a great film to see and discuss afterwards. The lead character is so open to interpretation and discussion and is so complex. Also Gena Rowlands is amazing. The first Cassavetes film we have seen. Kinda like Birdman but witha  different style?

title: The Bling Ring
summary: Inspired by actual events, a group of fame-obsessed teenagers use the internet to track celebrities' whereabouts in order to rob their homes.
josh_notes: Just can't understand why anyone would like this. Nothing really happens despite the interesting premise. They just randomly decide to go into some rich people's houses, do it a bunch, and then it ends? The acting was pretty bad I thought, although they did kind of come across like dim high schoolers I suppose. Also fashion back then was mental.

title: Volver
summary: After her death, a mother returns to her home town in order to fix the situations she couldn't resolve during her life.
josh_notes: Magical realism, Spanish ladies, death. What's not to like? Not as stylish as the other Almodovar film we watched but I think I preferred the story and the characters. It all felt very grounded in the reality of a Spanish village, despite the layer of magic. Side note, this is a great example of why it's total bullshit when people insist on films/plays etc being made by people with lived experience and whatnot.

title: The Muppets
summary: A Muppet fanatic with some help from his 2 human compatriots must regroup the Muppet gang to stop an avaricious oil mogul from taking down one of their precious life-longing treasures.
josh_notes: Some nice songs but not as good as some of the other muppet movies. Jason Segel is good casting but he does a lot of kinda annoying faces in this. Kermit is great though, nice one Kermit.

title: The Lives of Others
summary: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.
josh_notes: Really interesting and seemingly historically accurate film about a time I don't really know much about, and haven't really seen in a film before. It's always scary to think how recently these things went on, it was only like 15 years before the first iPod. Ulrich Muhe is amazing, his transformation is so steady and subtle that you hardly notice it. Very nice ending and actually a pretty nice message overall that people (and things) can change, especially once you've heard the music.

title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
summary: Two drag performers and a transgender woman travel across the desert to perform their unique style of cabaret.
josh_notes: Enjoyed most of it, some unbelievable costumes - how is it that the flip flop dress that Hugo Weaving wears hasn't become a classic halloween/meme outfit?, but the bit with the Fillipino wife was very out of place, and frankly kinda racist? At the very least it was really jarring in a film preaching equality and acceptance. But otherwise it was good.

title: How to Blow Up a Pipeline
summary: A crew of environmental activists plot a daring plan to disrupt an oil pipeline.
josh_notes: Good lil film. Builds the tension really well and is shot nicely. More than the title suggests. Kinda makes you want to blow up a pipeline I gotta say.

title: High School Musical 3: Senior Year
summary: As seniors in high school, Troy and Gabriella struggle with the idea of being separated from one another as college approaches. Along with the rest of the Wildcats, they stage a spring musical to address their experiences, hopes a...
josh_notes: Different times eh? It's alright, pretty boring except when Sharpay is doing stuff. Where did Ashley Tisdale go? Mad how small a budget all the HSM films are.

title: Dave Made a Maze
summary: Dave, an artist who has yet to complete anything significant in his career, builds a fort in his living room out of pure frustration, only to wind up trapped by the fantastical pitfalls, booby traps, and critters of his own creation.
josh_notes: Very unique and full of creativity - the set design is amazing - but it's just a bit boring overall, and Dave is pretty unlikeable.

title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
summary: Moviestar Nick Cage is channeling his iconic characters as he's caught between a superfan and a CIA agent.
josh_notes: Less funny than I anticipated but also a better plot so it kinda balanced out. Nicolas Cage plays it perfectly but would have been good if there were a few more jokes. What an ambitious film to write though, fair play.

title: Last Night in Soho
summary: Aspiring fashion designer Eloise is mysteriously able to enter the 1960s, where she encounters dazzling wannabe singer Sandie. But the glamour is not as it seems, and the dreams of the past crack and splinter into something darker.
josh_notes: Scarier than maybe I thought it would be. Mostly lacking in the style that Edgar Wright's other films have I would say, and not sure a lot of it looked gretty and slimy enough. The cast were all great though and tbh I didn't see the twist coming.

title: An Irish Goodbye
summary: In rural Northern Ireland, a pair of estranged brothers reunite following their mother's untimely death.
josh_notes: Pretty charming short film (oscar winning). Just a nice 20 minutes about two brothers deciding what to do after their mother dies. Nice enough, not groundbreaking.

title: Past Lives
summary: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrested apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Twenty years later, they are reunited for one fateful week as they confront notions of love and destiny.
josh_notes: Mental that this is someone's first film, its all so damn good. Annoyingly I didn't get to get sad because there were people laughing around me which kinda ruined it. Loved how chill the husband was about the whole situation, and actually I felt that was very important - the film wasn't about conflict but more about reflecting on what-ifs and the fact that we are surrounded by them in modern life (I thought). And how sad it sometimes is to realise you don't have unlimited choices.

title: 9 to 5
summary: Three female employees of a sexist, egotistical, lying, hypocritical bigot find a way to turn the tables on him.
josh_notes: Enjoyed this way more than I expected (I thought it would be a musical). The story is actually pretty wild and the whole thing is pretty ahead of it's time. Everyone's great, fun stuff. Nice Dolly Parton score.

title: The Killing
summary: Crook Johnny Clay assembles a five-man team to plan and execute a daring racetrack robbery.
josh_notes: Didn’t really get into this but it was okay! Classic moody lighting.

title: Rebels of the Neon God
summary: Within the urban gloom of Taipei, four youths face alienation, loneliness, and moments of existential crisis amidst a series of minor crimes.
josh_notes: Despite having one of the coolest names of any films, I wasn't fully on board with this. I liked it but I felt like for a coming-of-age film, the characters didn't really progress much? It was hard to read any of their motives for their behaviour. Maybe that was the point though who knows! Really cool Goldeneye-esque score though.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
summary: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.
josh_notes: One of the best ones probs init! Some cool lighting and effects when all the werewolf stuff is happening. They got some good directors to do the HPs didn’t they.

title: Mrs. Doubtfire
summary: After a bitter divorce, an actor disguises himself as a female housekeeper to spend time with his children held in custody by his former wife.
josh_notes: Has probably aged better than I thought it would have, although I can only think of Tobias being Mrs Featherbottom anytime he is dressed up. Still fun though.

title: Tokyo Story
summary: An old couple visit their children and grandchildren in the city, but receive little attention.
josh_notes: Extremely neat! Maybe a bit too neat for me but was still fascinating seeing a film from way back then that seemingly captures that exact moment in Japanese history. Glad that Shige got some kinda comeuppance! Loved the shots of the houses with loads of depth.

title: The Wonderful Story of Henry Sugar
summary: Chronicles a variety of stories, but the main one follows Henry Sugar, who is able to see through objects and predict the future with the help of a book he stole.
josh_notes: Couldn't really make this story any better could you? His style suits Roald Dahl so well it's silly. This goes an extra step though, really feels like you're being read to rather than watfching something actually take place because of all the moving sets and things. Genius.

title: Aguirre, the Wrath of God
summary: In the 16th century, the ruthless and insane Don Lope de Aguirre leads a Spanish expedition in search of El Dorado.
josh_notes: Told with a very straight face, but a very dark story of greed and power, and also how silly colonialists often were. When they're just sailing down the river proclaiming it is theirs because they sailed there in particular. Didn't blow my mind but was pretty effective and Klaus Kinski is great and has a mad face.

title: The Rat Catcher
summary: In an English village, a reporter and a mechanic listen to a rat catcher explain his clever plan to outwit his prey.
josh_notes: Pretty gruesome story, I guess Roald Dahl was really leaning into that at this stage.Was great though! More Richard Ayoade in stuff

title: Do Not Expect Too Much of the End of the World
summary: An overworked and underpaid production assistant has to shoot a workplace safety video commissioned by a multinational company. But an interviewee makes a statement that forces him to re-invent his story to suit the company's narr...
josh_notes: So chaotic and full of ideas. They don't all land but I felt (and Tom and Luiza confirmed) like I really got an insight into modern Romania. Loved the black and white cinematography, especially the shots in the car with the reflections off the dress. In hindsight enjoyed the ridiculously long silent scene for it's awkwardness in the cinema. Also liked the final long scene which felt so real, despite sitting there almost wanting it to end. Pretty wild overall.

title: Hit Man
summary: A professor moonlighting as a hit man of sorts for his city police department, descends into dangerous, dubious territory when he finds himself attracted to a woman who enlists his services.
josh_notes: A pretty good time all round, Richard Linklater can't make a feel bad film. I imagine this will be a hit on Netflix.

title: The Hypnosis
summary: A hypnotherapist sees Vera throw off the trappings of civilized behaviour. For a event She attends with André, Vera's behaviour holds a mirror up to the faux-authenticity, virtue signalling and hypocrisy of her fellow entrepreneurs.
josh_notes: Maybe my favourite of the festival. I just like the slightly weird scandi vibes you get sometimes from these films. Deadpan and smart, has a little bit of Force Majeure about it. Great peeing on a wifi router scene that we can all relate to.

title: Fallen Leaves
summary: In modern-day Helsinki, two lonely souls in search of love meet by chance in a karaoke bar. However, their path to happiness is beset by obstacles - from lost phone numbers to mistaken addresses, alcoholism, and a charming stray dog.
josh_notes: How deadpan can you make a movie and still have it be sweet?

title: Haar
summary: Jef, a 32 year old Unit Production Manager, has given a decade of her young life to the film industry when devastating events force her to confront her past and reevaluate her future. HAAR is a thoughtful and emotional drama that ...
josh_notes: So cool to see a feature film made on Super8, and extra cool for the director to bring the actual camera he used to show everyone at the screening. The film lacked a little bit - I didn't think the lead performance was all that good, and some of the final scenes were a bit heavy handed but you could see how excited the director was to have his film screening and stuff, so that was pretty great.

title: Ferrari
summary: Set in the summer of 1957, with Enzo Ferrari's auto empire in crisis, the ex-racer turned entrepreneur pushes himself and his drivers to the edge as they launch into the Mille Miglia, a treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy.
josh_notes: The gasp from a packed royal festival hall when that Ferrari crashes was well worth the rest of the film (which was a little bit dull tbh). Adam Driver is great though of course.

title: The Quick and the Dead
summary: A female gunfighter returns to a frontier town where a dueling tournament is being held, which she enters in an effort to avenge her father's death.
josh_notes: When she shoots Gene Hackman through the eye and he does a backflip, that is cool. Also though it had loads of cool dolly zooms, a crazy good cast and a great score so I'm surprised people didn't like it at the time. The story was a little bit dull/repetitive but I think the cool outweighs that.

title: Before Sunset
summary: Nine years after Jesse and Celine first met, they encounter each other again on the French leg of Jesse's book tour.
josh_notes: The dialogue is so natural and romantic, the relationship is so believable and it just captures everything that so many other films try to. Hard to put my finger on what that is but I felt like everyone could relate to it. May be torturous to watch if you were in a place where you felt you had missed a chance like that (though it would still be fucking great) but thankfully I am not.

title: Strange Way of Life
summary: After twenty-five years Silva rides a horse across the desert to visit his friend Sheriff Jake. They celebrate the meeting, but the next morning Jake tells him that reason for his trip is not to go down the memory lane of their fr...
josh_notes: It was alright I guess. Pedro Pascal hangs butt in it if that's what you're after.

title: Dragon Inn
summary: When the children of an executed General are pursued in 1457 China, some heroic martial arts swordsmen intervene.
josh_notes: Pretty awesome, also looks amazing (I think maybe I saw a remaster?). Really well designed setting with most of the goings on in an Inn in the middle of a valley in a Chinese desert. Loved that bit when he fires the arrow out of the flask back through the window - real noice. Didn't enjoy it so much when they left the Inn (other than the final battle), perhaps one battle too many. A must watch if you're into this kinda thing.

title: Goodbye, Dragon Inn
summary: On a dark, wet night a historic and regal Chinese cinema sees its final film. Together with a small handful of souls they bid "Goodbye, Dragon Inn".
josh_notes: I feel like I'm missing something with all the writing about how great this film is. Maybe the pacing was just too slow for me but I don't really see how it is a love letter to cinema or anything like that. If anything it was like a "goodbye, cinema is over, oh well" sort of vibe. I think I tried hard enough but none of it really resonated with me and it was hard to be invested in any of it. I liked 3 things - it kind of captured the communal loneliness of the cinema, the old dudes from Dragon Inn watching themselves and discussing the fact no one remembers them any more (great and sad), and the urinal scene that takes forever but was pretty funny.

title: Yi Yi
summary: Each member of a middle-class Taipei family seeks to reconcile past and present relationships within their daily lives.
josh_notes: When watching it this time I started thinking what my favourit bits were but it just ends up being a list of every scene. I can't put my finger on why it is but he manages to make you feel like you are every single character. I am a kid wanting to take pictures of the mosquitos to show his mum, I am a teenage girl jealous of her grown up neighbour, I am a Taiwanese business man in a meeting with a fascinating Japanese dude trying not to sell out, I am a lady worried she's not done enough with her life, I am a kid that brought in a balloon to school and got told off because they thought it was a condom, etc etc etc. Man it's good.

title: Bottoms
summary: Two unpopular queer high-school students start a fight club to have sex before graduation.
josh_notes: Thoroughly enjoyed how surreal it ended up getting. Some of the story didn't quite justify itself, like the speech that she makes about fighting in juvie just wasn't that impressive and I found everyone's reaction weird. That being said the fight scene at the end was great and more comedy films should lean into that kind of nonsense.

title: In Bruges
summary: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.
josh_notes: Enjoyed this more than I did the first time I watched it. Colin Farrell is so good at this character that he's basically playing in Banshees of Inisherin. Good film to watch before going to Bruges, they really do get around.

title: Dream Scenario
summary: A hapless family man finds his life turned upside down when millions of strangers suddenly start seeing him in their dreams. When his nighttime appearances take a nightmarish turn, Paul is forced to navigate his newfound stardom.
josh_notes: Such a great premise and pretty well executed. Nicolas Cage with his little tiny flashes of weirdness was perfect.

title: Killers of the Flower Moon
summary: When oil is discovered in 1920s Oklahoma under Osage Nation land, the Osage people are murdered one by one - until the FBI steps in to unravel the mystery.
josh_notes: Pretty much flew by, was almost surprised when it was coming to an end. Lilly Gladstone is pretty amazing in this and tbh everyone was completely convincing. I liked the way that as the story goes on you just steadily hate those guys more and more.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Secrets of Dead Man's Chest
summary: A making-of documentary for the movie Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest.
josh_notes: Just good fun isnt it. Amazing music, classic adventure stuff, great combination of characters.

title: The Killer
summary: After a fateful near-miss, an assassin battles his employers, and himself, on an international manhunt he insists isn't personal.
josh_notes: I don't understand why some people really didn't like it. But I also don't get why some people loved it. Never really got exciting, other than the fight with the Florida Man, and there was never much tension, or really any stakes.

title: May December
summary: Twenty years after their notorious tabloid romance gripped the nation, a married couple buckles under pressure when an actress arrives to do research for a film about their past.
josh_notes: I was well into this. All 3 main performances were top, must be in the running for oscars. Really multi-layered and full of gossip. Also loved the score it was both funny and tense. Also kinda soapy. The hot dog line at the beginning was classic.
